story:
Updates** 

JUNE 29/2016 Alright we've received all the printed comics (they're so beautiful! -single tear-) and are prepping for our COMIC LAUNCH on JULY 3RD at Fools and Horses Cafe in Winnipeg, Canada. :) Even if you can't make it, that's the day we're mailing out physical copies to those who purchased!



MAY 12/2016 WE ARE SENDING THINGS OFF TO BE PRINTED TODAY! THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR YOUR PATIENCE!
Since we may not see the physical copies for a month or so, we're sending out .cbr and .pdf files of the comic to everyone who has purchased a copy. :)

Apr10/2016 Had some fun at the Winnipeg Pop Expo, meeting other artists/writers and spreading the word about Anne Frank n' Stein!

Mar23/2016 Cover Image Complete!

Mar20/2016 50% Everyone! There's some Stein in the gallery. :)

Mar12/2016 We've suddenly bumped up to 42% Funding! Thanks so much to everyone who ordered a Dota2-Secret Perk ;P Let's get to 50% funding at which point we'll be releasing:.... CONCEPT ART FOR STEIN!

Mar9/2016 SHARING CONTEST IS UP ON FACEBOOK!! 

Points list here: https://www.facebook.com/AnneFranknStein

Mar8/2016-- Lots of new pages today! Let's reach 33% So we can start the Sharing Contest!

Mar6/2016-- Four new Preview Pages added to the Gallery! - Almost 30% Funded! Let's keep it going!

 Feb25/2016-- Two Preview Pages added to the Gallery

What is this?

Anne Frank n' Stein is the story never written in the diary, presented as a 5-issue comic series.

Prepare for a shocking ride as Anne proves herself more resourceful than the Nazis anticipated when they raid her secret attic. With the help of a monster created out of corpses and science she escapes to rescue her family which has been taken by the Third Reich.

However, the Nazis have secret experimental science of their own. Will Anne literally raise all Hell in return for her family's safety?

This comic project started out as a ballsy idea and a labor of love, but quickly turned into something much, much bigger. With a daring narrative written by Ezra Nickel and colorful art by Rifka Kremer, Anne Frank n' Stein is a story you need to read to believe.

Where is the money going?

The best part is, the first issue already exists!

  • All funding for the initial goal of $3000 will be going into publishing paper copies of Anne Frank n' Stein which can be ordered and shipped to you in addition to being sold at our local Comic Convention in Winnipeg, Canada.
  • We are taking NO PROFIT from the first issue, only trying to get this story out to the world.
  • We've  COMMITTED to this series now that we've reached 60% and ARE MOVING FORWARD WITH ISSUES #2-#5!


but WHY?

We realize that the nature of our subject material is shocking. However, having each read the Diary of Anne Frank, it is clear that she was a young woman with an incredibly tenacious spirit and hope in the face of adversity.

  • Our story takes events and individuals from the WWII era and injects them with the fantastical. We try to channel Anne's unbreakable spirit and explore what choices she might make given a completely different set of resources... and access to dark science.


So what's the Risk?

Our venture comes at incredibly low risk to you, the Supporter.

  • The first issue is practically ready to go and the four other issues are outlined in detail.
  • The Publishing and shipping process can begin as soon the campaign ends, given that the perks will be received whether or not we meet our goal full goal (We've done well enough to reward our backers).
  • If our goal is achieved, however, you can expect new issues to become available on a tri-monthly basis! So, if we complete our crowd-funding by the middle of April, you can expect Issue #2 by mid-August!


Tell your friends!

Whether or not you decide to contribute, let your friends know about us. Who knows? Maybe their support will help us reach our goal and you can snag your copy once we've got a few more issues out?

  • Like us on our Facebook Campaign Page: https://www.facebook.com/AnneFranknStein/
  • Also, feel free to tweet your hearts out and follow our Twitter Account: https://twitter.com/AnneFranknStein

Thanks for reading!

story:
Short Summary

I am Roderic Rodriguez a comic book artist based in Tacloban City, Philippines.

Am one of the survivor from Tacloban City when HAIYAN "Yolanda" most destructive super typhoon landfall in Tacloban City. I survived with my family by climbing the roof from storm surge.

I have nothing to start, my only source of income is the job as comic artist. Now that my  tools were wash out (PC and Wacom tablet), the house, power line, internet connection and phone that I used to communicate to deal with my clients as in everything's gone am totally broke.

This campaign is important for me, to start all over again but without my tools I can't do anything.

Please help me to achieve my goal, in return a comic book of my true to life story and a collection of life experiences before and after HAIYAN's WRATH will be yours digitally.


What We Need & What You Get

I need $1800 to buy new unit and tools to continue my work and start all over again.

HAIYAN'S WRATH is about my true to life story on how my family and me survived from super typhoon "Yolanda", a collection of life experiences of other survivors.

For those who pledge you'll get a digital copy of this book when it's done.

The Impact

This project is from the creator itself a true life experience from devastating typhoon.

I have 10 years experience in comics; you can visit and preview my sample works at http://roderic-rodriguez.deviantart.com

I am one of the survivor.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge please help me to spread this campaign.

Thank you.

story:
***Update - please note shipments may be delayed due to Corona Virus mandates ***

 

BONUS!!!:  ALL VOLUME 1 BOOKS ORDERED TODAY ARE NOW PERSONALLY SIGNED BY ARTIST, DENNIS CACO (VIA BOOKPLATE)!

-----

MAX BOOST IS THE ORIGINAL IMPORT TUNER COMIC est. 1998 in IMPORT TUNER MAGAZINE! 

For the FIRST TIME EVER, the early classic issues are available in a Max Boost, Volume 1 Collectors FIRST EDITION!

HARDBOUND, with BOOK SLEEVE, and DUST COVER. 150 PREMIUM PAGES of the most COLLECTIBLE, and RARE Max Boost Comic Collectible, EVER!

 

 

MAX BOOST - CELEBRATING OUR 20 YEAR ANNIVERSARY!

My name is Dennis Caco and I am passionate about cars, racing, and making comic books and in 1998 I helped design Import Tuner Magazine, and combined my love for cars and comics to create Max Boost which was a monthly feature in the magazine.

Yes, Max Boost is now 20 YEARS OLD and was born during the heyday of import culture Supras, Rx7s, GTOs, GTRs NSXs - waaaayyyy before Fast and The Furious!

So, after we launched Import Tuner, we realized that Max Boost was a ABSOLUTE HIT with the readers, and MANY people subscribed to the magazine because of Max Boost.  And over the years, the magazine grew, and the Max Boost Fanbase grew with it.

Additionally, the entire Import Tuner Culture started to become something.  When I became a tuner in the early 90's, NO ONE believed that this culture would last and they thought that it was a fad.

 

 

Now, 20 years later, the culture has established itself and is as vibrant as ever.  Which is why I decided it was time to bring back Max Boost for the original generation of readers, as well as new fans alike.

So - for the first time ever, ONLY here on Indiegogo, the long lost issues of Max Boost have been put into a collectible volume, plus new artwork, over 150 PAGES (first 4 years),  so you don't have to spend $1000 on eBay to find all the old issues of Import Tuner - which is basically impossible - just to read it.

So I would hope that you would take a look, and "back this project", and help us make this Max Boost, Volume 1 a reality!  

If you are new to Max Boost, WELCOME!  And please watch the video above and keep reading below!

Max Boost on the cover of Import Tuner for the first time ever.

Max Boost is a story about Max and Otto, and their adventures in Motorville as Max, a hyperactive boy that dreams of horsepower and fast cars, and Otto, his trusty sidekick and voice of reason, are best friends.

They love cars and racing, and hope to have a racecar of their own one day so they can challenge the town bully, Todd, to a race to put him in his place.

Since his birthday is coming, Max THINKS his Mom is going to get him his dream car - an Integra Type-R, so he can finally beat Todd's V8 in a race - but Instead...

....his mom gets him a base model Civic Hatchback. No air conditioning, no electric windows or seats, and most importantly - no horsepower. 

And it's even GREEN.  (Oh no!)

But, there is not turning back for Max, as the race is still on.

Everyone at Motorville High School will be watching - and Max can't back out now.  He's hoping for a miracle.

And, for the first time ever, he meets Todd at the local street races, ready or not.

Well, Max is definitely "NOT".

And so begins, Max's quest to keep himself from embarrassment, and for horsepower leads him to tuner culture and fast and furious hi-jinx.

 
            ...Meanwhile a bigger threat to ALL of Motorville looms overhead, and Motorville's existence is in question.

And from there, close to 200 total pages of Max Boost have been published to date about the misadventures begins - from tuning upgrades, to police, drag racing, drifting, burnouts and togue the story takes many twists and turns.  

There is fun around every corner!

Max Boost Volume 1 has 100 Pages of the original comic, plus 50 pages of extras and never before seen art and is only available here on Indiegogo for you to enjoy.  And exclusively for this launch campaign, you can get add-ons and never before seen extras (see below)!

WELCOME TO MOTORVILLE!

Max Boost - He is the underdog, and our unlikely hero.  Max is absolutely passionate about cars and racing, and will do anything it takes to find, build, and race the car of his dreams.  His number one enemy is Todd, and he is committed to bringing street-justice to Motorville by having Todd pay for all of the horrible things he does to those who have less horsepower than him.  

And, as the story develops, we find out what roles these characters play, as the very existence of Motorville may actually depend on this young group of street-rascals...


 

Otto - is Max's best friend and voice of reason.  Otto is basically the opposite of Max, as he is calm, collected, and is always thinking wisely.  However, he also knows it's almost impossible to stop Max when he has a "great idea", and knows it's better just get out of his way (and sometimes more entertaining!).  As a master tactician, Otto, has the skill of gently guiding Max along so he doesn't hurt himself... too much. 

Todd -  Big V8, BIG Pistons, and even BIGGER EGO.  Todd is the town jock that you love to hate, and he makes it a "sport" to harass Max and Otto, and anyone else under 500 horsepower.  Maybe one day, Max and Otto will be able to teach him a lesson in humility, but they will need to find some horsepower and torque first!


 

Papa Wheely and his henchmen, Yin, Yan and Wok - He has the Horsepower and Torque!  Papa Wheely is the Proprietor of Papa Wheely's Performance Pagoda.  He's the one to see if you want you tuner car, tuned - but for a PRICE!

AND, if you don't make your payments on time, you may end up meeting the his "Wu Tang Wack!"

Ese and 'Efe - The leaders of the Low Rider crew from Low Co., Ese and Efe' patrol the streets of Lotting Park - with 3 wheel motion, on chrome & white walls.  Don't get caught by them at the wrong time, in the wrong place, or you might find yourself getting "hit by switches".
 

And, that's not all, there are many, many more characters in Max Boost for you to meet!

 PLAY

WIth ~150 pages, the First 4 years of comics (1998-2002 for Volume 1) plus never-before-seen art in a gorgeous, collectible hardcover, exclusively only for pre-order here: 

BEAUTIFUL, HEAVY WEIGHT, PREMIUM hard bound book

Print size is just like original with heavy 150g Paper

Glossy Printed Dust cover!

and Heavy Weight Collectors Sleeve! (I plan on creating a more sophisticated design for this that I can get your input on, throughout the process!)

Numbered Special edition* - only available here and may never be offered again!

BONUS ITEMS & EXTRAS - "Boost" your Pre-Order! 

For a LIMITED limited time, you will have access to items only available here, and may NEVER be available any other time:

Indiegogo Exclusive 8 x 10 Collectible Frame-able Prints


Indiegogo Exclusive Collectible Metal Enamel Lapel Pins - FIRST EDITION

Max Boost Car Decal, Vinyl Transfer, perfect for your ride!

Max Boost Key Chain! Perfect for Power Wheels and Ferrari Keys alike!

 

For the first time in YEARS - you will have access to The Last Race Movie (Produced by Max Boost Creator, Dennis Caco and directed by Alex Ranarivelo) Digital Access for those who get a Max Boost, Volume 1!

INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE - THE AUTOMOTIVE ART OF AUTOCANNON

Many of you may have remembered my clothing brand Autocannon / Shift Gear, and have probably worn or bought one of my t-shirts in the past (especially if you are a O.G. tuner from the 90's).  Establishing one of the first clothing brands in the industry, our car designs and art became a huge part of our culture.

And, I thought it would be fun to add a little "something something" to this campaign with this art book to spark up some more nostalgia!

So, for First time EVER - we are offering a special "gallery preview book" of selected original Autocannon automotive and apparel designs, as well as more Max Boost coloring book pages!

This bonus special feature is only going to be available here, and we do NOT plan to have this  book availble after this campaign is over.  So if you want it, you have to get it here with Max Boost Volume 1!  We HIGHLY suggest it!

If you want it, please pick the reward teir that includes this book!

We promise, it will be awesome:

Select 90's and 2000's infamous Autocannon Artwork and T-shirt Designs

Max Boost Coloring Pages (that are not available in Volume 1)

40-60 colorful premium pages (Depends on how many are ordered, more orders = more pages!)

Limited Edition

Prototype Shown*

 

Whew.  Okay, that's a lot of SWAG for a Indiegogo... and I'm not even done!

- PLEDGE YOUR ALLEGIANCE TO TUNER COMICS!-

ALL COMIC BOOK BACKERS - To show my appreciation for backers like you, ALL BACKERS will have the option to have your name listed in the Book (you can choose any name you wish to display, within guidelines)

SUPER BACKER LEVEL, $199+ - And for certain higher pledge levels (see rewards), you can have your own “Instagram squares” in a special Super Fan Section.  You can also add your Instagram Profile name, for example. *Submissions must be made before Nov 10 2019 to make it to FIRST printing of the book.  Any submissions received after this date will be in a future printing.

SPONSOR LEVEL: Even sponsors and teams can get into the action by pledging for the Sponsor level tier!* (May not always be available)  *Submissions must be made before Nov 10 2019 to make it to FIRST printing of the book.  Any submissions received after this date will be in a future printing.

THANK GOD FOR THE FANS AND FRIENDS! -

Despite that all those years I was in hibernation, I received a lot of love.  One of my greatest joys is meeting Max Boost Fans in real life, and / or getting Fan messages.

In particular, I love getting  messages from those who were too young to drive when they first read Max Boost and now have tuner cars of their own. These stories kept reminding me that I should never have stopped drawing Max Boost- and if Max Boost, Volume 1 is successful -  I can bring Max Boost back for the next generation of tuner fans!

 

Even though I took a mental break for 10 years, inspiration came in an unlikely event.  My younger brother (he's 18 years younger than me) got into the tuner scene (on his own, I had no influnce I swear!) and eventually asked me to bring him to the racetrack for the first time. 

And little did he know, combined with support from one of our original Max Boost + Autocannon crew Memo Quibrera, and jumping into Sam Rothschilds Honda Challenge Series championship winning CRX racecar for the first time in YEARS - they reignited my need for speed, and my itch to bring Max Boost back!

 

- WHY I AM ON INDIEGOGO -

 

So why am I on Indiegogo?

I put over a decade of my life and sweat into Max Boost.  I invested everything I could to continue to make Max Boost for the people, and pursued the dream furiously.

8 years into it, in 2006, Everything was going perfect and Max Boost was on a roll.  We got some serious momentum when we partnered with Playmates Toys (the Ninja Turtle Company) to make Max Boost Toys and we were even on our way to landing video games, and a deal for Saturday Morning Cartoons with Warner Bros.

 

 

And then suddenly, the WB contract was cancelled -I hit rock bottom [Lost almost everything, and stopped drawing Max Boost to take a mental break.  I was devastated, as everything seemed to have fallen apart, and the hard work from so many was not actualized.

And, well, my “short" mental break ended up being more than 10 years.

 

 

I never stopped believing in Max Boost.  I never stopped loving cars, comics, and this culture.

So I'm here, to put the control back in my hands - and build a MAX BOOST TEAM with YOU (yes YOU) - to launch more products that YOU WANT TO SEE without needing the studios or big names.  I realized with the power of community, we can actually do this independently.

So Max Boost Volume 1 is the FIRST step of MANY.  So, if this campaign is successful, it will allow us to continue with our NEXT STEPS:

Max Boost Volume 2

Animation

Toys

Netflix Show? :)

AND MORE.... 

Like my own life, Max Boost is a true Underdog story, where you're put up against all odds and still have to find a way to succeed.  Max Boost was simply a dream, and though hard work, long nights sleeping under drawing tables, and being a starving artist (literally), I was able to create something that fans worldwide loved.

Max Boost is perfect for all gear heads, tuners, and comicbook fans looking for something that has deep roots and history in the Car Culture Or anyone who just love anime, cars, hispeed hijinx, and a good ol' underdog story about a little hatch back “that could".

Unfortunately, this Max Boost, Volume 1 that I am holding in the video is just a prototype (1 of 1), and need Pre-Orders here on Indiegogo to hit our printers minimums.   We have a limited time to gather orders, and to make the revival with Max Boost Volume 1,  a reality!

So this is where YOU come in...Max Boost is ONLY available here, at a discount, with Bonuses in hopes you will become part of the Max Boost Fam reserve your very own limited first edition copies, today,

Simply click below to "Back this Project" to keep this dream alive!

Please pledge today, share with your friends, and become part of Team Max Boost!

Drive Fast. Race Hard.

Dennis Caco & Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabelinskiy, Dan Wilson, and the Max Boost Crew

 

Perfect for your friends, bookshelf, coffee table, shop, or "riding shotgun" in your car!

 

A design I did for Nestor Cabrera and K&N for their project car. Eventually I ended up becoming a driver for the K&N Mitsubishi Evo Time Attack car for Super Lap Battle.

 

 

@AndresTheCarKid holding up a Falken Tires + Max Boost Collab Coloring Book given away FREE at Formula Drift Long Beach

 

Diane's @FK8Di Civic Type-R - The first one I ever drove, and fell in love with immediately. We took it to the racetrack while it was only a few months old and it blew my mind. Diane was originally in the market for a Lexus, and at the San Diego Auto Convention, I "convinced" her to take a look a the Honda's... and well, the rest is history. She said this is the best car (and the most fun) she has ever owned.

Justing and Jeff from Cartune Auto Repair. We're here track driving at Willow Springs raceway during an VTEC Club Event with Xtreme Speed.

 

 

My partner at Autocannon, Ian Penaflorida and his full race S13 reppin' Team SGR and Max BOOOOOOOOST! Here it is at California Autoclub Speedway!

You would have to buy a LOT of Import Tuners to get all the issues in Max Boost, Volume 1 - collectors edition! Luckily, for the first time ever, you can get the first early issues in the most convenient way possible!

 

 

 

I could NOT have done this without so many people through the last 20 years and need to say THANK YOU!  (I am SURE I am forgetting a bunch of people, so please bear with me as I edit this from time to time)

Of course, I need to start with my original "Racerette" and my wife Rachelle, and my son, Drake "Max" Caco, (yes his name is Max!),  and my very patient Mom, Dad my brothers Allan and Eric, and my super-sister Joann and her family.

And of course, this would have never have happened without Aldryn Estacio and Collier Mclennan (Online Performance) convincing me to be the first DRAG GEN II Turbo Kit car for Herman Chan, and subsequently meeting Michael Ferrara from Turbo Magazine (now publisher of DSPORT), to shoot my Black Turbo Intergra GS-R (RIP) for a feature back in 1995.

From there I met published Kipp Kington (RIP) and the team at IGC - Ed Eng, Evan Griffey, and that crew that invited me to help them design a brand new magazine from scratch, which eventally became Import Tuner.  (I designed the original logo, cover concepts, and helped create the theme for Import Tuner- the public actually doesn't know this, well, I guess until now. :).  Those were good 'ol days!

So that's the beginning ... 

And since then I have met (and need to thank) so many friends:

Memo Quibrera, Allan Deguzman, and Sam Rotschild for inspiring me to get back to the racetrack and bring Max Boost back to life.  

My studio and comic peeps:

Nghia, Derek, Clydene, Batton Lash, Joe Philips, Lex Wolfcraft, Chris Neuhahn

Co-Workers and Friends; Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabeliskiy, April Estrada  Rich Langi, Carter Jung, Rick, Andres the Car Kid, Wes Walz,

Artists and assistant artists:

Rich, Eddie, Ray, Melissa, Derek, Conrad, Trace

My OG race team:

Sam Rothschild, Dan Wilson, Lee Lim, Ian Penaflorida and Family, Gabe, Tim

Ground Zero Racing and Online Performance, Eddie from Dynamic Autosport and Ha (RIP) from Pann Autosport for being my very first retail customers in the mid 90's

Influencers & social partners:

IG: @mistergsx (www.youtube.com/mistermemo) @the_house_of_honda, @State_of_evolution, @sorenswift, @misterGSX, @ifestcivic, @craiglieberman_42

Sponsors & Industry:

Nick Fousekis, Rich Langi, and the crew at Falken Tire, Import Fest Basit Mirza, Wes Walz at Elite Finish, CarTune Auto Repair, Edward Lee Titan 7, Philip Chase, Kenji, Mike and the crew at Greddy, Volk, Tein,  Eibach, Eddie Kim Dynamic Autosport, Pann Auto, Rick from Legacy Auto Spa, Emil and Ed and the gang at Extreme Autofest, Jim Liaw and the team at Formula D, Robert at Comickaze in San Diego,  Rich Calbay and Harry Kong (who was actually one of the first to bring Max Boost back about 4 years ago) from Nitto Tire, Thomas Okihisa and Toyo Tires, Note from Treefrog USA, Ryan and the Honda Challenge crew from NASA ProRacing...

Bruce and the team at Honda for believing in the Power of Dreams (like mine!)

The Last Race Team:

Alex Ranarivelo (Director) and Our Crew, and all the extras that stayed for 7 hours to shoot our racing scenes!

And of course YOU and all of our hardcore Max Boost fans!

~ And I am sure I forgot some people, so I'll be adding more as I remember! :)

THANK YOU ALL!  LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

-Dennis and the Max Boost Crew

_____________________________________________________________

*all descriptions and products are subject to change in final production.  All products are prototypes and may change.  All prices are subject to change at anytime.

* Exclusives may be exclusive to this Indiegogo Campaign and any other platform we may continue this campaign on

*Stretch goals- each of these features are added when we hit certain pledge goals, see below for more details.

_____________________________________________________________

All Rights Reserved.  Titan 7 is ™ and © 2017 Titan 7 Wheels. All rights reserved. Eibach® is Copyright © 2019 Eibach. All Rights Reserved. The Fast and The Furious Copyright: Universal Pictures 2001.  Love Don't Cost a Thing TM & © 2019 Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. All rights reserved.
story_txt: ***Update - please note shipments may be delayed due to Corona Virus mandates *** BONUS!!!:  ALL VOLUME 1 BOOKS ORDERED TODAY ARE NOW PERSONALLY SIGNED BY ARTIST, DENNIS CACO (VIA BOOKPLATE)!-----MAX BOOST IS THE ORIGINAL IMPORT TUNER COMIC est. 1998 in IMPORT TUNER MAGAZINE! For the FIRST TIME EVER, the early classic issues are available in a Max Boost, Volume 1 Collectors FIRST EDITION!HARDBOUND, with BOOK SLEEVE, and DUST COVER. 150 PREMIUM PAGES of the most COLLECTIBLE, and RARE Max Boost Comic Collectible, EVER!  MAX BOOST - CELEBRATING OUR 20 YEAR ANNIVERSARY!My name is Dennis Caco and I am passionate about cars, racing, and making comic books and in 1998 I helped design Import Tuner Magazine, and combined my love for cars and comics to create Max Boost which was a monthly feature in the magazine.Yes, Max Boost is now 20 YEARS OLD and was born during the heyday of import culture Supras, Rx7s, GTOs, GTRs NSXs - waaaayyyy before Fast and The Furious!So, after we launched Import Tuner, we realized that Max Boost was a ABSOLUTE HIT with the readers, and MANY people subscribed to the magazine because of Max Boost.  And over the years, the magazine grew, and the Max Boost Fanbase grew with it.Additionally, the entire Import Tuner Culture started to become something.  When I became a tuner in the early 90's, NO ONE believed that this culture would last and they thought that it was a fad.  Now, 20 years later, the culture has established itself and is as vibrant as ever.  Which is why I decided it was time to bring back Max Boost for the original generation of readers, as well as new fans alike.So - for the first time ever, ONLY here on Indiegogo, the long lost issues of Max Boost have been put into a collectible volume, plus new artwork, over 150 PAGES (first 4 years),  so you don't have to spend $1000 on eBay to find all the old issues of Import Tuner - which is basically impossible - just to read it.So I would hope that you would take a look, and "back this project", and help us make this Max Boost, Volume 1 a reality!  If you are new to Max Boost, WELCOME!  And please watch the video above and keep reading below!Max Boost on the cover of Import Tuner for the first time ever.Max Boost is a story about Max and Otto, and their adventures in Motorville as Max, a hyperactive boy that dreams of horsepower and fast cars, and Otto, his trusty sidekick and voice of reason, are best friends.They love cars and racing, and hope to have a racecar of their own one day so they can challenge the town bully, Todd, to a race to put him in his place.Since his birthday is coming, Max THINKS his Mom is going to get him his dream car - an Integra Type-R, so he can finally beat Todd's V8 in a race - but Instead.......his mom gets him a base model Civic Hatchback. No air conditioning, no electric windows or seats, and most importantly - no horsepower. And it's even GREEN.  (Oh no!)But, there is not turning back for Max, as the race is still on.Everyone at Motorville High School will be watching - and Max can't back out now.  He's hoping for a miracle.And, for the first time ever, he meets Todd at the local street races, ready or not.Well, Max is definitely "NOT".And so begins, Max's quest to keep himself from embarrassment, and for horsepower leads him to tuner culture and fast and furious hi-jinx.             ...Meanwhile a bigger threat to ALL of Motorville looms overhead, and Motorville's existence is in question.And from there, close to 200 total pages of Max Boost have been published to date about the misadventures begins - from tuning upgrades, to police, drag racing, drifting, burnouts and togue the story takes many twists and turns.  There is fun around every corner!Max Boost Volume 1 has 100 Pages of the original comic, plus 50 pages of extras and never before seen art and is only available here on Indiegogo for you to enjoy.  And exclusively for this launch campaign, you can get add-ons and never before seen extras (see below)!WELCOME TO MOTORVILLE!Max Boost - He is the underdog, and our unlikely hero.  Max is absolutely passionate about cars and racing, and will do anything it takes to find, build, and race the car of his dreams.  His number one enemy is Todd, and he is committed to bringing street-justice to Motorville by having Todd pay for all of the horrible things he does to those who have less horsepower than him.  And, as the story develops, we find out what roles these characters play, as the very existence of Motorville may actually depend on this young group of street-rascals... Otto - is Max's best friend and voice of reason.  Otto is basically the opposite of Max, as he is calm, collected, and is always thinking wisely.  However, he also knows it's almost impossible to stop Max when he has a "great idea", and knows it's better just get out of his way (and sometimes more entertaining!).  As a master tactician, Otto, has the skill of gently guiding Max along so he doesn't hurt himself... too much. Todd -  Big V8, BIG Pistons, and even BIGGER EGO.  Todd is the town jock that you love to hate, and he makes it a "sport" to harass Max and Otto, and anyone else under 500 horsepower.  Maybe one day, Max and Otto will be able to teach him a lesson in humility, but they will need to find some horsepower and torque first! Papa Wheely and his henchmen, Yin, Yan and Wok - He has the Horsepower and Torque!  Papa Wheely is the Proprietor of Papa Wheely's Performance Pagoda.  He's the one to see if you want you tuner car, tuned - but for a PRICE!AND, if you don't make your payments on time, you may end up meeting the his "Wu Tang Wack!"Ese and 'Efe - The leaders of the Low Rider crew from Low Co., Ese and Efe' patrol the streets of Lotting Park - with 3 wheel motion, on chrome & white walls.  Don't get caught by them at the wrong time, in the wrong place, or you might find yourself getting "hit by switches". And, that's not all, there are many, many more characters in Max Boost for you to meet! PLAYWIth ~150 pages, the First 4 years of comics (1998-2002 for Volume 1) plus never-before-seen art in a gorgeous, collectible hardcover, exclusively only for pre-order here: BEAUTIFUL, HEAVY WEIGHT, PREMIUM hard bound bookPrint size is just like original with heavy 150g PaperGlossy Printed Dust cover!and Heavy Weight Collectors Sleeve! (I plan on creating a more sophisticated design for this that I can get your input on, throughout the process!)Numbered Special edition* - only available here and may never be offered again!BONUS ITEMS & EXTRAS - "Boost" your Pre-Order! For a LIMITED limited time, you will have access to items only available here, and may NEVER be available any other time:Indiegogo Exclusive 8 x 10 Collectible Frame-able PrintsIndiegogo Exclusive Collectible Metal Enamel Lapel Pins - FIRST EDITIONMax Boost Car Decal, Vinyl Transfer, perfect for your ride!Max Boost Key Chain! Perfect for Power Wheels and Ferrari Keys alike! For the first time in YEARS - you will have access to The Last Race Movie (Produced by Max Boost Creator, Dennis Caco and directed by Alex Ranarivelo) Digital Access for those who get a Max Boost, Volume 1!INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE - THE AUTOMOTIVE ART OF AUTOCANNONMany of you may have remembered my clothing brand Autocannon / Shift Gear, and have probably worn or bought one of my t-shirts in the past (especially if you are a O.G. tuner from the 90's).  Establishing one of the first clothing brands in the industry, our car designs and art became a huge part of our culture.And, I thought it would be fun to add a little "something something" to this campaign with this art book to spark up some more nostalgia!So, for First time EVER - we are offering a special "gallery preview book" of selected original Autocannon automotive and apparel designs, as well as more Max Boost coloring book pages!This bonus special feature is only going to be available here, and we do NOT plan to have this  book availble after this campaign is over.  So if you want it, you have to get it here with Max Boost Volume 1!  We HIGHLY suggest it!If you want it, please pick the reward teir that includes this book!We promise, it will be awesome:Select 90's and 2000's infamous Autocannon Artwork and T-shirt DesignsMax Boost Coloring Pages (that are not available in Volume 1)40-60 colorful premium pages (Depends on how many are ordered, more orders = more pages!)Limited EditionPrototype Shown* Whew.  Okay, that's a lot of SWAG for a Indiegogo... and I'm not even done!- PLEDGE YOUR ALLEGIANCE TO TUNER COMICS!-ALL COMIC BOOK BACKERS - To show my appreciation for backers like you, ALL BACKERS will have the option to have your name listed in the Book (you can choose any name you wish to display, within guidelines)SUPER BACKER LEVEL, $199+ - And for certain higher pledge levels (see rewards), you can have your own “Instagram squares” in a special Super Fan Section.  You can also add your Instagram Profile name, for example. *Submissions must be made before Nov 10 2019 to make it to FIRST printing of the book.  Any submissions received after this date will be in a future printing.SPONSOR LEVEL: Even sponsors and teams can get into the action by pledging for the Sponsor level tier!* (May not always be available)  *Submissions must be made before Nov 10 2019 to make it to FIRST printing of the book.  Any submissions received after this date will be in a future printing.THANK GOD FOR THE FANS AND FRIENDS! -Despite that all those years I was in hibernation, I received a lot of love.  One of my greatest joys is meeting Max Boost Fans in real life, and / or getting Fan messages.In particular, I love getting  messages from those who were too young to drive when they first read Max Boost and now have tuner cars of their own. These stories kept reminding me that I should never have stopped drawing Max Boost- and if Max Boost, Volume 1 is successful -  I can bring Max Boost back for the next generation of tuner fans! Even though I took a mental break for 10 years, inspiration came in an unlikely event.  My younger brother (he's 18 years younger than me) got into the tuner scene (on his own, I had no influnce I swear!) and eventually asked me to bring him to the racetrack for the first time. And little did he know, combined with support from one of our original Max Boost + Autocannon crew Memo Quibrera, and jumping into Sam Rothschilds Honda Challenge Series championship winning CRX racecar for the first time in YEARS - they reignited my need for speed, and my itch to bring Max Boost back! - WHY I AM ON INDIEGOGO - So why am I on Indiegogo?I put over a decade of my life and sweat into Max Boost.  I invested everything I could to continue to make Max Boost for the people, and pursued the dream furiously.8 years into it, in 2006, Everything was going perfect and Max Boost was on a roll.  We got some serious momentum when we partnered with Playmates Toys (the Ninja Turtle Company) to make Max Boost Toys and we were even on our way to landing video games, and a deal for Saturday Morning Cartoons with Warner Bros.  And then suddenly, the WB contract was cancelled -I hit rock bottom [Lost almost everything, and stopped drawing Max Boost to take a mental break.  I was devastated, as everything seemed to have fallen apart, and the hard work from so many was not actualized.And, well, my “short" mental break ended up being more than 10 years.  I never stopped believing in Max Boost.  I never stopped loving cars, comics, and this culture.So I'm here, to put the control back in my hands - and build a MAX BOOST TEAM with YOU (yes YOU) - to launch more products that YOU WANT TO SEE without needing the studios or big names.  I realized with the power of community, we can actually do this independently.So Max Boost Volume 1 is the FIRST step of MANY.  So, if this campaign is successful, it will allow us to continue with our NEXT STEPS:Max Boost Volume 2AnimationToysNetflix Show? :)AND MORE.... Like my own life, Max Boost is a true Underdog story, where you're put up against all odds and still have to find a way to succeed.  Max Boost was simply a dream, and though hard work, long nights sleeping under drawing tables, and being a starving artist (literally), I was able to create something that fans worldwide loved.Max Boost is perfect for all gear heads, tuners, and comicbook fans looking for something that has deep roots and history in the Car Culture Or anyone who just love anime, cars, hispeed hijinx, and a good ol' underdog story about a little hatch back “that could".Unfortunately, this Max Boost, Volume 1 that I am holding in the video is just a prototype (1 of 1), and need Pre-Orders here on Indiegogo to hit our printers minimums.   We have a limited time to gather orders, and to make the revival with Max Boost Volume 1,  a reality!So this is where YOU come in...Max Boost is ONLY available here, at a discount, with Bonuses in hopes you will become part of the Max Boost Fam reserve your very own limited first edition copies, today,Simply click below to "Back this Project" to keep this dream alive!Please pledge today, share with your friends, and become part of Team Max Boost!Drive Fast. Race Hard.Dennis Caco & Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabelinskiy, Dan Wilson, and the Max Boost Crew Perfect for your friends, bookshelf, coffee table, shop, or "riding shotgun" in your car! A design I did for Nestor Cabrera and K&N for their project car. Eventually I ended up becoming a driver for the K&N Mitsubishi Evo Time Attack car for Super Lap Battle.  @AndresTheCarKid holding up a Falken Tires + Max Boost Collab Coloring Book given away FREE at Formula Drift Long Beach Diane's @FK8Di Civic Type-R - The first one I ever drove, and fell in love with immediately. We took it to the racetrack while it was only a few months old and it blew my mind. Diane was originally in the market for a Lexus, and at the San Diego Auto Convention, I "convinced" her to take a look a the Honda's... and well, the rest is history. She said this is the best car (and the most fun) she has ever owned.Justing and Jeff from Cartune Auto Repair. We're here track driving at Willow Springs raceway during an VTEC Club Event with Xtreme Speed.  My partner at Autocannon, Ian Penaflorida and his full race S13 reppin' Team SGR and Max BOOOOOOOOST! Here it is at California Autoclub Speedway!You would have to buy a LOT of Import Tuners to get all the issues in Max Boost, Volume 1 - collectors edition! Luckily, for the first time ever, you can get the first early issues in the most convenient way possible!   I could NOT have done this without so many people through the last 20 years and need to say THANK YOU!  (I am SURE I am forgetting a bunch of people, so please bear with me as I edit this from time to time)Of course, I need to start with my original "Racerette" and my wife Rachelle, and my son, Drake "Max" Caco, (yes his name is Max!),  and my very patient Mom, Dad my brothers Allan and Eric, and my super-sister Joann and her family.And of course, this would have never have happened without Aldryn Estacio and Collier Mclennan (Online Performance) convincing me to be the first DRAG GEN II Turbo Kit car for Herman Chan, and subsequently meeting Michael Ferrara from Turbo Magazine (now publisher of DSPORT), to shoot my Black Turbo Intergra GS-R (RIP) for a feature back in 1995.From there I met published Kipp Kington (RIP) and the team at IGC - Ed Eng, Evan Griffey, and that crew that invited me to help them design a brand new magazine from scratch, which eventally became Import Tuner.  (I designed the original logo, cover concepts, and helped create the theme for Import Tuner- the public actually doesn't know this, well, I guess until now. :).  Those were good 'ol days!So that's the beginning ... And since then I have met (and need to thank) so many friends:Memo Quibrera, Allan Deguzman, and Sam Rotschild for inspiring me to get back to the racetrack and bring Max Boost back to life.  My studio and comic peeps:Nghia, Derek, Clydene, Batton Lash, Joe Philips, Lex Wolfcraft, Chris NeuhahnCo-Workers and Friends; Memo Quibrera, Marat Zabeliskiy, April Estrada  Rich Langi, Carter Jung, Rick, Andres the Car Kid, Wes Walz,Artists and assistant artists:Rich, Eddie, Ray, Melissa, Derek, Conrad, TraceMy OG race team:Sam Rothschild, Dan Wilson, Lee Lim, Ian Penaflorida and Family, Gabe, TimGround Zero Racing and Online Performance, Eddie from Dynamic Autosport and Ha (RIP) from Pann Autosport for being my very first retail customers in the mid 90'sInfluencers & social partners:IG: @mistergsx (www.youtube.com/mistermemo) @the_house_of_honda, @State_of_evolution, @sorenswift, @misterGSX, @ifestcivic, @craiglieberman_42Sponsors & Industry:Nick Fousekis, Rich Langi, and the crew at Falken Tire, Import Fest Basit Mirza, Wes Walz at Elite Finish, CarTune Auto Repair, Edward Lee Titan 7, Philip Chase, Kenji, Mike and the crew at Greddy, Volk, Tein,  Eibach, Eddie Kim Dynamic Autosport, Pann Auto, Rick from Legacy Auto Spa, Emil and Ed and the gang at Extreme Autofest, Jim Liaw and the team at Formula D, Robert at Comickaze in San Diego,  Rich Calbay and Harry Kong (who was actually one of the first to bring Max Boost back about 4 years ago) from Nitto Tire, Thomas Okihisa and Toyo Tires, Note from Treefrog USA, Ryan and the Honda Challenge crew from NASA ProRacing...Bruce and the team at Honda for believing in the Power of Dreams (like mine!)The Last Race Team:Alex Ranarivelo (Director) and Our Crew, and all the extras that stayed for 7 hours to shoot our racing scenes!And of course YOU and all of our hardcore Max Boost fans!~ And I am sure I forgot some people, so I'll be adding more as I remember! :)THANK YOU ALL!  LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!-Dennis and the Max Boost Crew_____________________________________________________________*all descriptions and products are subject to change in final production.  All products are prototypes and may change.  All prices are subject to change at anytime.* Exclusives may be exclusive to this Indiegogo Campaign and any other platform we may continue this campaign on*Stretch goals- each of these features are added when we hit certain pledge goals, see below for more details._____________________________________________________________Max Boost!® and Autocannon™ are TM & © 2019 of Caco Enterprises, inc.Import Tuner® is TM & © 2019 SUPER STREET ONLINE | MOTOR TREND GROUP, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.Honda®, Acura®, Integra®, Vtec®, Type-R®, and Civic® are TM & © 2019 American Honda Motor Co. All rights reserved Used with permission.Toyota® is a TM and ©2019 Toyota Motor Sales, U.S.A., Inc. All rights reserved. Falken Tires® is TM and © 2019 Sumitomo Rubber North America, Inc. All Rights Reserved.  Titan 7 is ™ and © 2017 Titan 7 Wheels. All rights reserved. Eibach® is Copyright © 2019 Eibach. All Rights Reserved. The Fast and The Furious Copyright: Universal Pictures 2001.  Love Don't Cost a Thing TM & © 2019 Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. All rights reserved.

story:
The gods have fallen, turned to dust while the world bleeds. Mankind doomed to wear the penance of their transgression against the Dead Ones. Again, and again. Through the cycle of chaos and death, a desperate alchemist seeks redemption.

The Alchemist is a new mature and gritty comic series, from The McKane Brothers (Art by Mason McKane and Story by Nic McKane), that follows Lester Von, an Alchemist attempting to salvage what is left of mankind in the wake of a dark curse brought upon the world by the ancient gods known as the Dead Ones, as their last act against the humans that sought to betray and destroy them.

Prima Materia (First Matter) is the first issue of the first main story arc in the series. This 22-page, full-color issue, will be the first step in a saga that will see The Alchemist and he meets along the way encounter fanatic cults, cosmic entities, and the forces of Chaos itself as Lester seeks redemption within the Void. If you love dark fantasy stories and Lovecraftian tales please check out this comic, we hope you enjoy.

 

Drawn by Mason McKane, Nefarious Publishing

Written by Nic McKane

Self-published under Nefarious Publishing

What We Need & What You Get

This is our first Indiegogo campaign and our goal is simple; raise enough funds to print books for our backers and support our convention prints and some travel costs. Our humble goal of $500 also allows us to utilize IndieGoGo’s in-demand status so that we can gain better visibility and sell the book right here on this site for you all!

We plan to use the funds raised through this campaign to cover the costs of printing and shipping to our backers. Specifically, we need funding for:

Printing costs - We understand the importance of actually having a physical copy of a book in your hands, which is why we are focusing on good old classic printed copies at the moment and that stuff costs money!

Artist fees - Gotta eat!

Convention and distribution expenses - We are always trying to reach new people and share our stuff as much as possible. This will help us do that.

So what’s in it for you? Well, if you choose to back us you can expect:

$10 level - Printed copy of The Alchemist #1 and small print (6x9).

$20 level - Printed copy of The Alchemist #1 and large print (11x17).

$35 level - Printed copy of The Alchemist #1 and Nefarious Publishing t-shirt.

$45 level - Printed copy of The Alchemist #1, large (11x17) print, and Nefarious Publishing t-shirt.

$70 level - 2 printed copies of The Alchemist #1, one standard and one with plastic-framed sketch cover with original oil painting on it.

$100 level - All items from other pledge levels. Includes 2 printed copies of The Alchemist #1, one standard and one with plastic-framed sketch cover with original oil painting on it, Nefarious Publishing t-shirt, one small pint (6x9), and one large (11x17) print.

This is just for starters too! We plan on making a bunch more issues so you can expect the perks to get better as we are able to produce more cool stuff thanks to backers like (hopefully) you!

The Impact

If we reach our goal we will not only be able to put the book (and other cool stuff) in the hands of all our backers, it will also allow us to produce enough copies, and afford travel expenses, to get off the ground during convention season to share with as many people as possible!

Risks & Challenges

The main thing that comes to mind here is time. We both have full-time day jobs and work on comics in our free time. Therefore we produce content as quickly as we can and aim to produce a new issue every few months, but sometimes life happens and delays can occur. Rest assured that we will honor every pledge and every order received as quickly as we can. We will get you your stuff!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are not ready to support us yet. You have your reasons! However, you can still help us out by getting the word out on social media, using the Indiegogo share tools, and by checking out more art and projects over at www.masonmckane.com and www.nefariouspublishing.com.

Additionally, you can reach out to us at:

Mason McKane: nefariousillustration@gmail.com

Nic McKane: nmckane@gmail.com

story:
Dive deep into the mysterious past of Pink Lemonade with this holiday collection of comic strips and short stories!  Rising star Nick Cagnetti continues his colorful ride through the world of PINK LEMONADE. Standard cover by Nick Cagnetti!  Joyful holiday variant cover by Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson!

 

PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG (STANDARD COVER) - $6.00

 

PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG (DON SIMPSON VARIANT COVER) - $6.00

 

PINK LEMONADE #1 (STANDARD COVER) - $4.00

 

IT'S ALIVE! IS PROUD TO PRESENT THE PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG BY NICK CAGNETTI!

PINK LEMONADE returns with this holiday collection of comic strips and short stories!  Stories include the moment she receives her name, a motorcycle crash where she narrowly escapes serious injury, a run-in with an angry French spaceman named Skip who has lost his dog, a bar full of pirates that turn out to be quite friendly, a moment of introspection where she struggles with loneliness, the discovery of an old comic containing a superhero she admires, and Pink Lemonade’s first ever letter to Santa!  New friends, motorbikes, carousels, dino-shaped chicken nuggets, OJ-bot, angry spacemen, flying dogs, vintage comics, even Good Old Saint Nick himself…it’s all in here! Rising star Nick Cagnetti continues his colorful ride through the world of PINK LEMONADE.

You can pick up your copies of the PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG from this IndieGoGo campaign, which includes the Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, and a Variant Cover by Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson!  You can also pick up a signed Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, or a signed Variant Cover by Don Simpson!

If you take a moment to look through the Perks on the right side of this page, you will see that you have the option of picking up one of the two covers, two individual signed covers, or all four signed and unsigned covers at once.  AND WHEN YOU CHECK OUT, YOU WILL SEE SEVERAL ADD-ON OPTIONS THAT YOU CAN ADD TO YOUR ORDER!  THIS INCLUDES SIGNED AND UNSIGNED COVERS!

Also, Nick Cagnetti will be making some of his gorgeous original PINK LEMONADE comic strip art available.  These are the comic strips seen in THIS collection!

SEE ALL AVAILABLE COMIC STRIPS BELOW

There will also be a handful of PINK LEMONADE pin-ups available from a group of amazing artists who believe in what Nick is doing.

Lastly, for those who missed it, we are making a limited number of PINK LEMONADE #1 (Standard cover by Nick Cagnetti) available for purchase!

Through this campaign we hope to raise the funds necessary to print and ship the PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG.  We are only asking for $1000, but we do have some stretch goals in mind if we go beyond the initial goal.

Thank you for your interest in PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG!  Please let us know if you have any questions.

And now...here is a sneak peek at one of the short stories found in this 32 page collection...

----------------------------------------------

 

HERE ARE ALL THE AVAILABLE PINK LEMONADE COMIC STRIPS.  REMEMBER THAT A FREE COPY OF THE PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG COMIC BOOK (STANDARD COVER) IS INCLUDED WITH EACH COMIC STRIP PURCHASED!  WHAT A DEAL!

 

----------------------------------------------

 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT PINK LEMONADE

"Terrific and original like crazy" –Michael Allred (MADMAN)

"Dreamy 'bots, fun fandom examination and her bike is her best friend. Delirious insanity with danger lurking just around the corner." –John Cassaday (PLANETARY)

"Above all else, comic books are meant to be fun. PINK LEMONADE hits the mark from the start, and blasts through the entertainment strata with style I can’t help but believe would make King Jack proud." –Dan Brereton (NOCTURNALS)

"Crazy fun--has a playful look and feel of a 90's comic reminiscent of Michael Allred and Jay Stephens." –Rich Tommaso (DRY COUNTY)

“It’s unique and refreshing! I love the pure style of it all.” –Dan Fraga (THE GRAVE)

"PINK LEMONADE is pure pop art funkiness. It’s a mix of Mike Allred’s MADMAN with a healthy does of Jack Kirby and Dan Clowes thrown in for good measure." –Jamal Igle (MOLLY DANGER)

"A pop culture story that's deeply rooted in its own fictional pop culture, PINK LEMONADE #1 is as intriguing is it is bizarre. Entertaining, with solid art that is a mash up of Allred, Clowes, and animator Sally Cruikshank." –David Hahn (SIX MILLION DOLLAR MAN)

"Nick Cagnetti's PINK LEMONADE is a quirky, good-hearted comic book series. Try a taste of PINK LEMONADE. You'll find it refreshing!" –Michael T. Gilbert (MR. MONSTER)

"Pink Lemonade is a fun romp with visual nods to the coolest art books of yesteryear!" –Pop Mahn (RAVEN: DAUGHTER OF DARKNESS)

"What an endearingly goofy heroine!  I want to go to lunch with her!" –Trina Robbins (LAST GIRL STANDING)

"Nothing can prepare you for how cool and eye-popping the world of Pink Lemonade is. You'll instantly fall for the eponymous do-gooder motorcyclist who will charm her way into your heart while also injecting a healthy dose of madness into your mind." –Scott Duvall (ARMY OF DARKNESS/BUBBA HO-TEP)

"First half of the book was like 'What?' and the second half was like 'Whoa!!'  The ending had me like, where is book 2 going to take me?" –N. Steven Harris (WILDSTORM: MICHAEL CRAY)

"This is a very fun comic book! If you enjoy quirky, whimsical, and surreal comics like Mike Allred’s MADMAN, then this is for you." –Henry Chamberlain, COMICS GRINDER

"This book’s zany, upbeat, often surreal sensibilities lie somewhere between Mike Allred’s MADMAN and Ryan North and Erica Henderson’s UNBEATABLE SQUIRREL GIRL." –Dan Grote, WMQ COMICS

"Overall, Pink Lemonade #1 is a stunning start to a comic series with an art style that blows most of what is on stands out of the water." –Lizzy Garcia, BUT WHY THO?

"On the surface, this may seem like cool stuff for younger readers. I think kids will appreciate PINK LEMONADE on several levels, and I look forward to seeing her cosplayed. But Cagnetti, the writer/artist/colorist/letterer/genius/madman behind PINK LEMONADE has some things to tell us grownups, too." –Clyde Hall, DOOM ROCKET

"The art and visual design for this one jumped out at me" –JK Parkin, SMASH PAGES

"This one is a definite check out book." –COMICS HEATING UP

“...hopepunk by way of Jack Kirby and Evel Knievel!” –Grant DeArmitt

"(PINK LEMONADE is) strong-willed, quirky, and fun. Every interaction she has with another human is filled with this childhood whimsy I wish I still had." –Cidnya Silva

 

----------------------------------------------

 

RECENT PRESS FOR PINK LEMONADE

COMICS HEATING UP: https://comicsheatingup.net/2019/08/05/august-p...

PREVIEWS WORLD INDIE EDGE: https://www.previewsworld.com/Article/232927-In...

SMASH PAGES: http://smashpages.net/2019/07/14/fund-me-sunday...

ATOMIC JUNK SHOP - FLIPPIN' THROUGH PREVIEWS: http://atomicjunkshop.com/flippin-through-previ...

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/05/10/its-ali...

COMIC CRUSADERS: https://www.comiccrusaders.com/its-alive-announ...

COMICS GRINDER: https://comicsgrinder.com/2019/05/11/review-pin...

WMQ COMICS: https://wmqcomics.com/news/indie-review-pink-le...

BUT WHY THO?: https://butwhythopodcast.com/2019/06/18/heroesc...

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/06/15/exclusi...

KGW COMIC PICK OF THE WEEK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SB9CskVgAN0

DOOMROCKET: https://doomrocket.com/pink-lemonade-1-review/

 

----------------------------------------------

 

ABOUT NICK CAGNETTI

Nick Cagnetti is 24 years old, he's been drawing forever but he first started making comics with his friends in 2012. Among the works produced were two series: Infinite Wonders, and The Spirit of The Shadows. Alongside storyboard work and other art gigs, Nick has been making Pink Lemonade comic strips and short stories on his own since 2016. In 2019, he set out to tell larger stories with Pink Lemonade's own comic book series which brings us to today.

 

ABOUT IT'S ALIVE!

IT'S ALIVE! is the brainchild of multiple Eisner Award nominee Drew Ford, publishing out of print comics, English translations of foreign material, original projects (like PINK LEMONADE!), and other unique collectibles.
story_txt: Dive deep into the mysterious past of Pink Lemonade with this holiday collection of comic strips and short stories!  Rising star Nick Cagnetti continues his colorful ride through the world of PINK LEMONADE. Standard cover by Nick Cagnetti!  Joyful holiday variant cover by Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson! PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG (STANDARD COVER) - $6.00 PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG (DON SIMPSON VARIANT COVER) - $6.00 PINK LEMONADE #1 (STANDARD COVER) - $4.00 IT'S ALIVE! IS PROUD TO PRESENT THE PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG BY NICK CAGNETTI!PINK LEMONADE returns with this holiday collection of comic strips and short stories!  Stories include the moment she receives her name, a motorcycle crash where she narrowly escapes serious injury, a run-in with an angry French spaceman named Skip who has lost his dog, a bar full of pirates that turn out to be quite friendly, a moment of introspection where she struggles with loneliness, the discovery of an old comic containing a superhero she admires, and Pink Lemonade’s first ever letter to Santa!  New friends, motorbikes, carousels, dino-shaped chicken nuggets, OJ-bot, angry spacemen, flying dogs, vintage comics, even Good Old Saint Nick himself…it’s all in here! Rising star Nick Cagnetti continues his colorful ride through the world of PINK LEMONADE.You can pick up your copies of the PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG from this IndieGoGo campaign, which includes the Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, and a Variant Cover by Don (MEGATON MAN) Simpson!  You can also pick up a signed Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, or a signed Variant Cover by Don Simpson!If you take a moment to look through the Perks on the right side of this page, you will see that you have the option of picking up one of the two covers, two individual signed covers, or all four signed and unsigned covers at once.  AND WHEN YOU CHECK OUT, YOU WILL SEE SEVERAL ADD-ON OPTIONS THAT YOU CAN ADD TO YOUR ORDER!  THIS INCLUDES SIGNED AND UNSIGNED COVERS!Also, Nick Cagnetti will be making some of his gorgeous original PINK LEMONADE comic strip art available.  These are the comic strips seen in THIS collection!SEE ALL AVAILABLE COMIC STRIPS BELOWThere will also be a handful of PINK LEMONADE pin-ups available from a group of amazing artists who believe in what Nick is doing.Lastly, for those who missed it, we are making a limited number of PINK LEMONADE #1 (Standard cover by Nick Cagnetti) available for purchase!Through this campaign we hope to raise the funds necessary to print and ship the PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG.  We are only asking for $1000, but we do have some stretch goals in mind if we go beyond the initial goal.Thank you for your interest in PINK LEMONADE HOLIDAY GRAB-BAG!  Please let us know if you have any questions.And now...here is a sneak peek at story:
Be Mesmerized by That Magical Horror Light Show!

 

 

Volume 1: Monsters

Our mousy protagonist Willow lives in a mundane and restricted school, which ends up being the worst place someone could get gifted a magical necklace. Desperately trying to contain the magic within, this act of futility seems to just make matters worse. As the necklace crumbles the school’s secrets around her, Willow is left to wonder if it was a gift sent by friend or foe?

 

 

Volume 2: Mischief

Willow, Georgia and Emma have accidentally wrapped both Tillie and Aaron into their magical girl shenanigans much to their chagrin. However, things seem to be getting even harder to keep quiet as these magical powers have turned from intriguing to infectious.  Between daylight daydreams, tanking a track star, bathroom breakdowns and betrayal from within - our quarreling quintet might be in bigger trouble then they ever thought possible.

 

 

Volume 3: Malice

The infection has spread beyond control, their quiet home a prison. Willow and the rest of the XII, incapacitated and injured, try desperately to make sense of the world they never knew they lived in. Trapped in the claws of the Headmistress and their necklaces confiscated - the only thing the girls have left: is escape. 

XII: Of Magic and Muses has been published online as a webcomic since 2016 and after 5 magical years we're finishing off the trilogy in print - before the website finishes Volume 2! It is currently updating 6x a week - Mondays to Saturdays and will finish in September 2022.

This comic is rated for a Teen Audience due to language, partial nudity, and scenes of violence, as well as content warnings for blood and strangulation.

 

Praise for Magic and Muses

'XII has a slow but promising start. The setting is eerie and mysterious enough by itself and things only get more and more strange as magic enters the scene. Definitely an original take on the magical girl genre.' - Goodreads

"A one-of-a-kind coming of age story!" - A Place to Hang Your Cape

"Spellbinding visuals help showcase this engaging story!" - The Valkyries

 

Add-Ons

Sticker Sheet - $6 CAD

A sticker sheet displaying all 12 of the familiars!

Button Set - $6 CAD

A complete set of 12 1 inch buttons, each designed after the girls' necklaces!

Holographic Print - $15 CAD

Grab a 8x11 in shiny holographic art nouveau print! 

Character Standees - $25 CAD

Our magical girl double sided standees stand at a whopping 6 inches and are still available! You can choose from our whole cast of Magic and Muses: Willow, Georgia, Emma, Tillie, Aaron, Nana, Bebe, Eve, Phoebe, Alice, Sarah and Jodie!

Character Standees Full Set - $180 CAD

Our magical girl double sided standees stand at a whopping 6 inches and are still available! You can choose from our whole cast of Magic and Muses: Willow, Georgia, Emma, Tillie, Aaron, Nana, Bebe, Eve, Phoebe, Alice, Sarah and Jodie!

story:
WHAT IS ENGLEWOOD?

ENGLEWOOD is a comic being brought to life through the writing of Micah Curtis, the art of Brian Martinez, and colors of Armand Strange. It is a project three years in the making, and we're finally looking to bring it to the masses. ENGLEWOOD will be an ongoing series, and this campaign's primary purpose is getting all 36 pages of Issue 1 into your hands and onto store shelves, kickstarting a street-level story that we know you'll love.

FROM THE MIND OF MICAH CURTIS

After hearing countless tragedies from his home city, and witnessing it become the murder capital of the world, Micah Curtis had an idea: What would happen if Chicago had its own superhero? Thus, the idea of ENGLEWOOD got its first spark. A lifelong comic book fan, Micah is known for his YouTube channel and weekly podcast, "Micah and The Hatman." He has also written for Bleeding Fool, Techraptor, and other publications.

BRIAN MARTINEZ BRINGS ART WITH A BITE

Brian Martinez discovered comics when his mother would buy him bundles of tattered and torn books, 10 for $1. Growing up in poverty, it was an affordable hobby for him at the time. Ever since, he's wanted to tell stories through pictures. Martinez has found inspiration through the superheroes of Marvel and DC, the gritty black-and-white of Eastman and Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and even MANime like Berserk, Fist of the North Star, Sakigake!! Otokojuku, and JoJo's Bizarre Adventure. He brings that inspiration to ENGLEWOOD through pencil and ink.

COLORS SURGE WITH ARMAND STRANGE

Armand Strange's story is rather simple. According to what his mother told him, he's been making art as soon as he picked up a stick and could draw in the sand. He never stopped. Strange joins the ENGLEWOOD team as its colorist.

 

CHECK OUT THE PIN-UP YOU CAN GET (SOLD OUT)

 

AND SHIRTS, TOO! (SOLD OUT)

 

OH, AND HERE ARE OUR STRETCH GOALS!

$10,000 — A sticker featuring the logo of Elijah's gym—Solomon's Temple—will be included with every physical perk. MET!!

$12,000 — Eric Weathers will letter the book! MET!!

$15,000 — Author Micah Curtis will sign every comic, and whatever other physical perk you want him to put his shiny signature on.

$20,000 — Our art team will receive a bonus!

story:
About me

My name is Mysh, visual storytelling is my trade and my passion. I make comics and films, both animated and live-action. "Imaginary Encounters" is my most personal and most ambitious project to-date, and in it all the things I love to do and to tell about come together.

About Haiku-Comics

Based on a traditional Japanese format of three-line poems, the Haiku-comics are short graphic and video pieces that use words and images to capture moments in life – of love and sexual desire, heartbreak and joy. Through the Haiku I tell stories that express my own feelings and views (that's why most of the Haiku are about men loving men). This project is hard to fit into existing formats. Because of this, "Imaginary Encounters" began its run at the place where boundaries tend to blur – the Internet. For two years the Haiku project ran online as a series of comics and video shorts, resulting in fifty-and-counting pieces. Now I want to take it to the next level.

The Book of Haiku-comics

Though the Haikus exist now in the digital form, they are all hand-drawn, and my dream is to enable the readers to experience them in the way closest to the originals. So my first goal is to produce, print and distribute a hardcover collection of "Imaginary Encounters" series – a book that will include the first 50 Haikus. The book itself  will be an art object designed to honor the content.

The Original Art Plates

"Imaginary Encounters" is as much a fine art project as it is a series of comics. As part of the process of bringing it back to its paper form, I want to make original plates of selected Haikus, each limited to 25 or 50 prints in beautiful silk-screen printing technique.

The Series of Haiku-videos

Like the comics,  Haiku-videos are black-and-white silent shorts, capturing moments when Life becomes Poetry. To this day, I've made only three Haiku-videos, but there are much more I want to make, creating a full-scale series

What do we need?

Our ultimate goal is to raise $60.000, which will enable us to make all parts of the project happen: the book, the art plates,  and ultimately, bring Imaniary Encounters to life on the screen as a video series.

The first $20.000 will enable us to edit, design, print and ship the book, using the best quality materials,

$30.000 will make it possible to build the Imaginary Encounters' official website, and to create the original plates for selected Haikus, which can be ordered and bought through the website

And finally, reaching the $60.000 will enable the Haiku-videos series to begin. That means that during the next two years I will produce and direct various Haiku shorts, bringing the total number of episodes to 20. They will run on the Haiku project official website, and hopefully will find their way to film festivals and international distribution.

This all will result in a massive LGBT art project that defies boundaries of both gender and media. If you feel it's a good cause to support – here's your opportunity!

How can you contribute and what do you get?

Choose one of the perks on your right to support the project and receive a unique precious gift.

Besides the financial contributions, you can help us by spreading the word about our campaign. You can do it through Facebook, or by using the IndieGoGo share tools!

Thank you for your time and see you on the other side!

Mysh

This all will result in a massive LGBT art project that defies boundaries of both gender and media. If you feel it's a good cause to support – here's your opportunity!
How can you contribute and what do you get?
Choose one of the perks on your right to support the project and receive a unique precious gift.
Besides the financial contributions, you can help us by spreading the word about our campaign. You can do it through Facebook, or by using the IndieGoGo share tools!
Thank you for your time and see you on the other side!
Mysh

story:
We're seeking funding to publish two new great comics by artists Mia Schwartz (previewed left) and Ben Urkowitz (previewed right), and we need your help!

This spring, the comics elite gather to exhibit in Toronto, Canada for the Toronto Comics Arts Festival, or TCAF. Enter young micropublisher Rigged Books, run by yours truly, Kyle Petersen, who gets a table at TCAF a mere few months after my first publication, Cat City by Liz Lehman, is released to critical praise.

Going to TCAF as a publisher has been a dream of mine for nearly a decade and I'd like to do something very special for it, so I'm working with two artists who need a substantial work to showcase their talents, those two being Mia Schwartz and Ben Urkowitz, and I'm working with Colour Code Printing of Toronto and their Risograph printers to produce beautiful 2-color books that double both as great works of comics and gorgeous art objects.

I've covered my own travel expenses, the cost of the table and the advance payment to each artist for their work, so what I next need your help with is the following:

  • $2500 for the printing and shipping costs on these new books
  • $300 travel stipend for the artists (total)
  • ~$150-300 for Indiegogo fees
  • The remainder goes to producing and shipping other rewards for the campaign

We have stretch goals, should we meet our quota, that'll be revealed further as they go on:

  • $3500: full runs of both Mia's and Ben's comics at TCAF!
  • $4000: the above plus more new work from Rigged Books artist Liz Lehman!
  • $5000: the above plus a brand-new English-language comics debut by Paula Almeida!
  • $6000: the above plus new comics from up-and-comer Vida Alcamo!
  • More stretch goals TBA...

Supporting this campaign is supporting the artists you love.

I care deeply about comics, so much that there's been times where they've literally saved my life. The early successes that Rigged Books has had, however modest, have made me immeasurably happy, getting to share comics I love that would otherwise have not been published. This, though, is my attempt to really make waves in the system, to put out the best new work possible, and to show the world the artists I love and the art that uplifts.

In that interest, I take no money from this personally; all money that goes through Rigged Books goes to the artists, shipping costs, and future projects. Furthermore, the drive is operating on flexible funding, to ensure that some part of the run is payed for in time for TCAF, and that even if the goal isn't hit, we have books to share.

It's my sincere hope that this serves both as a staging ground for the TCAF books and a wider revelation to the comics world of the things I am working on bringing to print. I want to run a comics house which is both uncompromising and serious, but fun and thoughtful, and the only way to achieve that is to try to bring those things forward.

If you can't donate, please spread the word on your social media site of choice, or by word of mouth. If you can donate and do, you're a saint, and if you donate AND spread the word, you're one of my favorite people.

Please, direct any questions to riggedbooks@gmail.com; thank you.

Thank you for supporting great comics, and we'll see you at TCAF!

story:
Desiree Galen is The Fool, in Fool's Journey


Desiree was born circa 1994, and has morphed and grown through time. Originally put down to the proverbial paper as a novel, it was my re-introduction to Jason, and his illustration skills, that sparked the idea of a comic book, breathing new life into a story I'd almost given up on.

We've had the first 13 page issue on indieaisle for almost a year, but have decided it's time to take the next step with this project! Unsure whether printing this issue was a good idea, we spoke with other artists, in, and out, of the comic book world, who convinced us it really was. So, here we are! Asking you for help to get this baby of mine to the masses! Not only will we be able to spread this story throughout the country, we'll have the motivation to continue, and finish, the story! Extra earnings will mean a second issue in print! 

Free distribution

Our main goal is to get this story in front of people, so we'll be mailing copies of the book, for FREE, to varies contacts. (Are you a viable media contact? Let us know and get on the list...)

  • We want to print 1000 copies, which will cost us about $2382 plus shipping (We've decided to go with 360 Digital Printing b/c of their amazing staff).
  • Perks and shipping will cost about $590
  • A super quality e-formatting for the first 16 pages was a must to help us promote: $90
  • We'd like to purchase ISBN's to have the option to start selling our books on Amazon, Barnes & Nobles, etc. Each printed version needs it's own, as does each e-formatted issue. 10 ISBN's for $250 (they're cheaper the more you buy, so if we raise more money we'll get more)
  • Fees to Indiegogo
  • Jason's creating some great prints, and rare editions for you! I'll keep those updates coming as they're created.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll just print less copies. If we exceed our goal (!!!!) I'd like to pay Jason something for his time, plus have the second issue printed. 

For You...

...the hugest appreciative thank you in the history of mankind! This decades long dream of mine to get this story completed and to an appropriate audience is on its way!

Of course, everyone gets a free issue! That's the whole point! Some will have access to the newly re-formatted e-book on completion, others will have physical copies sent to them to hug and love forever! 

There's a bunch of terrific one-of-a-kind art, including original concept sketches, and limited edition prints available to the true fans! You can even grab a perk that will immortalize your name, or face, forever in our pages. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help:

  • Spread the word! Tell everyone you've ever met about this awesome new comic! Click the share buttons below! Come back often and re-share to help keep our momentum going!
  • Read the first issue here and write a terrific review! We can share it to others, and so can you!

Special Thanks To:

  • Rick J. Smith: He'll make anyone sound amazing. And who else can come up with an original background sound in 38 minutes, minus music reflection time. 
  • Public Domain: As complicated as this sounds, I felt comfortable using the Popeye clip
  • Artifex: who watches over, and gives great feedback

story:
Neelakshi: The Quest for Amrit

By funding this project, you help us realize a dream very close to our hearts. Since my teens I have been a big fan of comics and graphic novels and had always wanted to create my own comic book. I also want to explore a new genre in comics: stories inspired by the rich mythology of India but not just retell existing mythology. With Ashok Rajagopalan, my writing partner and published writer and illustrator of children's books, who shares the same dream, I want to produce 'Neelakshi,' a sword and sorcery graphic novel with a strong female protagonist, Neil.

Neil is transported to the underworld of demons where she is Neelakshi, the promised one of prophecy. The story is her quest for amrit, the nectar of immortality, and how she establishes peace in the three worlds of Hindu myth.

For this project, we have enlisted the support and skills of the talented artist Judit Tondora and the amazing colorist Roland Pilcz.

We request funding for the production of 'Neelakshi - The Quest for Amrit' a 64 page graphic novel of the highest quality. We expect to start a minor revolution in visual storytelling with this project.

We have created the initial pages but need funds to proceed and ensure Neelakshi is published. We will provide regular updates at each stage of the process as we proceed. Both of us work at our day jobs due to financial neccessity, but hope to be doing only comic books in the future and give pleasure to fans across the globe. We will give of our best in terms of quality and skills, but we need your support.


I have enlisted the support of an illustrator, a colorist and a letterer. To pay them, I need $7000.
Project duration: Four months.
We already have publishers interested in the project, and it only needs the funds for execution.

story:
Hi guys,

Thanks so much for already coming as far as to click on this page!
If you've follow me on YouTube and have watched my video then you will already know how important I believe education can be for those who really want or need to get out of a bad situation. 

If you haven't watched the video then please do!

On Monday 8th September, some of the world’s most famous YouTube stars are starting a school with a difference, to help raise money for children who don’t have access to education.

For five days, YouTube stars like me will be stepping back into the virtual classroom and learning something completely new, before sharing it with our fans around the world. In exchange for pushing ourselves outside the comfort zone, we’re asking viewers to support us by donating whatever they can.

Millions of children worldwide won’t be going back to school this September, because they simply don't have access to education - especially kids living on the streets, in slums, in refugee camps and in areas of conflict. Education can be a powerful route out of poverty and without it many people are trapped in these desperate situations.

Money raised will be spent by Comic Relief UK to help children from vulnerable and disadvantaged backgrounds to go to school and receive a life-changing education.

Here are some examples of how your donation could help:

£5 could pay for a literacy book for a young person in conflict-stricken Somalia, helping them get the education they need.

£10 could buy a school uniform for a child living on the streets of Ghana, which they need to go to school so they can get vital skills and work towards a brighter future.

£60 could pay for a Zambian orphan to go to secondary school for a whole year, offering them hope, safety and life-changing access to education.

£300 could pay for a female mentor to work in a school for an entire year in a poor area of Ghana to encourage girls to stay in school and help them get a better education.

I really appreciate all of your support and I can't wait to see the changes that we can make together!
