story:
Earth is a distant memory and the remnants of humanity now lives aboard the space station, Terralympus. Mia is one of the best engineers on Terralympus and there's never been a problem that she can't fix. It started out as a normal day with Mia showing Hanna (the new engineering recruit) the ropes. However, Mia stumbles upon a hidden conspiracy aboard Terralympus which could have serious consequences to all aboard the space station.  

Terralympus is a 48 page Black &White (GREYSCALE) graphic novel printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover.  (For those unfamiliar with gsm, I'm a bit of a paper snob and this is high end paper!) Terralympus is standard comic book size 260mm x 170mm.

This is the perfect graphic novel for anyone who loves science fiction grounded in reality, compelling characters and an exploration of what lies out there in vast realm of space. Your help and support will bring this story to life! There is an exclusive IndieGoGo cover that will never be printed anywhere else. Only one print run of this cover will be done for this campaign and that's it!

Standard Cover

IndieGoGo Exclusive Cover

Creators

Terralympus is created by Shaun Keenan and Stephen Kok with amazing artwork by Von Randal. All three creatives have worked on multiple project including Xtreme Championship Tournament (XCT), Word Smith and many more titles!

Mia

Stefan

Hanna

Pages!

All pages are highly detailed Black & White (greyscale) works. If you loved The Walking Dead artwork, you will love Terralympus.

 

More Pages!

 

Last Bonus Page!

Rewards!

All monies raised will go into a new print run of Terralympus. As part of this print run an exclusive IndieGoGo cover will be made. This cover will NOT be SOLD anywhere else except on this campaign. All rewards are priced in Australian Dollars (AUD) so for international backers (especially those in the US) you will get an awesome discount based on the exchange rate! 

Note : The graphics provided for the rewards are an indication ONLY. The actual graphic novel is 48 pages.

Note : All physical rewards can be signed by the creator Stephen Kok on request.

PDF Reward - AUD$5

Standard Cover - AUD$20

Variant Cover - AUD$29

Artwork by Wallace Cheong (Only 15 copies!)

IndieGoGo Exclusive Cover - AUD$29

Artwork by Von Randal (Only for this campaign!)

MEGA Pack - AUD$55

You get the PDF, Standard and IGG Exclusive cover PLUS Special limited edition A5 (Postcard - 148mm x 210mm) Print Pack with 2 limited edition prints!

Risks & Challenges

The artwork is ready to go and lettered! All that's required is to get the print run with the exclusive IndieGoGo cover printed and shipped out to all the supporters.

Thanks for your support and reading through this campaign! If this graphic novel perks your curiosity, your contribution will be appreciated. Please feel to let your friends and family know about Terralympus and be sure to share the link around!

story:
Hello! And welcome to my third Indiegogo campaign!  My name is Mike S. Miller, I'm a 27 year veteran of the comic book industry, best known for my artwork in the NYTimes best selling, and #1 digital comic book in the world, INJUSTICE: GODS AMONG US, and INJUSTICE 2 for DC COMICS.  I'm also the cover artist for A GAME OF THRONES, you've probably heard of that one...  

I'm from San Diego, California, where I live with my amazing and beautiful wife, and 5 insane children who pull me in every direction!  I've gone rogue from the mainstream comics plantation, and have struck out on this new venture to reshape the very nature of comicdom itself!  What's that you say?  Aiming a little high am I?  Well, I figure if I aim for the moon, I might hit the top of the mountain.  But either way, it's a long, steep climb, and I'll need your help to keep this thing going!

Cover A: Mike S. Miller BROKEN GLASS

Cover B: The Jon Malin

Cover C: Mike S Miller Gone with the Wind:

Cover D: by Ethan Van Sciver and Kyle Ritter:

Covers A and B combined for MONSTER HUNT by Mike S. Miller:

Monster Hunt Caanan White/Kyle Ritter cover:

Monster Hunt Elliot Fernandez cover (to be colored by Kyle Ritter):

 

We're keeping the perks simple, and the prices as low as feasible:

$15 flat Gets you a digital copy of Lonestar: Soul of the Soldier 

$25 Lonestar: Soul of the Soldier signed 

$30 signed physical PLUS digital copy

$50 signed Lonestar: Soul of the Soldier PLUS  signed cover A of Lonestar: Heart of the Hero! FIRST PRINTING (LIMITED AVAILABILITY!)

$100 - Lonestar for the troops - Buy 4 signed copies for yourself and we'll send a minimum of 10 to the troops. If we can, we will send more. NO SHIPPING! (best deal?  HECK YEAH!)

$200-300 gets you a LONESTAR: HEART OF THE HERO blank sketch cover with a full drawing of a bust or torso, not just a doodle, an honest to goodness pen and ink drawing! (LIMITED AVAILABILITY!!!)

For $750, you can BE IN LONESTAR!  You'll either be a vampire or a victim in one of the upcoming LONESTAR books! 

Please check the perks out for more specific details!

STRETCH GOALS will be announced as we near them, including new trading cards, post cards, perhaps posters... but one goal is set in stone... 

The $60K stretch goal UNLOCKED: Caanan White trading card!

The $100K stretch goal is available as a new tier available through a secret perk option to those who have purchased Lonestar 2 through a secret perk option (check your email!).  THE INDIE COMICS CROSSOVER: MONSTER HUNT!  The secret perk is an add-on to your previous order with zero additional shipping no matter how many copies you order!

LONESTAR. JAWBREAKERS. GRAVEYARD SHIFT. Together in a single comic book for the first time. This EPIC HISTORIC COMIC will be written and illustrated by Mike S. Miller. Approved by Richard C. Meyer, Jon Malin, and Mark Poulton.  DO NOT MISS OUT!

Here are some pages from LONESTAR: SOUL OF THE SOLDIER. ALL PAGES ARE DONE!

Please check the perks out for more specific details!
STRETCH GOALS will be announced as we near them, including new trading cards, post cards, perhaps posters... but one goal is set in stone... 
The $60K stretch goal UNLOCKED: Caanan White trading card!

The $100K stretch goal is available as a new tier available through a secret perk option to those who have purchased Lonestar 2 through a secret perk option (check your email!).  THE INDIE COMICS CROSSOVER: MONSTER HUNT!  The secret perk is an add-on to your previous order with zero additional shipping no matter how many copies you order!
LONESTAR. JAWBREAKERS. GRAVEYARD SHIFT. Together in a single comic book for the first time. This EPIC HISTORIC COMIC will be written and illustrated by Mike S. Miller. Approved by Richard C. Meyer, Jon Malin, and Mark Poulton.  DO NOT MISS OUT!
Here are some pages from LONESTAR: SOUL OF THE SOLDIER. ALL PAGES ARE DONE!

story:
Short Summary

Hosted by, comedian Royale Watkins, The "Mixtape Comedy Show" is a multi-platform stand-up comedy & music show that takes place every third Sunday at New York's Gotham Comedy Club.  The show features four hilarious comics, a live band, musical performance, and one of New York City's most dynamic DJs! Several of your favorite comedians have graced Mixtape Comedy Show's stage including: Chris Rock, Tracy Morgan, Sherri Shepherd, Donnell Rawlings, Amy Schumer, and most notably... Jerry Seinfeld!!!

Having recently celebrated our 5th anniversary, we want to bring Mixtape Comedy to a television near you. 

We need your help to film the FIRST Mixtape Comedy Special!!!


What We Need & What You Get

All of the funds raised for this project will go towards covering the cost of production. I will NOT take any fees as host or producer. If we can raise $50,000 in 30 days there is an investor who is willing to match that with an additional $50,000 investment! This is why every dollar, every cent counts. We will produce this special, get it on TV and generate enough attention so that the Mixtape Comedy Show will become a weekly program. We're looking forward to bringing you your favorite comics and old school hip hop acts every week. 

Again, I will not take ANY fees whatsoever. The sole purpose of this campaign is to raise the initial $50,000. 

For your kind donations, you will receive the following:

$10 - Free download of comedy special

$25 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster

$50 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt

$100 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt, plus mention in special thanks

$500 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt, VIP table at taping, plus mention in special thanks

$1,000 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt, VIP seats at taping, VIP meet and greet and thanks in credits. 

$2,500 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt, mention in special thanks plus credit on screen and private screening of special with Royale Watkins.

$5,000 - Free download of comedy special, autographed poster, Mixtape Comedy T-shirt, mention in special thanks plus Producer credit on special and private screening of special with Royale Watkins and dinner for up to four people at restaurant in your hometown. And a Mixtape Comedy Tour jacket! 

$10,000 - I honestly don't think you need any of the shit listed, but I'll give it to you and my number so we can talk about a list of your other demands if there are any. 

The Impact

Your contributions will help establish a new platform for comedic talent across the globe to show their chops! We want the Mixtape Comedy Show to be your go-to source for established and breakout comedians and music talent to showcase their gifts!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to help with a monetary donation or not, please support us!

Tweet about it: @MixtapeComedy

Facebook us: Mixtape Comedy Show

Share our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

We are "Chevelin Illustration" and are passionate about illustration, painting and all related to the ninth art. Our mission is to create an haitian comic inspired by the haitian culture and history. Haitian culture and history are so rich that it could inspire generations to literary, film and comics. From the first wars between the "indians", Native of the Hispaniola Island, and the Spanish invaders, through the arrival of slaves from Africa, the wars for the occupation of the entire island between France, Spain and England, the revolution, the role of voodoo in this fight, our "loas", our myths and mythical stories, independence, and even after the independence of Haiti, all this is an invaluable resource for the creation of a comic book. 

Contributing to make this project come true will help us achieve a very high social, cultural and economical goal. We choose to promote the haitian culture and history by writing. By doing so, we'll help people discover this beautiful part that is characterizing Haiti. That will make people see the country with other eyes than the usual ones, we mean, the poverty-eyes. Contributors to this project will help boosting career of so many talented young writers and illustrators. 

What We Need & What We Get

We already have the writers, strong illustrators, graphists and correctors teams, a local. All we need is just financial resources for printing and for the distribution campaign. The several numeros we want to present are "Nicole la Fouyapot" (Tome 1 and 2), "Ti Mistè" (Tome 2), "la Legende des Tezens" (Tome 1 and 2) and Bizango 3 (Tome 3). 

They represent different stories but deeply related to the haitian culture and history. 

1- Nicole La Fouyapot is about "Nicole, a teenager who doesn't afraid of anything. She always dreamed to become a famous detective! From her window she can watch everything. She leads the investigation, deduct and alert "Tonton Barnave". What are these stiff body carried around by her strange neighbors across the street every night? Nicole is watching, and she promises to herself to discover the truth!

2- Bizango 3 is the following story began two episodes before. The Episode 2 tells a story about  the cell of a curious secret society of Rome which is planning to capture a certain sacred relic located in Haiti and very coveted. But the shadow of a terrible threat hanging over all these antagonists and their many plots. Why this relic is so sought after? What are the mysteries that surround it?


Bizango III

Bizango III

But Chevelin Illustration has already produced Bizango I and II. 

Bizango I The Indian and the former Slave

Bizango I The french army against former slaves

3- La légende des Tezens is a about a new world. A young haitian is coming back home (Petit-Goave) for a couple of days. He met this beautiful girl  that looks like his childhood friend Bianca. But, surprise! it was not his childhood friend but a creature from another world whom took a human look familiar to him. The young man discovered against his will a new world full of myths and intrigues. Why is it caught? What secret hides this species? Do the stories tell by his grandmother are real? 

Scene in "La Légende des Tezens"


Chevelin Illustration has developed differents characters, now comes the time to present them in finished comics story. 



Our budget :


The Impact

This project is very ambitious and challenging too. But we are sure about the impact it would have in the haitian society and even in the world. Haiti is a wonderful country, but poverty does not allow people to realize how great are the haitian culture and its history. Create an haitian comic is about to give faith to the young haitians in their peers. It is about to create success story, to demonstrate how talented people can succeed in Haiti, can be famous. It is about to reward talented writers, illustrators, graphists, etc... But the final goal is just this collective thought that we need to promote in us, the thought that Haitians can resolve their problems by themselves. Haiti needs to believe in its own resources, to believe in itself in order to move forward. 

This project can also contribute to present the haitian culture to whole world. Please note that the comics will be selling in the international market too. We already have different comics on itunes. Click on https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/bizango-2/id761925044?mt=11 and you'll can get the Bizango II. or click on https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/bizango-1/id727069880?mt=11 to buy the Bizango I. Now we want to bring you more and more comics.  

Risks & Challenges

Every project, how matter great, well elaborated and prepared, comes with risks. And more ambitious and challenging is the project, more risky it is. 

First of all, launching a typical haitian comic is something new within the haitian culture. Then, we need to establish a strong promotion campaign in order to attract people. But, we must admit that the fact it is new constitutes an advantage for us. 

The printing cost and promotion campaign are high, that is why we develop strategies to promote our books:

     1- We go toward the haitian schools in order to bring the books to the students;

     2- We publish on Facebook some preview related to our books which are seen                 by more than 10,000.00 people;

Other Ways You Can Help

Help is not necessarily about giving money. You can help us making this project true by :

  • getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign just by using the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

___________________________________________________________________________ 

FAQ 

1.- "I want to send you money but I do not want to give you my address, is that possible?" 

- Yes, however, we will not be able to send you your prize.

2.- "I cannot contribute with my credit card, what should I do?" 

 - You can contact us at our email address and we'll provide you more info for the cash transfer (bank account,...).

3.-"If you do not reach your goal of $ 40,000, does the project fall down?" 

- Of course not! the team has decided to give the Haitian players and the world of comics Haitian. Therefore, even if the paper magazine can not exist without the funds raised by the campaign, the site will take over and then the team will focus its energies on a way to boost the delivery method (YouTube channel, Facebook, iTunes, etc).

4.- "What guarantee me that you will not leave with the money once collected? 

- We have linked our identity with this project, and in addition, we have already started with the productions. Make use of this money for another purpose other than launching this haitian comic is not an option.

5.-“I am not in Haiti, but I would like to contribute and receive my prize, is that possible?0

-  You can contribute from any place on earth. For shipping you need to provide your address and add ten more dollars ($10).

6.- “My wife and I would like to jointly contribute to the “Platinum Contributor” package, how does it work?

-  You just have to contribute via a one credit card and you decide by yourselves how you are going to share the prizes within the package. However, you can have a common prize like the oil portrait (family one, your wife, your kids and you).

story:
THIRSTY?

 

VENGEANCE OF VAMPIRELLA, the new hit series from DYNAMITE COMICS, meets up with old friends CYBERFROG and SALAMANDROID again for a new variant cover collectible comic! This oughta hit the spot!

 

Hello again!  In anticipation of launching CYBERFROG 2: REKT PLANET on Sunday, March 15th, it's a good time to launch this little appetizer!  

CYBERFROG: BLOODHONEY is the biggest crowdfunded comic book of all time, and the hugely anticipated sequel is right around the corner.  To celebrate, here's a perfect snack: A new cover by me, Ethan Van Sciver, with Vampirella enjoying the honey Vyzpzz make of human blood (of course she'd enjoy it) with Salamandroid and Cyberfrog watching in the background!  Beautiful colors by KYLE RITTER!

 

I

 

I'll be offering the REGULAR version of this cover, a color version without the logo, a Black and White line art version, and signed versions as well!

 

Also, we're doing a t-shirt and two new coins!

story:
KIDZ OF THE KING

My name is Reginald Byers. I've professionally illustrated comic books since 1987. My passion other than drawing, is building up youth by teaching them social skills, character education and Christian discipleship.

KIDZ OF THE KING is a Christian themed comic book I created with my wife back in 1993. It started out featuring 4 superkids (who were actually angels) named TRUTH, FAITH, MERCY and ZEAL.

The comic book has been a blessing to thousands of kids all over the country!

The only problem is that is was released irregularly due to it being a part time concentration and limited funds.

Now 20 years later, we haven't given up contuing to do Kidz, but we need financial help to create a new on-going series that we will make available to customers via our website and direct to churches, ministries and parochial schools.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We are looking to raise $2000 to pay for printing costs for at least the first 3 issues (bi-monthly releases beginning September 2013). The copies will be sold to churches for their youth groups and will also be used as curriculum booklets for parochial after-school programs. The wholesale and retail prices of the books sold will garner enough returns to fund printing for subsequent issues.

We have wonderful perks for different levels of donations from signed copies of books, exclusive posters, original art from the books, to custom drawings featuring the characters of your choice from the series!

In the case we don't reach our goal, whatever funds are raised will go to printing at least the first and/or second issues of the series at lower numbers of copies. These copies will be signed and numbered short run special editions.

Should we exceed our goal, in addition to the new comic series, we will produce beautiful full color Kidz of the King posters as well as "Lil' Kidz" coloring books, a coloring book featuring little versions of the characters for K-1 age youth!

 

THE IMPACT

Your contribution to this project will not only help Kidz of the King remain steady and self sufficent, but will also aid in building up the spiritual and moral fiber in countless children in the USA and the world!

 

CAN'T CONTRIBUTE? GOT FRIENDS?

In these hard economic times, some may want to give, but can't. I understand. But if you are connected to many people in your social media network, please PASS us on to them! SHARE THE GOOD NEWS OF THIS CAMPAIGN!

FACEBOOK, TWITTER, LINKEDIN, AND THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!

By all means spread us around like jelly on bread! LOL

 

Thank you for listening and God bless you and keep you is our prayer!

story:
Who We Are

A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on KILLRAVEN and DR. STRANGE, he went on to become one of the pioneers in opening new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart (THE MAGIC FLUTE), Strauss (SALOME) and Wagner (THE RING OF THE NIBELUNG). He has illustrated classic comic-book characters as diverse as Elric, The Sandman, Conan, Batman, Hellboy and The Spirit. His more recent work includes comic book adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s CORALINE and THE GRAVEYARD BOOK.

 

ABOVE: P. Craig Russell examines his original art and supporting material for his 1988 comic-book adaptation of ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD while visiting the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum in Columbus, Ohio. The originals are on deposit at the library. Craig and his frequent collaborator, Wayne Alan Harold, recently took a road trip down to the library to temporarily "borrow" the pages so that the project can be restored using the original comic art boards.

Wayne Alan Harold’s collaborations with Russell have included the documentary NIGHT MUSIC: THE ART OF P. CRAIG RUSSELL, the five-volume instructional DVD series P. CRAIG RUSSELL’S GUIDE TO GRAPHIC STORYTELLING and the soon-to-be released hardcover P. CRAIG RUSSELL SKETCHBOOK ARCHIVES. The five instructional DVDs and the Sketchbook Archives were all made possible by successful crowd-funding campaigns. In addition to managing the campaign to fund this project, Wayne will also be doing the majority of the restoration work on the artwork itself, with direct supervision from PCR.
 

Our First Original Art Restoration Campaign

We are pleased to launch our SEVENTH crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the scanning, restoration and preservation of the original color art that P. Craig Russell created for his 1988 graphic-novel adaptation of Maurice Maeterlinck's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD. 

 

 

 


Editorial Reviews

"The prize of the book is a long, lush, magisterial adaptation of Dukas's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD, originally published in 1989. It's one of the most visual of operas, to begin with—half the plot has to do with the play of light—and Russell opens up and roars like a star tenor, fiercely stylizing everything from the opera's architecture to its sunbeams and indulging in wordless passages that let him cut loose with enormous spectacles." — Publisher's Weekly

"The closest Classics Illustrated  got to opera was "William Tell," adapting Schiller's play rather than Rossini's grandest work. Too bad, because opera is customarily visually opulent. But then, Classics Illustrated didn't have Russell, the most opulent contemporary realistic comics artist, who loves opera.  Dukas' crypto-feminist modification of Bluebeard, with its rooms full of gems, lets Russell indulge his lapidary flair and conjure a morbid decorativeness." — Booklist

 

PCR's Vintage Hand-Coloring Process

 

Back in the 1980s and early 90s, well before computer coloring, Craig decided that he wanted to hand-color a number of his creator-owned projects using mixed media to allow for more gradations in color, mood and effect. To start with, he had his original black-and-white line art reproduced on letter-sized sheets of clear plastic. He then placed that plastic copy over another piece of letter-sized art paper. When hand-coloring, he would lift the plastic sheet repeatedly, over and over and over again, so that he could apply the mixed-media color to the bottom sheet. It was an insanely time-intensive process, but the end results were uniquely and undeniably beautiful. When the art was published, it was shot from the reduced color “masters" with the reduced black & white linework overlaid via the plastic.
 

ABOVE: The original coloring for this panel shows major "mottling" and is in need of extensive repairs.
 
In recent years, this original original color art has deteriorated badly, with much of it becoming “mottled,” chipped, faded and decayed. The plastic overlays with the black and white line art have also yellowed, shrunk and flaked away. These first color "masters" are pretty much unusable for any future presentation of these groundbreaking stories. All are in dire need of both restoration and preservation. This includes the color art for such landmark projects as SALOME, THE MAGIC FLUTE, PELLEAS AND MELISANDE, THE JUNGLE BOOK, HUMAN REMAINS. THE GIFT OF THE MAGI and more. We will be attempting to restore and preserve all of these masterworks on a project-by-project basis, starting with 1988's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD. 
 

Scan of the original hand-colored art (with no black line) of the bottom of Ariane and Bluebeard page 2. The dark gray in the bottom panel is an example of 'mottling' and the need for restoration of the original coloring. The sticky adhesive on the back of the plastic Pantone sheets used to provide solid color to a particular area separates and curdles over the years. Digital attention, sampling the color, will remove the degeneration and restore it to its original appearance. Time consuming, but it works.
 
 

 

 

 

Our Restoration and Preservation Process

 

 

First, an “Artifact Scan” will be made of the original comic art page. While appearing to be in black and white, each original art page is scanned in color to show blue pencil and other corrections. This is to create a digital file of the original page for preservation and posterity:


The second step will be to create a second high resolution scan—this time in black & white—to capture Craig's black ink art in as pristine a manner as possible. The bitmap scan is then gone over with a fine-tooth “digital comb” to remove as many imperfections as possible—again, to capture the ink art as crisply and cleanly as possible:


We then take Craig's original mixed-media hand-coloring and scan it at a very high resolution. As stated before, much of the original coloring has decayed in the past few decades. As you can see on the following raw scan, the silhouette of the running men has “mottled.” This must be repaired digitally—not to make it look as if it has been computer colored, but rather to restore it to its original, beautifully organic appearance:


Finally, the super-sharp, original black line art is taken from our second scan and combined with the newly restored hand coloring in an all-new, high resolution digital file. This is the cleanest, clearest presentation that this stunning art has ever had—and it’s now beautifully restored and preserved for generations to come. We have already restored Page 1 as a sample and it can be seen as follows:

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

What We Need

 

This undertaking is obviously going to be extremely time-consuming, so we are raising funds for the restorations via a series of project-related campaigns. 

Please keep in mind that after we pay IndieGoGo fees, PayPal fees for credit card processing, income taxes (funds raised via crowdfunding campaigns are considered as income and thus are taxable) and the substantial costs of manufacturing and shipping our physical perks . . . not a lot of money is left over. After the dust clears, we still have to have sufficient funds remaining for the primary purpose of this campaign—the extensive restoration of the original ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD hand-colored artwork.

So we have to "price" our perks accordingly. We are unable to offer these physical goods at the price they would be offered for at brick and mortar retail stores or even via the product section of our websites. 

By supporting this campaign, you are making this project happen as a valued pledge partner. Our Artifact Prints and Artifact Folios are basically the equivalent of the books, calendars or mugs that viewers receive when donating to a PBS Pledge Drive. We hope that you will agree that our perks are much more unique and of long-lasting value.
story_txt:
Who We Are
A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on KILLRAVEN and DR. STRANGE, he went on to become one of the pioneers in opening new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart (THE MAGIC FLUTE), Strauss (SALOME) and Wagner (THE RING OF THE NIBELUNG). He has illustrated classic comic-book characters as diverse as Elric, The Sandman, Conan, Batman, Hellboy and The Spirit. His more recent work includes comic book adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s CORALINE and THE GRAVEYARD BOOK.
 

ABOVE: P. Craig Russell examines his original art and supporting material for his 1988 comic-book adaptation of ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD while visiting the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum in Columbus, Ohio. The originals are on deposit at the library. Craig and his frequent collaborator, Wayne Alan Harold, recently took a road trip down to the library to temporarily "borrow" the pages so that the project can be restored using the original comic art boards.

Wayne Alan Harold’s collaborations with Russell have included the documentary NIGHT MUSIC: THE ART OF P. CRAIG RUSSELL, the five-volume instructional DVD series P. CRAIG RUSSELL’S GUIDE TO GRAPHIC STORYTELLING and the soon-to-be released hardcover P. CRAIG RUSSELL SKETCHBOOK ARCHIVES. The five instructional DVDs and the Sketchbook Archives were all made possible by successful crowd-funding campaigns. In addition to managing the campaign to fund this project, Wayne will also be doing the majority of the restoration work on the artwork itself, with direct supervision from PCR. 
Our First Original Art Restoration Campaign
We are pleased to launch our SEVENTH crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the scanning, restoration and preservation of the original color art that P. Craig Russell created for his 1988 graphic-novel adaptation of Maurice Maeterlinck's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD. 

 
 

 

Editorial Reviews
"The prize of the book is a long, lush, magisterial adaptation of Dukas's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD, originally published in 1989. It's one of the most visual of operas, to begin with—half the plot has to do with the play of light—and Russell opens up and roars like a star tenor, fiercely stylizing everything from the opera's architecture to its sunbeams and indulging in wordless passages that let him cut loose with enormous spectacles." — Publisher's Weekly
"The closest Classics Illustrated  got to opera was "William Tell," adapting Schiller's play rather than Rossini's grandest work. Too bad, because opera is customarily visually opulent. But then, Classics Illustrated didn't have Russell, the most opulent contemporary realistic comics artist, who loves opera.  Dukas' crypto-feminist modification of Bluebeard, with its rooms full of gems, lets Russell indulge his lapidary flair and conjure a morbid decorativeness." — Booklist

When hand-coloring, he would lift the plastic sheet repeatedly, over and over and over again, so that he could apply the mixed-media color to the bottom sheet. It was an insanely time-intensive process, but the end results were uniquely and undeniably beautiful. When the art was published, it was shot from the reduced color “masters" with the reduced black & white linework overlaid via the plastic.
 

ABOVE: The original coloring for this panel shows major "mottling" and is in need of extensive repairs.
 
In recent years, this original original color art has deteriorated badly, with much of it becoming “mottled,” chipped, faded and decayed. The plastic overlays with the black and white line art have also yellowed, shrunk and flaked away. These first color "masters" are pretty much unusable for any future presentation of these groundbreaking stories. All are in dire need of both restoration and preservation. This includes the color art for such landmark projects as SALOME, THE MAGIC FLUTE, PELLEAS AND MELISANDE, THE JUNGLE BOOK, HUMAN REMAINS. THE GIFT OF THE MAGI and more. We will be attempting to restore and preserve all of these masterworks on a project-by-project basis, starting with 1988's ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD.  

Scan of the original hand-colored art (with no black line) of the bottom of Ariane and Bluebeard page 2. The dark gray in the bottom panel is an example of 'mottling' and the need for restoration of the original coloring. The sticky adhesive on the back of the plastic Pantone sheets used to provide solid color to a particular area separates and curdles over the years. Digital attention, sampling the color, will remove the degeneration and restore it to its original appearance. Time consuming, but it works.

The bitmap scan is then gone over with a fine-tooth “digital comb” to remove as many imperfections as possible—again, to capture the ink art as crisply and cleanly as possible:

story:
Overview

 

The future of comics in your hands!
We are trying to build a new paradigm in the global comic ecosystem,
and of course, we cannot do this without the participation of both artists and fans.
 

 

 

We are elevating the value of all spaces beyond reality.


ACON3D.COM  is an open platform for sharing 3D designs & models. We give new life to high-quality 3D models from the architecture and interior industry, where over 100,000 models are wasted each year.

Through us, we connect these 3D models to producers and artists of various ﬁelds who, with these models, can elevate their works with dramatically less time and eﬀort.

 


As part of our vision, we are encouraging change in the comic creation process; using ready-made models as a comic background to boost up productivity and elevate the working conditions of artists.

 

 
[A ready-made background model by lovegoood - 'Modern Cafe']

 

 

 

Build the Future of Comics with ACON3D.COM

 

We are confident that this easy method of comic creation will become the mainstream way in the future, and that this will be beneficial to artists and fans both. So then, why not speed it up?

By being a part of <Build the Future of Comics with ACON3D.COM> contest, you will literally be a part of BUILDING the future of this industry globally!

 

 

 

SUBMITTED COMIC PREVIEWS

MORE HERE : [Updates] 

VOTE : [Voting Page] *

* voting is only available for perk contributors (1 vote per person)

 

[LIST OF CONTESTANTS] (updated 7/29/2019)

#1. Jogam  #2. Manukahoney  #3. Garyeong  #4. Bueong  #5. Herz  #6. Hokkang

 

 

 

 

  • FANS : Vote for the preview comic of your choice, and spread the word!

 

  • ARTISTS : Draw & submit a preview of your work, using at least 1 scene with the ready-made BG given!

 

 

 

 

    1. Apply to get your free Ready-Made BG   :   [1-min application form]

         ACON3D will provide the ‘Modern Café’ model right after the application.

 

    2. Draw & Submit  :  By 8/15 24:00 (Seoul, GMT +9)

          Artists can submit their work from until August 15, 2019. During the submission period,

          entries will be updated at least once a week in the ‘Updates’ section.


    3. Votes   :   [Voting Page]

          Fans can vote for his/her favorite artist from July 29, 2019, to August 29, 2019.

          During the voting period, the status of the ballot tally will be announced once a day in the

           ‘Updates’ section.


   4. Winning works
         Winners will be announced on September 2, 2019.

         There will be a total of 4 winners for this contest :

                1st Place Award             #1 in total votes!

                2nd Place Award          #2 in total votes!

                Special Award               nominated for the uniqueness of drawing style or story!

                ACON Award                   honorable nomination from the ACON3D team!


   5. Reward / Prize   :   a total 40% of funding deposits* go to artists!

       Rewards will be in the production process right after the announcement of the winners.

        Sending & shipping is estimated to start in October, 2019.

        Prize money will be given to artists after the final submission of their work.

                1st Place Award             16% of funding deposits

                2nd Place Award          12% of funding deposits

                Special Award               8% of funding deposits

                ACON Award                  4% of funding deposits

        *funding deposits : actual amount deposited, excluding IGG / payment fees & tax

 

 

 

 

① ② Ready-made 3D models can form a better creating environment for an artist in helping them draw backgrounds easier with only three-steps of action; rotate, zoom and snap!

 

③ Better creating environments lead to comics of better quality.

 

④ Comics with better quality bring more fans into the field where they are in need. Fans will provide support in forms of more reaction, higher traffic, and even money.

 

⑤ This support becomes financial entice and fulfillment for the artist to be more involved in their work and creation, and will bring more & more artists, comic works, and fans into the cycle!

 

 

[Snapped 2D image of a 3D ready-made model by lovegoood]

 

 

 

The ACON3D Team has experienced the exact same evolution in comic creating environment in Korea. 

Previously, there were productivity issues concerning the working condition of webtoon artists, since they had to publish work every week at a set time with low levels of profit. In the process, drawing backgrounds was the biggest obstacle; as it was not the main part of their work, but took an average of 2~3 hours for each scene.

A few artists started to utilize 3D models for their backgrounds, and created their webtoons in an easier and faster manner; as fast as 2-3 MINUTES for each scene! This shifted the ecosystem of webtoon creation. Artists were able to update work on time, with better quality, and this brought in more fans into the comic world - bringing in more artists, and even more fans!

Naturally, the webtoon market grew more than 5 times bigger in just 5 years! Here, ACON3D is helping artists find the ready-made 3D model they need by gathering models in an easy-to-access platform(where selections are rapidly growing!).

 

 

So, if this has been the case in one country, why wouldn't it happen worldwide?

WE WANT YOU TO BE A PART OF THE MOVEMENT!

 

 

 

 

 

1. Apply 

    Submit application form through this [1-min application form]

 

2. Receive ready-made model 

     ACON3D will provide the ‘Modern Café’ sample model made by lovegoood.

     The mode is constituted of monotone furniture and interior that give a nice and neat mood.

 

3. Draw Preview

     1) Draw at least 2 frames of the comic preview and

     2) write a short synopsis of the complete story.

     - At least one frame should set ‘Modern Cafe’ as a background.

 

4. Submit

     - Submit both 1) the image file and 2) synopsis to contact@acon3d.com.

     - Files should be submitted in PNG format / 720px width / 72dpi (at least). 

 

5. Win

     Winners will be chosen by vote (1st, 2nd) or by us (Special, ACON Pick)

     - Artists can freely use ACON3D’s posts uploaded on SNS channels

        (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook) which will lead to more excitement!

    - Winners will be awarded with 40% of the total funding deposits.

 

6. Finish Story

     Once awarded as a winner, artists need to complete their story for publishing!

     We recommend for completed work to be at least 40 frames.

     Prize money will be given only to artists who finish their work!

 

7. Publish

    The finished four winning works will compiled as a book titled ‘Build the Future of Comics.’

 

 

 

 

Winners will receive prize money and a printed book of their work.

Prize money will be given to artists after the final submission of their work.

 

The prize money will be a total 40% of funding deposits*

                1st Place Award             16% of funding deposits

                2nd Place Award          12% of funding deposits

                Special Award               8% of funding deposits

                ACON Award                  4% of funding deposits

        *funding deposits : actual amount deposited, excluding IGG / payment fees & tax

 

Remember : not only winners, but all participants will get a chance to earn global fans from more than 200 countries.

 

 

 

 

1. Choose a Preview

    Read through all the entries and choose the best preview of your choice.

 

2. Buy a Perk

     Choose a perk and contribute, in order to vote for your favorite work.

 

3. Vote : [Voting Page]

     Vote for your favorite work at the voting page! You must have your Contribution ID 

     (received when you contribute to a perk!)

 

4. Share

    To give more support to your artist, and build more excitement to this campaign,

    like and share the posting of your artist on ACON3D SNS channels

    (Twitter / Instagram / Facebook).

 

5. Get Your Perk

     You will receive your perk once the production of ‘Build he Future of Comics’ is completed.

     (Expected to be in October, 2019)

 

 

 

  • VOTE ONLY

​        Thanks for joining our contest! After contributing with this perk, go to our

        [Voting Page] and vote for the artist of your taste. Your precious vote will

         make the future of comics better and brighter. 

 

  • eBook

         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’

         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners.

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].       

                                                                                                         

  • eBook Special

         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including

         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.

         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners.

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].  

 

 

 

  • eBook Creator ver.

         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’

         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners

         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].       

 

  • eBook Creator Premium

         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including

         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.

         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners

         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].    

 

  • Printed Book

         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’

         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners

         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].       

 

 

  • Printed Book Premium

         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including

         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.

         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners

         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].  

 

  • Printed Book VIP

         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including

         a chance to include a 1-page long VIP special shout-out in the book.

         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners

         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!

          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].  

 

  • Super Sponsor

         Take our campaign to another level by becoming our Super Sponsor!

         There will be a Special section to introduce our Super Sponsor in the book!  

 

  • Diamond Sponsor

         Take our campaign to another level by becoming our Diamond Sponsor!

         There will be a VERY Special section to introduce our Diamond Sponsor in the book!  

 

 

 

 

 

SO...

How do you use ready-made 3D models for comic backgrounds... in detail?

 

A. Here is a very light overview of how to snap a scene from the ready-made model for your background.

     We will be opening an extended version,and subtitled versions as STRETCH GOALS, 

     so please stay tuned!

 

 

 

 

      STRETCH GOALS

                  150%        Extended HOW-TO on using ready-made 3D models

                  250%       English subtitles added!

                  350%         Subtitled videos in French, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese added!

                  450%         Additional subtitled videos in (most) all languages requested!

 

 

 

 

 

OTHER WAYS TO SPREAD THE WORD!

 

Thank you for making it all the way down here!

We really appreciate your attention and support. ACON3D is hoping to elevate drawing environments of comic artists, so that many more great stories can be told to the world!

 

We would also appreciate your contribution on social media and spreading the word on communities that are loved by comic artists around the world.

 

 

You can SHARE this campaign by

  • going back to the top of this page to share on SNS (Facebook, Twitter, etc)
  • using this shortened link of the campaign below to share anywhere!

         : https://igg.me/at/acon3d/x/22130534#/

Fans will provide support in forms of more reaction, higher traffic, and even money. ⑤ This support becomes financial entice and fulfillment for the artist to be more involved in their work and creation, and will bring more & more artists, comic works, and fans into the cycle!  [Snapped 2D image of a 3D ready-made model by lovegoood]   The ACON3D Team has experienced the exact same evolution in comic creating environment in Korea. Previously, there were productivity issues concerning the working condition of webtoon artists, since they had to publish work every week at a set time with low levels of profit. In the process, drawing backgrounds was the biggest obstacle; as it was not the main part of their work, but took an average of 2~3 hours for each scene.A few artists started to utilize 3D models for their backgrounds, and created their webtoons in an easier and faster manner; as fast as 2-3 MINUTES for each scene! This shifted the ecosystem of webtoon creation. Artists were able to update work on time, with better quality, and this brought in more fans into the comic world - bringing in more artists, and even more fans!Naturally, the webtoon market grew more than 5 times bigger in just 5 years! Here, ACON3D is helping artists find the ready-made 3D model they need by gathering models in an easy-to-access platform(where selections are rapidly growing!).  So, if this has been the case in one country, why wouldn't it happen worldwide?WE WANT YOU TO BE A PART OF THE MOVEMENT!     1. Apply     Submit application form through this [1-min application form] 2. Receive ready-made model      ACON3D will provide the ‘Modern Café’ sample model made by lovegoood.     The mode is constituted of monotone furniture and interior that give a nice and neat mood. 3. Draw Preview     1) Draw at least 2 frames of the comic preview and     2) write a short synopsis of the complete story.     - At least one frame should set ‘Modern Cafe’ as a background. 4. Submit     - Submit both 1) the image file and 2) synopsis to contact@acon3d.com.     - Files should be submitted in PNG format / 720px width / 72dpi (at least).  5. Win     Winners will be chosen by vote (1st, 2nd) or by us (Special, ACON Pick)     - Artists can freely use ACON3D’s posts uploaded on SNS channels        (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook) which will lead to more excitement!    - Winners will be awarded with 40% of the total funding deposits. 6. Finish Story     Once awarded as a winner, artists need to complete their story for publishing!     We recommend for completed work to be at least 40 frames.     Prize money will be given only to artists who finish their work! 7. Publish    The finished four winning works will compiled as a book titled ‘Build the Future of Comics.’    Winners will receive prize money and a printed book of their work.Prize money will be given to artists after the final submission of their work. The prize money will be a total 40% of funding deposits*                1st Place Award             16% of funding deposits                2nd Place Award          12% of funding deposits                Special Award               8% of funding deposits                ACON Award                  4% of funding deposits        *funding deposits : actual amount deposited, excluding IGG / payment fees & tax Remember : not only winners, but all participants will get a chance to earn global fans from more than 200 countries.    1. Choose a Preview    Read through all the entries and choose the best preview of your choice. 2. Buy a Perk     Choose a perk and contribute, in order to vote for your favorite work. 3. Vote : [Voting Page]     Vote for your favorite work at the voting page! You must have your Contribution ID      (received when you contribute to a perk!) 4. Share    To give more support to your artist, and build more excitement to this campaign,    like and share the posting of your artist on ACON3D SNS channels    (Twitter / Instagram / Facebook). 5. Get Your Perk     You will receive your perk once the production of ‘Build he Future of Comics’ is completed.     (Expected to be in October, 2019)   VOTE ONLY​        Thanks for joining our contest! After contributing with this perk, go to our        [Voting Page] and vote for the artist of your taste. Your precious vote will         make the future of comics better and brighter.  eBook         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners.          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].                                                                                                                eBook Special         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners.          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].     eBook Creator ver.         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].        eBook Creator Premium         You will receive an eBook version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].     Printed Book         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics.’         ‘Build the Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].         Printed Book Premium         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including         a chance to include a special shout-out in the book.         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].   Printed Book VIP         You will receive a printed version of ‘Build the Future of Comics’ including         a chance to include a 1-page long VIP special shout-out in the book.         ‘The Future of Comics’ will include four completed works of winners         and a guide for using ready-made models in your work!          You will also be able to vote, at our [Voting Page].   Super Sponsor         Take our campaign to another level by becoming our Super Sponsor!         There will be a Special section to introduce our Super Sponsor in the book!   Diamond Sponsor         Take our campaign to another level by becoming our Diamond Sponsor!         There will be a VERY Special section to introduce our Diamond Sponsor in the book!       SO...How do you use ready-made 3D models for comic backgrounds... in detail? A. Here is a very light overview of how to snap a scene from the ready-made model for your background.     We will be opening an extended version,and subtitled versions as STRETCH GOALS,      so please stay tuned!          STRETCH GOALS
                  150%        Extended HOW-TO on using ready-made 3D models                  250%       English subtitles added!                  350%         Subtitled videos in French, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese added!                  450%         Additional subtitled videos in (most) all languages requested!     OTHER WAYS TO SPREAD THE WORD! Thank you for making it all the way down here!We really appreciate your attention and support. ACON3D is hoping to elevate drawing environments of comic artists, so that many more great stories can be told to the world! We would also appreciate your contribution on social media and spreading the word on communities that are loved by comic artists around the world.  You can SHARE this campaign by
going back to the top of this page to share on SNS (Facebook, Twitter, etc)
using this shortened link of the campaign below to share anywhere!
         : https://igg.me/at/acon3d/x/22130534#/

story:
IN·VO·CA·TION [in-vuh-key-shuh n]

the action of summoning, for aid or protection, a deity, spirit, or the supernatural.


        


WHO WE ARE:

A.D. Banker: Creator/Writer/Art Director
http://twitter.com/alpabanker

Laura Ferguson: Illustrator 
lferguson3d.weebly.com


GEEK SQUAD / CAMPAIGN HEROES:
Robert Panico: Co-Producer/CONbassador 
http://scorpiusproductions.com

Yonas Michael: Marketing Juggernaut 
http://yonasmichaeltv.com

Mariah Tedder: SocialMediaGoddess 
http://twitter.com/mariahtedder

Anjeli Singh: Promotional Prefect (Ravenclaw)

https://twitter.com/Anjeli_86




WHY WE NEED & APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT: 
Entertainment is a platform for GAME-CHANGING. 
As a creator, if you want to effect change in the world, you have the power to create something that celebrates what you like, while offering a different perspective on what you think could be better. 
As an audience member, your support and viewership are literally your votes for what you like to see and how you want to see things evolve. 

BLOOD QUEEN VOL. 1 offers fans of comic-based movies a gateway into the graphic novel world, while offering fans of the latter world a unique visual experience, a fresh new take on the genre, and most importantly: a fresh new hero. 

With your support, we can bring this vision to life: in the graphic novel world, and BEYOND...!!!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT WE'LL DO WITH IT: 

-IF WE REACH OUR GOAL OF $3500: we will cover the illustrator's fee; the Indigogo + Paypal fees; and any additional marketing/production costs.

-IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL: we'll have to pay Indigogo a LAME additional 9% fee + Paypal fees + Feel sad about it :-( 

-IF WE EXCEED OUR GOAL: we can start production right away and use any extra funds to begin Volume 2 of this 3-part series!! YAY!!! 

-WHAT WE'RE CAPABLE OF: we've kept the funding goal down to the bare minimum so that we can reach our goal faster and start production sooner. 

We created the campaign teaser with literally a $0 budget and a 2-person crew...imagine what we can do with more!!!  


UPDATE: A VERY SPECIAL THANK YOU TO ALL OF OUR AWESOME SUPPORTERS FOR HELPING US REACH OUR GOAL!!!!

story:
Hey there, I'm BZ Cullins, an actor, writer, producer and voice talent. 

I've written a-day-in-the-life short film based on the DC Comics character, John Stewart, The Green Lantern. As a voice talent, I'd longed to voice the animated character, until one day, a wild hair crept up and said, "Hey! Forget about voicing John Stewart, BE John Stewart!" And here we are.

John Stewart was introduced in 1971, but didn't get much recognition until he was made a series regular in the animated hit Justice League/Justice League Unlimited from 2001-2004 on Cartoon Network. Since then, the character has become immensely popular. Comic book fans, like myself, the world over, are in dire need to see this character come to the live screen. And here we are.

We have one film starring the character recently released online and it's doing very well. So much so, it's been written up in DC Comics News.

The article:

https://dccomicsnews.com/2021/01/06/in-brightes...

 

What We Need 

We need to raise $11,000  in order to shoot the film. Shooting will take place In Las Vegas as soon as possible.   

Covered costs...

Equipment, props, location rentals, food, cast (all parts paid), crew, insurance, pre and post production and distribution. Your generosity will help fund a project that will definitely geek out the multitude.

In return, you can choose from the different perks that allows you to be a part of our process.

The Cast

BZ Cullins - John Stewart

Nina Fechner - Shayera Hol/Hawkgirl  (Voice)

Chris Warren - Hal Jordan

Mark Justice - Kyle Rayner

Gus Langley - Guy Gardner

Karen Salazar - Jessica Cruz

? - Simon Baz

John McClain - Alan Scott

TJ Wimbs - Standby

The Impact

Plainly. Simply. We want to make comic book fans giddy. We have everything  in place and ready to go! Cast, crew, crafty, locations, props, all dat!! Being fan films, we're not allowed to make profits, but we can use your help in order for these stories to be told!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute funds, but social outreach to people who can will be just as great.  Please tweet, Facebook, Instagram, tumblr, about this project as much as you can. 

Bless you and Thank you again for your contributions!!!

story:
This will be a full-color reprint of the original Stump comic book (first printed in black-&-white, in 2013), with new story pages, revised dialog, and a new cover.

The majority of the book is done.  I'm currently adding more pages to punch up the action and show more of Stump's origin.  The first printing was 28 pages, but the book is currently sitting at 32 pages, with more being added.  I've also increased the font size, which requires me to rewrite almost all of the dialog.  

Since, I am doing all of the writing, art, coloring, and lettering myself, I am able to keep my costs low.  So, my primary funding goal is to cover the printing costs and postage for mailing the book out to backers.  Fulfillment will be my number one priority.  After that, if I can make enough of a profit to continue creating new issues of Stump, that would be a dream come true.

Stump is a superhero that I created, in 1993, while I was in the Army and it's always been my dream to make a comic book series with him as the starring character.  In addition to completing issue #1 for this campaign, I am also working on writing and drawing out issue #2 (with a few pages of issue 2 already drawn out).  My plan is to start a second campaign for Stump #2 as soon as this campaign is successfully completed and in fulfillment.  Then I hope to do it all again for issues 3, 4, 5 and so on.

I would love to spend the rest of my life drawing Stump comics, but I need your help to do that.  Thank you for your time and consideration.

Here are three pages of the new artwork that is being added to the book:

story:
Closing Soon!

You still got a bit of time to get Volume 1! The signup page for Volume 2 is up right now and is launching soonish!

CLICK HERE TO SIGNUP FOR VOLUME 2

Overview

SLAUGHTER SQUAD is a 48-page action-packed gorefest with a healthy dose of black humor!

Somewhere in Texas, a team of livestock with nothing to lose takes on the forces of Big Meat, armed with nothing but horns and bad attitude. And a machine gun.

Covers

Variant 1

by Joseph King, Colors by Steve Canon

Variant 2

by Dax Martian

Interior Art

 

Pinups

\

Volume One is a double feature including:


Part One: "Out of the Frying Pan, Into the Meatgrinder"

The Squad goes on the first mission: rescue and recruit livestock. But its a trap!

Part Two: "Showdown with El Lobo"

An army needs weapons, so they steal a shipment from a Mexican cartel. They don't take kindly to thieves.

Stretch Goals

Everyone gets an upgrade when we hit these goals! (physical backers only)

3K - Perfect Bound UNLOCKED

4K - Stickers UNLOCKED

5K - Bookmark

6K - Trading Card (different from the signup card)

7K - Animated Wallpaper

8K - Patch

The Team

Written and illustrated by Joseph King, a professional animator of 12 years (RICK AND MORTY, FINAL SPACE, BRICKLEBERRY, LAB ZERO GAMES, HARMONQUEST and more).

Additional colors by Steve Cannon (Monster MD, Steel Cowboy)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
This handy one stop shopping link will take you to all the free bonus previews and updates and other campaign extras and periphery that I will be updating throughout the month of DESPAIR vol. 3.

Some kind words/gestures for DESPAIR, previous:

"The Black Riders and Other Lines," from Despair vol. 1, a "Notable Comic," from The Best American Comics 2014, Series Editor, Bill Kartalopoulos
"Dockery's  books are far from perfect, but they give a sense that he is on a mission...I'd say he's probably just crazy—often it amounts to the same thing."  Aaron Lange
"Dockery’s roads map the South beyond Gothic into the teratogenic. They extend the polite dreams of the Surrealists into preternatural nightmare. You laugh here – and immediately consider critical self-examination." Bob Levin, The Comics Journal

THE MISSION, THE MESSAGE:

I, J.T. Dockery, have gathered my own inks and the force of inks of the of others to publish two volumes in two years and now the third, and final volume, in a third year, under the Despair mantle.  An exegesis on the titular subject, a ritual, an ink as blood sacrifice, not to wallow in the subject matter but use metaphor/s in  comics/s from to work through it, grapple with it.

I have used and now am using for the third, and final time, the crowdfunding model to raise money for printing by virtue of preorders and affordable original art in various price packages.  This serves both the ability to produce the work in the format I believe most fully serves the content without concern to the somewhat arbitrary limitations of commercial publishing and serves the ability to be able to fund this dream as I am a disabled artist, in the government designation of the term these last four to five years, drawing through arthritis, as I have created through arthritic hands all of my adult life.

THE MONEY:

2,038.61 dollars is needed for the print job of 250 copies, the estimate from the printer.  I am using the same local printer I have used previously for IN TONGUES ILLUSTRATED, SPUD CRAZY, and the previous two volumes of DESPAIR. 

Additional money above printing costs is to pay my guest artists for their contributions, and to be used towards promotion and travel of the finished book.

WHAT YOU GET IS A 38 PAGE OVERSIZED 9 BY 12 INCH SUBVERSIVE UNDERGROUND COMIC BOOK IN GLORIOUS BLACK AND WHITE: 

There is no such thing as failure.  The book will be printed.  All orders will be honored/fulfilled.  My track record for the previous two volumes is the proof/the track record I can provide.

I have partnered with Institute 193 on these three volumes as de facto "publisher," but being a non profit, they serve in a capacity of moral support and after the fact distribution; it is strictly my own burden to make the book happen.

THE GUEST ARTISTS:

The special guests to "share the Despair" for this volume are:

Jeremy Baum

Eamon Espey

Liv Valasco

Nikolina Serdar-Kissel.  In this case, a woman of letters, born of Croatia, living in Germany, currently at large in the Old World, with whom I've collaborated to illustrate a tale from her secret book of dreams.

THE LIVING ORGANISM:

Throughout the month of this campaign, I'll be providing all manner of updates and content, including spotlights on the guest artists, even making the entirety of my own work from the volume available for free online to preview.  

SHARE THE DESPAIR:

Are you into the idea, the art/artists, but desperately devoid of scratch?  I feel ya. But telling your friends, whether it's whispering directly in their ears, pointing in my general direction and/or linking to this campaign via your preferred social media network helps a lot and is much appreciated.  We here at Doc Industries accept help and well wishes in any form which they arrive.
story_txt:
This handy one stop shopping link will take you to all the free bonus previews and updates and other campaign extras and periphery that I will be updating throughout the month of DESPAIR vol. 3.



Some kind words/gestures for DESPAIR, previous:

"The Black Riders and Other Lines," from Despair vol. 1, a "Notable Comic," from The Best American Comics 2014, Series Editor, Bill Kartalopoulos
"Dockery's  books are far from perfect, but they give a sense that he is on a mission...I'd say he's probably just crazy—often it amounts to the same thing."  Aaron Lange
"Dockery’s roads map the South beyond Gothic into the teratogenic. They extend the polite dreams of the Surrealists into preternatural nightmare. You laugh here – and immediately consider critical self-examination." Bob Levin, The Comics Journal

THE MISSION, THE MESSAGE:
I, J.T. Dockery, have gathered my own inks and the force of inks of the of others to publish two volumes in two years and now the third, and final volume, in a third year, under the Despair mantle.  An exegesis on the titular subject, a ritual, an ink as blood sacrifice, not to wallow in the subject matter but use metaphor/s in  comics/s from to work through it, grapple with it.
I have used and now am using for the third, and final time, the crowdfunding model to raise money for printing by virtue of preorders and affordable original art in various price packages.  This serves both the ability to produce the work in the format I believe most fully serves the content without concern to the somewhat arbitrary limitations of commercial publishing and serves the ability to be able to fund this dream as I am a disabled artist, in the government designation of the term these last four to five years, drawing through arthritis, as I have created through arthritic hands all of my adult life.

THE MONEY:
2,038.61 dollars is needed for the print job of 250 copies, the estimate from the printer.  I am using the same local printer I have used previously for IN TONGUES ILLUSTRATED, SPUD CRAZY, and the previous two volumes of DESPAIR. 
Additional money above printing costs is to pay my guest artists for their contributions, and to be used towards promotion and travel of the finished book.
WHAT YOU GET IS A 38 PAGE OVERSIZED 9 BY 12 INCH SUBVERSIVE UNDERGROUND COMIC BOOK IN GLORIOUS BLACK AND WHITE: 
There is no such thing as failure.  The book will be printed.  All orders will be honored/fulfilled.  My track record for the previous two volumes is the proof/the track record I can provide.
I have partnered with Institute 193 on these three volumes as de facto "publisher," but being a non profit, they serve in a capacity of moral support and after the fact distribution; it is strictly my own burden to make the book happen.

Jeremy Baum


Eamon Espey


Liv Valasco

Nikolina Serdar-Kissel.  In this case, a woman of letters, born of Croatia, living in Germany, currently at large in the Old World, with whom I've collaborated to illustrate a tale from her secret book of dreams.

THE LIVING ORGANISM:
Throughout the month of this campaign, I'll be providing all manner of updates and content, including spotlights on the guest artists, even making the entirety of my own work from the volume available for free online to preview.     SHARE THE DESPAIR:

But telling your friends, whether it's whispering directly in their ears, pointing in my general direction and/or linking to this campaign via your preferred social media network helps a lot and is much appreciated.  We here at Doc Industries accept help and well wishes in any form which they arrive.

story:
THANK YOU!!!

We have successfuly completed our campaign.  We're finishing the last revision/editing/translation check. The comic will enter the printing house on January the 20th and we hope to ship everything by the 23th. So everyone should have their reward by the end of the month as planned.


Prostitutes, violence, rough sex, unpredictable animals! Welcome to the first edition of the Unpopular Tales, in which red Riding Hood works in Granma's brothel and is terrorized by Jack Lumber.  40 pages of adult guilty pleasures!

                                                                                                        (paperback edition) 

    Sounds bizarre right? This is the first series on a whole new visions of the classical tales. 


But hold your horses. We need to assure production and distribution costs first so check our rewards and help us bring the real stories to life!  With Christmas just around the corner why don't you make a comic fan happy with a one of a kind gift?? 

In case we don't reach our goal, we would fulfill our rewards and develope the series to a longer electronic format and we'll add more tales. 

If you can't contribute directly please spread the word around! THANK YOU!!




IMPORTANT: ALL PACKAGES SENT OUTSIDE CONTINENTAL EUROPE MUST ADD THE EXTRA SHIPPING AND HANDLING FEES (15$)

story:
READ DYNAMITE BOOKS NOW!  IT'S EASY TO CATCH UP ON TITLES YOU MISSED!

(BUT ONLY FOR A LIMITED TIME & LIMITED QUANTITIES)

Dynamite Comics, and the rest of the industry's comic publishers have had their new comics halted when distribution went on hiatus a few weeks ago. Some comic shops are still open and selling some items, but most shops are not, and that means it's harder for any fan to get their weekly "comic fix".

This is the destination for fans who are looking for new and exciting titles to entertain them during this strange time. Dynamite is offering some of the best titles from our inventory at amazing discounts, and delivered straight to your door in a matter of weeks!

Because we're trying to fulfill your orders right away, we are limited on the stock readily available to us so most of these books will sell-out fast!

GRAPHIC NOVEL MYSTERY BOX

Have us send you a package of 3 randomly selected PAPERBACKS and 2 HARDCOVERS for just $20 and fill your days in quarantine with a great start to some amazing stories. Each box contains a great selection among fantasy, science fiction, horror, action, and... of course, superheroes. The titles in this pack will not be any of the same titles listed below.

EASILY MAKE THE MYSTERY BOX AN ADD-ON TO ANY BOOK ORDER DURING CHECKOUT!

OTHER PREMIUM TITLES

Click on any title to learn more about the book and see interiors pages before you order!

The Romita Legacy

Red Sonja: Scorched Earth by Mark Russell

Art of Atari

Dynamite's Art of Alex Ross 

Art of Sean Phillips 

Art of Howard Chaykin 

Art of Troma 

Gumby Imagined: The Story of Art Clokey & His Creations

Tens Frames Per Second (The Photography of SgtBananas)

WHAT'S GOING ON IN COMICS DURING THE PANDEMIC?

The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the entire world in a variety of ways and the comics industry is a market that's suffering greatly right now. With comic shops forced to close their doors for safety, and their main source of distribution on hiatus, publishers and creators are feeling the strain. The passion of comic readers has always been a driving force for the comics business, but direct, online support from fans is now essential to the current state of the business. If the comic industry is going to survive this pandemic, the fans will be the ones keeping creators and publishers in business!

"This is an unprecedented era in the comics industry and community," said Nick Barrucci, Dynamite CEO and Publisher. "Everyone from publishers to fans and others are having to be creative in keeping those treasured connections between us and the comics flowing. This Indiegogo option allows us to support fans with great deals and vice versa, keeping everyone excited to read more and ready to return to their Local Comic Shop once this pandemic is over. Comics will come out on the other side of this stronger than before." - Nick Barrucci CEO of Dynamite Entertainment

RISK & CHALLENGES

This campaign was designed to provide fans with quick fulfillment on books that are already available and ready to fulfill as soon as orders are processed at Indiegogo. With no printers involved, delays in fulfillment would be due to possible issues with mail services, but none are expected at this time.

story:
In February of 2012, an enterprising young comics fan named Hannah found herself wishing for a community where she could talk to other awesome women about shared nerdy loves.  Thus, Ladies' Night at Graham Cracker Comics was born!

Three years later, and we are putting together the third volume of an anthology that features original comics from more than twenty contributors.  This volume is your guide to all things magic and mystical--think of it as wizarding school with a much better deal on tuition.


To make all this awesomeness happen, we need some cash on hand to print the book and some amazing original artwork in the form of prints, stickers, and patches.  Your contribution to our $2500 goal will help us with:

  • First run print of Volume 3, How to Magic: A Complete Guide.
  • Hundreds of stickers and prints to send to our campaign contributors and sell along with the book.
  • Marketing online and in person at events like C2E2 (Chicago Comics and Entertainment Expo) and Free Comic Book Day.

Any money left over will contribute to starting up a fourth (and fifth) volume of the anthology as well as running our meetings--all of our contributors are volunteering their time and talent.


Contribute at any level and you get the digital PDF of the full anthology, but there's also a bunch of amazing swag and art that is available.  We're even taking advertisers to help defer the cost of printing.

There are may levels at which you can contribute, each more enchanting than the last. Check out just some of the perks available below!

We have so many wonderful pieces of art from which to choose for our 8x10 print perk! But once it is determined, we will share the selection as an update, along with previews of finished sequential artwork as it is completed. 

International supporters PLEASE NOTE: if you need to ship internationally, please add $10 to your contribution.


$3000 will mean we can print a 'zine of all the amazing art submissions to Volume 3! We had over 30 immensely talented women submit amazing art pitches to try to get into the anthology--with only ten spots available, there were far more creators than we could feature.  But with a little extra funding we can print a whole slew of 'zines (short for magazine) featuring their hard work! Anyone at the $50 backer level will get the zine if we reach this stretch goal.
$4000 will allow us to get a reprint of Volume 1: Chicago. We are currently down to a couple dozen copies of Volume 1, and if we reach $3500, everyone that contributes $50 or more will get  a copy of Vol 1 (or Vol 2, if they prefer) in addition to their other perks.

The Impact

We all know that women and other minorities are grossly under-represented in mainstream comics.  The success of Womanthology and similar books prove that this doesn't need to be the case! Whether you exclusively read superhero titles from the Big Two or you're an avid webcomic fan, every fan wants a place to feel like they belong, surrounded by other enthusiasts.  Our goal is to continue our ongoing anthology that features the amazing talents of women who love comics in every form they come in, and the much-needed diversity that they have to offer to the industry.

Let's show the big guys how it's done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily at this time, please help us spread the word!  We have a Facebook page and a website to tell you more about GCC Ladies' Night and our awesome community of readers.

Regardless, we hope to see you at our next Ladies' Night!

We wouldn't be this excited about How to Magic if it wasn't for the immensely talented creators working on the book! Meet the many women that are making indie-comic magic with your help: 

Alexis Cooke
Amber Huff
Amy Dittmeier
Brittany Peer
Dayna Smith
Emily Rosen
 Gi Devine

Heather Kenealy
Jenn Woodall
Kelly Smith
Laura Neubert
Lindsey Richter
Mandie Brasington
Marie Vibbert

Mary Verhoeven
Monica Ras
Rachel Simon
Sandra Rós Björnsdóttir
Shawnee Gibbs
Shawnelle Gibbs
Stephanie Hall

with editors

Caitlin Rosberg
Kris MacKenzie
Lauren Burke
Megan Byrd
Summer Sparacin

And special thanks to Amanda K. Schwarz, Anissa Espinosa, Cameron Keleher, and Lisa Kwon.
