story:
All new 5 Series Digital Comic Book Launch

Founded by a team of writers and artists, Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC or D.P.M. in short, is "IMAGINATION UNLEASHED".
At D.P.M. we are working to bring you original stories set in brand new realities that will always entertain, sometimes inform, and perhaps on occasion even provoke.
We love comics and telling stories through art as much as you do, and we intend to bring that passion to each and every series we produce.
We at D.P.M. are looking to you to help us bring to market an initial launch of five comic book titles. Much of the work is already done, and we just need some capital to help carry us across the finish line, but more on that later. First, who are the guys who make up Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC?

The D.P.M. Team!


Glenn E. Smith - Served in the United States Army in Korea and the continental United States, and with the United States Air Force / Air National Guard, deploying overseas twice under Operation Enduring Freedom following the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. He holds an Associate Degree in Law Enforcement and a Bachelor Degree in Business Management, but writing is his passion. He is a published novelist and often cannot seem to write fast enough to keep up with all the stories in his head.
Glenn started writing at the age of 14, but didn’t seriously consider striving toward getting published until well into his twenties. He began writing "Star Trek Phase II: Illustrated" in 2010, and that venture led him to found Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC with that title’s artist, Bill Lutz, and "Star Trek Phase II" actor Charles Root. Glenn’s goal for the company is to present intriguing stories in the science-fiction, fantasy, mystery, and paranormal genres that will entertain readers to the fullest.

Bill Lutz – Works as an independent illustrator and cartoonist. He has been working both for fun and professionally for the last twenty years. He graduated from the School of Visual Arts in New York City in 1988 with a degree in Illustration and Design with a minor in Creative Writing.
Bill has been a fan of comic books since he purchased his first "Fantastic Four" comic book back in the 1970s at age 12. He has been drawing since he was six years old. He began drawing "Star Trek Phase II: Illustrated" back in 2010, which eventually lead to a partnership with Glenn and the forming of Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC. Bill is looking forward to releasing new titles, including his long awaited "Return of the Frontiersmen," and to supervising new artwork and digital comics through Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC.
A die hard "Star Trek" fan, Bill has enjoyed all of the TV series and the first 10 "Star Trek" movies. He is also a fan of animation ranging from the Warner Bros Classics all the way to the current computer animations styles of today.
Bill’s biggest goal for Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC as art director is to ensure quality and exciting artwork, a diverse subject matter, and to ensure readers have a great time enjoying all the company's work.

Rob Barnes – He is a self-taught artist and musician currently living in far away Auckland, New Zealand. After working in the tire business for 15 years he decided it was time for a change and began to pursue his passion for art. After two years of learning Photoshop and 3D modeling in Maya, Rob and his brothers started the iPhone game development company Squidjuice. He works as the lead artist and is involved in creating concept art, in-game art, and 3D models. Squidjuice has released three games to date: “UDF," “UDF Spitfire,” and their latest game “Buck Rogers Begins-Mission To Saturn.” Rob has also been involved with the “Star Trek Phase 2 Illustrated” comic book with Glenn and Bill as colorist.
Rob’s love of comics goes back to his youth, getting his first comic, “Green Lantern 173” in 1984. Since then his passion for the medium has only grown and he is looking forward to bringing that passion to D.P.M.

Charles Root Jr. – Holds a Master’s Degree in Management of Information Systems as well as other degrees in Computer and Political Science. He has worked in the finance and Intellectual Property industries for over 20 years, but has an alter ego that is light years away from his day job.
Charles plays the role of Commander Montgomery Scott “Scotty” in the most successful Star Trek fan film series ever produced, "Star Trek Phase II." Secretly studying theater and modern dance while in college eventually paid off when years later he landed the roll while working as a production assistant on that series.
While unable to draw a straight line to save his life, he does excel at writing, having written many technical pieces for the I.T. industry, and is parlaying that experience into writing for screen as well as into writing a title for Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC. Charles’ love of comics goes all the way back to his youth, when he would spend many a summer hour buried between the pages of "Richie Rich," "Casper," and "G.I. Joe" comics.


The Initial Titles

So that’s great and all, that we all love comics and have a solid team to develop them, but what are the titles that D.P.M. wants to initially release?
Great question! Here they are:

 

The Lion Kings of Arthan ascended to the thrown as the Age of Dragons came to its end, and the Realm has known only peace under their reign for more than 500 years. But the village of Gaalreth has been cursed and the old darkness is returning once more to bring chaos to the Realm. As that darkness dawns anew, brothers descended of legend and long separated by leagues and loyalties must reunite to save the Realm.

12 issues written so far!

 

 


A great threat encroaches on the galaxy—a threat that even the mighty Continuum cannot stop. Once cast aside, The Frontiersmen have assembled anew to face that threat, but the lines between friends and foes have blurred. Priorities have changed and loyalties have shifted. Yet, if the galaxy is to survive, there exists but one single hope. The Return of the Frontiersmen.


             

Harrington Cybernetics Corporation has designed and manufactured artificial limbs and organs for decades. Under second-generation President and CEO Justin Harrington, a man known for his love of excess as well as for his billionaire status, the company’s young biotronics division strives to become the first entity ever to successfully design and manufacture fully-functional and autonomous androids. Unfortunately, that achievement has proven more difficult to realize than they had hoped. But now Justin’s older brother, Penn State University Archaeologist Professor Walter Harrington, has discovered something that could change the family company’s fortunes forever, as well as that of the entire world.

27 issues written so far!

 

 

 

In every choice, there is a path. Dragon Phoenix Media present “Pathways,” a 24-issue miniseries leading into “The Return of the Frontiersmen.” The Frontiersmen were once Earth’s greatest heroes. They saved the world, and the world cast them aside. Now, as Emperor Oby’Dar of the Continuum faces his greatest challenge and a powerful villain pursues aspirations of worldwide economic domination, something even more sinister is coming…

These are the tales of the Frontiersmen. These are their Pathways.

In every choice, there is a path.

4 issues completed!

3 more inked in! 11 penciled and all 24 have been written! 

Previews coming!


When humans first set foot on Mars and discover ancient alien technology buried there, That discovery sets off a colonization push that centuries later transforms Mars into an independent world, free of the Earth government's shackles. Now bitter enemies, Mars and Earth fight an ongoing and devastating war for control of the red planet, believing there may exist there more alien technology yet to be discovered. A shocking discovery not only proves both sides wrong, but also warns that mankind may have awakened a power that neither side is ready to understand, let alone control.

4 issues written so far!


So What Do We Need?

As we said earlier, some of the work to get these titles published has already been done. Our goal is to have at least six issues of each title completely done by launch day. Much of the stories have already been written. Some issues have been drawn, some have been inked, and some have even been colored and just await lettering. Others still need a lot of art work done to finish them off.

We are seeking $25,000 to reach our a goal of 5 titles each with 6 issues completed. Your donations will be spent in the following manner:

  • Hiring of 3 or more contract artist to pencil and ink issues.
  • Develop a distribution platform for digital delivery on PC, MAC, Android & iOS
  • Cover some of the costs already incurred to get this far.
  • Purchase art supplies, like paper, pens, ink, and tissues for when it all goes wrong (just kidding about the tissues).
  • Purchase some software for digital manipulation of images.
  • Perform some upfront advertising of the comics.
  • Pay for some of the thank you gifts.
  • Do a limited run of printed versions of the titles.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

  • Are you a talented artist? We're looking for people who can create sequential art and want to make a name for themselves in the comics business, Please contact us if you're interested.
  • Please share this campaign link with your social media connections.
  • Look for future updates that will include a FREE download of a mini-comic that you can enjoy and share.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP AND CONSIDERATION! IT IS APPRECIATED MORE THAN YOU CAN IMAGINE!
story_txt:
All new 5 Series Digital Comic Book Launch
Founded by a team of writers and artists, Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC or D.P.M. in short, is "IMAGINATION UNLEASHED".At D.P.M. we are working to bring you original stories set in brand new realities that will always entertain, sometimes inform, and perhaps on occasion even provoke.We love comics and telling stories through art as much as you do, and we intend to bring that passion to each and every series we produce.We at D.P.M. are looking to you to help us bring to market an initial launch of five comic book titles. Much of the work is already done, and we just need some capital to help carry us across the finish line, but more on that later. First, who are the guys who make up Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC?
The D.P.M. Team!

Glenn E. Smith - Served in the United States Army in Korea and the continental United States, and with the United States Air Force / Air National Guard, deploying overseas twice under Operation Enduring Freedom following the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. He holds an Associate Degree in Law Enforcement and a Bachelor Degree in Business Management, but writing is his passion. He is a published novelist and often cannot seem to write fast enough to keep up with all the stories in his head.Glenn started writing at the age of 14, but didn’t seriously consider striving toward getting published until well into his twenties. He began writing "Star Trek Phase II: Illustrated" in 2010, and that venture led him to found Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC with that title’s artist, Bill Lutz, and "Star Trek Phase II" actor Charles Root. Glenn’s goal for the company is to present intriguing stories in the science-fiction, fantasy, mystery, and paranormal genres that will entertain readers to the fullest.Bill Lutz – Works as an independent illustrator and cartoonist. He has been working both for fun and professionally for the last twenty years. He graduated from the School of Visual Arts in New York City in 1988 with a degree in Illustration and Design with a minor in Creative Writing.Bill has been a fan of comic books since he purchased his first "Fantastic Four" comic book back in the 1970s at age 12. He has been drawing since he was six years old. He began drawing "Star Trek Phase II: Illustrated" back in 2010, which eventually lead to a partnership with Glenn and the forming of Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC. Bill is looking forward to releasing new titles, including his long awaited "Return of the Frontiersmen," and to supervising new artwork and digital comics through Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC.A die hard "Star Trek" fan, Bill has enjoyed all of the TV series and the first 10 "Star Trek" movies. He is also a fan of animation ranging from the Warner Bros Classics all the way to the current computer animations styles of today.Bill’s biggest goal for Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC as art director is to ensure quality and exciting artwork, a diverse subject matter, and to ensure readers have a great time enjoying all the company's work.Rob Barnes – He is a self-taught artist and musician currently living in far away Auckland, New Zealand. After working in the tire business for 15 years he decided it was time for a change and began to pursue his passion for art. After two years of learning Photoshop and 3D modeling in Maya, Rob and his brothers started the iPhone game development company Squidjuice. He works as the lead artist and is involved in creating concept art, in-game art, and 3D models. Squidjuice has released three games to date: “UDF," “UDF Spitfire,” and their latest game “Buck Rogers Begins-Mission To Saturn.” Rob has also been involved with the “Star Trek Phase 2 Illustrated” comic book with Glenn and Bill as colorist.Rob’s love of comics goes back to his youth, getting his first comic, “Green Lantern 173” in 1984. Since then his passion for the medium has only grown and he is looking forward to bringing that passion to D.P.M.Charles Root Jr. – Holds a Master’s Degree in Management of Information Systems as well as other degrees in Computer and Political Science. He has worked in the finance and Intellectual Property industries for over 20 years, but has an alter ego that is light years away from his day job.Charles plays the role of Commander Montgomery Scott “Scotty” in the most successful Star Trek fan film series ever produced, "Star Trek Phase II." Secretly studying theater and modern dance while in college eventually paid off when years later he landed the roll while working as a production assistant on that series.While unable to draw a straight line to save his life, he does excel at writing, having written many technical pieces for the I.T. industry, and is parlaying that experience into writing for screen as well as into writing a title for Dragon Phoenix Media, LLC. Charles’ love of comics goes all the way back to his youth, when he would spend many a summer hour buried between the pages of "Richie Rich," "Casper," and "G.I. Joe" comics.

The Initial Titles

So that’s great and all, that we all love comics and have a solid team to develop them, but what are the titles that D.P.M. wants to initially release?Great question! Here they are:
 
The Lion Kings of Arthan ascended to the thrown as the Age of Dragons came to its end, and the Realm has known only peace under their reign for more than 500 years. But the village of Gaalreth has been cursed and the old darkness is returning once more to bring chaos to the Realm. As that darkness dawns anew, brothers descended of legend and long separated by leagues and loyalties must reunite to save the Realm.
12 issues written so far! 
 












A great threat encroaches on the galaxy—a threat that even the mighty Continuum cannot stop. Once cast aside, The Frontiersmen have assembled anew to face that threat, but the lines between friends and foes have blurred. Priorities have changed and loyalties have shifted. Yet, if the galaxy is to survive, there exists but one single hope. The Return of the Frontiersmen.


             
Harrington Cybernetics Corporation has designed and manufactured artificial limbs and organs for decades. Under second-generation President and CEO Justin Harrington, a man known for his love of excess as well as for his billionaire status, the company’s young biotronics division strives to become the first entity ever to successfully design and manufacture fully-functional and autonomous androids. Unfortunately, that achievement has proven more difficult to realize than they had hoped. But now Justin’s older brother, Penn State University Archaeologist Professor Walter Harrington, has discovered something that could change the family company’s fortunes forever, as well as that of the entire world.
27 issues written so far!

 
 


 


In every choice, there is a path. Dragon Phoenix Media present “Pathways,” a 24-issue miniseries leading into “The Return of the Frontiersmen.” The Frontiersmen were once Earth’s greatest heroes. They saved the world, and the world cast them aside. Now, as Emperor Oby’Dar of the Continuum faces his greatest challenge and a powerful villain pursues aspirations of worldwide economic domination, something even more sinister is coming…







These are the tales of the Frontiersmen. These are their Pathways.







In every choice, there is a path.
4 issues completed!
3 more inked in! 11 penciled and all 24 have been written! 
Previews coming!




When humans first set foot on Mars and discover ancient alien technology buried there, That discovery sets off a colonization push that centuries later transforms Mars into an independent world, free of the Earth government's shackles. Now bitter enemies, Mars and Earth fight an ongoing and devastating war for control of the red planet, believing there may exist there more alien technology yet to be discovered. A shocking discovery not only proves both sides wrong, but also warns that mankind may have awakened a power that neither side is ready to understand, let alone control.
4 issues written so far!

So What Do We Need?

As we said earlier, some of the work to get these titles published has already been done. Our goal is to have at least six issues of each title completely done by launch day. Much of the stories have already been written. Some issues have been drawn, some have been inked, and some have even been colored and just await lettering. Others still need a lot of art work done to finish them off. 
We are seeking $25,000 to reach our a goal of 5 titles each with 6 issues completed. Your donations will be spent in the following manner:

Hiring of 3 or more contract artist to pencil and ink issues.

Develop a distribution platform for digital delivery on PC, MAC, Android & iOS

Cover some of the costs already incurred to get this far.
Purchase art supplies, like paper, pens, ink, and tissues for when it all goes wrong (just kidding about the tissues).
Purchase some software for digital manipulation of images.
Perform some upfront advertising of the comics.
Pay for some of the thank you gifts.
Do a limited run of printed versions of the titles. 


Other Ways You Can Help!
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Are you a talented artist? We're looking for people who can create sequential art and want to make a name for themselves in the comics business, Please contact us if you're interested.

Please share this campaign link with your social media connections.
Look for future updates that will include a FREE download of a mini-comic that you can enjoy and share.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP AND CONSIDERATION! IT IS APPRECIATED MORE THAN YOU CAN IMAGINE!

story:
Overview

  • The young and determined detective, Vince Davis, and his lighthearted partner, Isaac Lazlo, commit to solve homicide cases to constrain the insistent evil enclosing their cherished town. Though they often disagree on their course of action, they form a strong bond which only their deep, buried secrets can tear apart.

Introduction

  • Hello! My name is Patrick Kebert, a video editor from Phoenix, Arizona. Recently, I’ve received a Bachelor of Arts in Digital Video and Animation. I look forward to applying my knowledge in creating a high quality comic series.

  • Hello, my name is Christine Sloban. I’m an artist from a small village in Northeast Ohio. I currently hold an Associate in Science for Multimedia, and I hope to use that knowledge in the development of this project. As a fanatic of mystery novels and crime television, I want to build a story that is both intriguing and thrilling for its audience.

  • This campaign is to help bring our comic idea Traces to life! After countless hours working together flushing out the ideas and small details of the comic, we are ready to start the funding process. This project is near to our hearts as it is something we have wanted to create for a long time, but we have never had the means to do so. That is where you guys, the backers, come in!
  • To create the level of quality we are striving for with our comic we are going to need some help. Without backers the comic is not going to reach the level of quality we hope to be able to bring to you all!
  • We will update with more pictures as we continue to work on them.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Amount needed: $2,100. Funding will go to a variety of things all needed to make this project possible. This includes:

    • Website hosting fees (To ensure constant access is available)

    • Hardware (Cintiq and PC repairs/upgrades)

    • Bills (To ensure that we can commit as much time to the comic as possible)

  • Perks! (You receive all previous level perks as well)

    • $1+ Have name listed on a donation page.

    • $5+ Personalized “Thank you” email.

    • $10+ Have a character named after you (if wanted).

    • $20+ Desktop Wallpaper

    • $25+ Wallpaper (iphone/Android)

    • $30+ Emailed a sketched headshot of preferred character. (Limit of 40)

    • $50+ Digital Poster

  • If we are unable to reach our goal, the funds will be used to ensure the comic is made and all of the perks are given out.

The Impact

  • By contributing to Traces, not only are you putting us one step closer to fulfilling our dream of creating a comic, but you also help out everyone looking forward to seeing it come to fruition.
  • Both of us have been a part of multiple different projects that involve producing content for consumers. One of which was an Indiegogo project, Instinct - A Military Survival Short Film, whose campaign was successful. (Link Below)
    • https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/instinct-a-m...
  • If you would like to see some of Christine's artwork, follow the link below.
    • https://almightyvenven.tumblr.com/
  • Our main obstacle will be funding. Currently we have tons of content planned out and ready to be made, but without the funding we will not be able to create it all. There are no real risks that we see that we will not be able to overcome, even if we receive a lack of funding we are still going to attempt to create the comic in some form for those that wanted it.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you are unable to donate, you can still help us by sharing the campaign to get the word out there. Those who take the time to share aids us immensely and allows this idea come to fruition. Donating and/or sharing, helps make the project that much better. Please leave us a message on what you think about Traces.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Hello, my name is Christine Sloban. I’m an artist from a small village in Northeast Ohio. I currently hold an Associate in Science for Multimedia, and I hope to use that knowledge in the development of this project. As a fanatic of mystery novels and crime television, I want to build a story that is both intriguing and thrilling for its audience.
This campaign is to help bring our comic idea Traces to life! After countless hours working together flushing out the ideas and small details of the comic, we are ready to start the funding process. This project is near to our hearts as it is something we have wanted to create for a long time, but we have never had the means to do so. That is where you guys, the backers, come in!
To create the level of quality we are striving for with our comic we are going to need some help. Without backers the comic is not going to reach the level of quality we hope to be able to bring to you all!
We will update with more pictures as we continue to work on them.




What We Need & What You Get

Amount needed: $2,100. Funding will go to a variety of things all needed to make this project possible. This includes:

Website hosting fees (To ensure constant access is available)
Hardware (Cintiq and PC repairs/upgrades)
Bills (To ensure that we can commit as much time to the comic as possible)





Perks! (You receive all previous level perks as well)

$1+ Have name listed on a donation page.
$5+ Personalized “Thank you” email.
$10+ Have a character named after you (if wanted).
$20+ Desktop Wallpaper
$25+ Wallpaper (iphone/Android)
$30+ Emailed a sketched headshot of preferred character. (Limit of 40)
$50+ Digital Poster


If we are unable to reach our goal, the funds will be used to ensure the comic is made and all of the perks are given out.


The Impact

By contributing to Traces, not only are you putting us one step closer to fulfilling our dream of creating a comic, but you also help out everyone looking forward to seeing it come to fruition.
Both of us have been a part of multiple different projects that involve producing content for consumers. One of which was an Indiegogo project, Instinct - A Military Survival Short Film, whose campaign was successful. (Link Below)https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/instinct-a-m...

If you would like to see some of Christine's artwork, follow the link below.https://almightyvenven.tumblr.com/

Our main obstacle will be funding. Currently we have tons of content planned out and ready to be made, but without the funding we will not be able to create it all. There are no real risks that we see that we will not be able to overcome, even if we receive a lack of funding we are still going to attempt to create the comic in some form for those that wanted it.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate, you can still help us by sharing the campaign to get the word out there. Those who take the time to share aids us immensely and allows this idea come to fruition. Donating and/or sharing, helps make the project that much better. Please leave us a message on what you think about Traces.
Remember to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

story:
Yo, Ho

 

Minerrale is a French author. Eristeine is a Filipina artist. We have wanted to work together on a project for a long time, and after more than a year of hard work, we are happy and proud to present to you this beautiful 22 pages, full-colour comic.

Yo, Ho started as a bedtime story. It was short, whimsical, and simple - the story of a young pirate who couldn't hear but saw sounds as colours. As I (Min) and she/they (Eri) talked about the story, we found her art style to be a great complement to my words, and the story of Emmet the pirate grew. He got a backstory. The story got a bit longer.

This is our story, and we've worked hard to make it as pretty and as polished as possible. Take a look at the first page:

 

 

The comic is finished and has been translated into French. We're eager to have Emmet's story out into the world, and we hope you love it as much as we do.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The goal is set at 550€, which is roughly 650$.

This price covers three things:

  1. the upgrade costs of the website to sell and distribute the comic
  2. securing the ISBN for both the English and French version
  3. formatting the digital versions
  4. providing a backers-only exclusive print run. There will likely be no reprints.

 

 

Your support helps take this project past its shoestring budget and allows us to produce more projects in the future, not just together, but with other talented artists from all over the world.

Eri has been paid on a per-page basis and will receive 60% of the profits. She did an amazing job and provided invaluable insight. I believe she has earned it. I look forward to collaborating with her in the future so we can not only expand Emmet's story but bring future stories together into the world.

 

 

Thank you for your time and support. Supporting this project allows artists and creatives to reach audiences in ways they never thought possible, and we all thank you for that opportunity.

 

 

*** Français

Minerrale est une auteure française, Eristeine est une artiste philippine. Nous voulions travailler ensemble depuis longtemps et, après plus d’un an de travail, nous sommes fières de vous présenter cette BD magnifique, toute en couleurs, de 24 pages incluant la couverture.

Yo, Ho était au départ une histoire pour enfants. C’était une histoire courte, fantaisiste, et simple : l’histoire d’un jeune pirate qui ne pouvait pas entendre mais voyait les sons comme des couleurs. Lorsque j’ai (Min) écrit cette histoire j’en ai parlé à Eri et nous avons trouvé que son style serait parfait pour illustrer mes mots. A force l’histoire d’Emmet le pirate a évolué, s’est allongée, et a pris une vie propre.

La BD est terminée et prête à imprimer en français et en anglais. Nous avons hâte de vous faire lire l’histoire d’Emmet, et espérons que vous l’aimerez autant que nous.

Ce dont nous avons besoin

 

The but à atteindre est de 550€, ce qui couvre trois choses:

- l’amélioration de mon site internet pour pouvoir vendre la bande dessinée dessus

- obtenir les ISBNs pour les deux versions

- vous offrir une version papier exclusive. Il n’y aura probablement pas de réimpression.

Votre soutien nous aidera à rentrer dans nos frais et à faire aboutir ce projet. Il nous aidera également à réaliser d’autres projets dans l’avenir, pas seulement ensemble mais aussi avec d’autres artistes et écrivains du monde entier.

 

Eri a reçu un paiement par page et recevra 60% des bénéfices sur toutes les ventes. Elle a fait un travail exceptionnel et m’a donné des conseils précieux durant toute notre collaboration. J’ai hâte de travailler à nouveau avec elle pour non seulement développer encore l’histoire d’Emmet, mais en créer de nouvelles.

Merci pour votre temps et votre soutien. Soutenir ce projet permet aux artistes et aux créateurs d’atteindre des auditoires d’une façon qu’ils n’auraient jamais cru possible, et nous vous remercions du fond du coeur pour cette opportunité.

story:
What's HIRO: Blood of Patriots about?

War has changed the way we live. The Red Threat has backed America into a corner. without a solution, America will soon be under the rule of the worlds most ruthless superpower. HIRO is the solution we need. When a soldier dies his fight is not over, HIRO or "Hardware Integrated Reanimation Ordinance" is an A.I. controlled Robotic pack that can reanimate the dead.  This is not a zombie book, HIRO turns fallen warriors into undead super soldiers! In this graphic novel, we will follow HIRO, his creator, and his team on an action-packed, military, sci-fi adventure. If you are a fan of DeathLok, Captain America, and Universal Soldier, you’ll Love HIRO!

What We Need & What You Get

We have a fixed goal of $3800 and plan to use that money for the following:

  • 48 action-packed pages
  • High-quality professional printing
  • Coloring for all pages
  • Shipping containers and handling fees
  • Fulfillment begins Nov 2019

As a fixed goal campaign, if we do not make the goal of $3800 you will be fully refunded! 

Stretch Goals

UNlocked! $3,800 - FUNDED! We're making a comic!

UNlocked! $5,500  - Upgraded colors by @vegasdayreal (=Better Colors & Faster Fulfillment!)

(locked) $6,500 - Macho grows his "Dastardly Dan" Curled Mustache!

(locked) $7,000  - More Content!

The Impact

We, the creators, have been comic book fans our whole lives. We grew up in the 80's and 90's in the heyday of extreme action-packed comics. We have been avid consumers of comic books and our desire is to have the chance to give back to the comic book community in the form of content creation. The idea for HIRO is something that we have been developing for a long time. Our hope is that comic book readers will enjoy reading this story as much as we have enjoyed creating it. 

Risks & Challenges

This story is written and the artwork as you can see is well on its way. Our biggest challenge at this point is to obtain funding in order to have the artwork colored by a professional colorist and get high-quality printing. We want the finished product to best represent the story and artwork we have spent years creating. We feel our combined professional experience will ensure this challenge is met.  Mutt-Man has 15 years as a project manager in graphic design and marketing, and Macho Dan has 11 years in marketing and event management. Delivering a quality product and experience for the consumer is something we are confident we can do. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our Indiegogo link with friends and family. Find us on Twitter: @MuttMan75 @MachoDano. Sign up for our mailing list and let us know how you like our 16-page preview issue. Send us fan art and shout outs. We love interacting with other creators and fans.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking the time to consider HIRO: Blood of Patriots!

story:
4th Wall Productions, the team behind Aceblade: The Vegas Vigilante, King Supreme, LumberJax and Black Scorpion presents…


Annihilation Day- a full color Graphic Novel


A crossover event featuring the premiere characters of the 4th Wall Universe. Here's how it all starts. 




  • Aceblade is dead...

#SpoilerAlert

...And with his death dies the common link between the only chance the world has against a new and terrible threat, The Troll. Motivated only by a desire to breed boundless chaos and destruction, The Troll sets forth a plan to annihilate the Earth’s population in order to make room for his own kind. With the help of Mystic, and the rest of Aceblade's former team the heroes Black Scorpion, LumberJax and King Supreme must come together to stop The Troll before he does away with everything they have vowed to protect.


PREVIEW- Here's a free preview to get you started-




What Is 4th Wall Pros?


4th Wall Productions is independent productions company based in North Carolina with a short term focus on comic book, manga and graphic novel publications as well as weekly podcasts recorded videos. In the long term we will encompass a wide-range of media productions including short and feature length films. Our mission at 4th wall productions is to the quench the thirst we all have for storytelling and entertainment in various forms of media.




Beginning with the novel Aceblade: The Vegas Vigilante by Danny Quick, 4th Wall Productions has continued to produce and release new and original stories. After starting 4th Wall Productions and then adding his pals Morgan Iverson and M. Rene Lee to the team, 4th Wall Productions has grown and continued to produce original works that offer a refreshing alternative for comic book and fiction literature aficionados. Along with the novels LumberJax and the recently released Black Scorpion: Origins, the first issues of the comic books Aceblade: The Vegas Vigilante #1 and King Supreme #1 and the SIC Squad short stories along with a growing number of free short stories on the Wattpad app. All of the publications so far are written by one of the three team members and the artwork is commissioned from artist some of the best upcoming artists.




The Campaign


The Annihilation Day graphic novel is the first time the pillar characters (King Supreme, Black Scorpion and LumberJax) and the main titles of the 4th Wall Universe have crossed over and directly interacted with each other for a common purpose. It is also the first story written by all three members of the 4th Wall Pros team.


Through Annihilation Day we hope to give our audience a chance to see our main characters up close as they interact with each other and supporting characters in their shared universe. Annihilation Day takes place shortly after the death of Aceblade and Mystic and his team are still trying to regroup after the death of their leader. While all this is happening Black Scorpion is looking for help in stopping a former villain of his who has recently been empowered by an unknown form of energy. As he seeks out assistance from Aceblade and learns about his death he teams up with Mystic who recruits the aid of LumberJax before attempting to take down The Troll.


Magnitude of your contributions 

Annihilation Day can springboard us forward into the comic universe with a smash hit of our own. It is huge for us because our narrative stories and comics lead up to, and away from this converging point in our universe. For our stretch goals, if met, we would be able to get not only this comic but the first editions of Black Scorpion and LumberJax done which would be monumental. We love what we do, and want to do it full time. With projects like these fully funded under our belt that would happen a lot sooner than later.






The Impact


As a grassroots company at the moment, your impact here is a crucial moment in our company's history. This comic will literally be the lifeblood for the company for years to come giving a glimpse into three of our main characters, a recurring villainous threat, and some of our other up and coming characters. It gives us our ace in the hole to put the company on the map and pave the way for our characters, whichever one that grabs your heart, to have their own success in their own comic editions. We haven't made it to where we're going but your contributions are supplying the gas to ensure we have the fuel to continue toward our destiny.




We have a timeline that we are building to in our universe. Annihilation day is a true epicenter of events and story crossovers that has rippling ramifications in the timeline as a whole for our universe.



Risk and Challenges

This is our 5th Project and we are well aware of the risks. There is always a certain amount of risk with a project like this. Especially at this size. We've been able to overcome everything from changes in artists, to deaths in our past projects and we are confident that we will be able to fulfill our promises to all who pledge to this project. Thank you all so much for your support.

#READY
story_txt:
4th Wall Productions, the team behind Aceblade: The Vegas Vigilante, King Supreme, LumberJax and Black Scorpion presents…Annihilation Day- a full color Graphic NovelA crossover event featuring the premiere characters of the 4th Wall Universe. Here's how it all starts. 
Aceblade is dead...
#SpoilerAlert...And with his death dies the common link between the only chance the world has against a new and terrible threat, The Troll. Motivated only by a desire to breed boundless chaos and destruction, The Troll sets forth a plan to annihilate the Earth’s population in order to make room for his own kind. With the help of Mystic, and the rest of Aceblade's former team the heroes Black Scorpion, LumberJax and King Supreme must come together to stop The Troll before he does away with everything they have vowed to protect.PREVIEW- Here's a free preview to get you started-What Is 4th Wall Pros?4th Wall Productions is independent productions company based in North Carolina with a short term focus on comic book, manga and graphic novel publications as well as weekly podcasts recorded videos. story:
PINK LEMONADE #1 (STANDARD COVER) - $4.00

 

PINK LEMONADE #1 (JIM RUGG VARIANT COVER) - $4.00

 

PINK LEMONADE #1 (EXCLUSIVE INDIEGOGO VARIANT COVER) - $4.00

 

PINK LEMONADE #1 (EXCLUSIVE HEROESCON VARIANT COVER) - $4.00

 

 

IT'S ALIVE! IS PROUD TO PRESENT PINK LEMONADE #1 BY NICK CAGNETTI!

Mysterious past...colorful costume...altruistic...nomadic lifestyle...it's all pretty cool!  Pink Lemonade dreams of doing big things.  She just wants to be good and help where she can. But things don't always work out the way we plan.  And soon Pink Lemonade finds herself in jail, after a big misunderstanding with some cops, while trying to help a child.  And just when you think she's sunk, a powerful man shows up with an offer she may not be able to refuse! But is it too good to be true?  Rising star Nick Cagnetti introduces us to the wildly colorful world of PINK LEMONADE. A story full of both fun and mystery, readers are sure to get lost in her strange, action-packed adventures!  Don’t miss this beautiful comic that Michael (MADMAN) Allred called, “Terrific and original like crazy!”, and journalist Grant DeArmitt called, “hopepunk by way of Jack Kirby and Evel Knievel!”  Gorgeous variant cover by Jim (STREET ANGEL) Rugg!

You can pick up your copies of PINK LEMONADE #1 from this IndieGoGo campaign, which includes the Standard Cover, the HeroesCon Exclusive Cover, the Variant Cover by Jim (STREET ANGEL) Rugg, and the IndieGoGo Exclusive Cover!  You can also pick up a signed Standard Cover by Nick Cagnetti, or a signed Variant Cover by Jim Rugg!

If you take a moment to look through the Perks on the right side of this page, you will see that you have the option of picking up one of the four covers, two individual signed covers, or all four covers at once.  AND WHEN YOU CHECK OUT, YOU WILL SEE SEVERAL ADD-ON OPTIONS THAT YOU CAN ADD TO YOUR ORDER!  THIS INCLUDES SIGNED AND UNSIGNED COVERS!

Also, Nick Cagnetti will be making some of his gorgeous original PINK LEMONADE art available.  There will also be a handful of PINK LEMONADE pin-ups available from a group of amazing artists who believe in what Nick is doing.  All of this original art will be available as add-on rewards during the course of the campaign, and will be released one by one over the next few weeks!

Through this campaign we hope to raise the funds necessary to print and ship PINK LEMONADE #1, as well as pay for the variant cover.  We are only asking for $2000, but we do have some stretch goals in mind if we go beyond the initial goal.

Thank you for your interest in PINK LEMONADE!  Please let us know if you have any questions.

And now...here are a few interior pages to get you excited!

 

----------------------------------------------

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT PINK LEMONADE

"Terrific and original like crazy" –Michael Allred (MADMAN)

"Dreamy 'bots, fun fandom examination and her bike is her best friend. Delirious insanity with danger lurking just around the corner." –John Cassaday (PLANETARY)

"Above all else, comic books are meant to be fun. PINK LEMONADE hits the mark from the start, and blasts through the entertainment strata with style I can’t help but believe would make King Jack proud." –Dan Brereton (NOCTURNALS)

"Crazy fun--has a playful look and feel of a 90's comic reminiscent of Michael Allred and Jay Stephens." –Rich Tommaso (DRY COUNTY)

“It’s unique and refreshing! I love the pure style of it all.” –Dan Fraga (THE GRAVE)

"PINK LEMONADE is pure pop art funkiness. It’s a mix of Mike Allred’s MADMAN with a healthy does of Jack Kirby and Dan Clowes thrown in for good measure." –Jamal Igle (MOLLY DANGER)

"A pop culture story that's deeply rooted in its own fictional pop culture, PINK LEMONADE #1 is as intriguing is it is bizarre. Entertaining, with solid art that is a mash up of Allred, Clowes, and animator Sally Cruikshank." –David Hahn (SIX MILLION DOLLAR MAN)

"Nick Cagnetti's PINK LEMONADE is a quirky, good-hearted comic book series. Try a taste of PINK LEMONADE. You'll find it refreshing!" –Michael T. Gilbert (MR. MONSTER)

"Pink Lemonade is a fun romp with visual nods to the coolest art books of yesteryear!" –Pop Mahn (RAVEN: DAUGHTER OF DARKNESS)

"What an endearingly goofy heroine!  I want to go to lunch with her!" –Trina Robbins (LAST GIRL STANDING)

"Nothing can prepare you for how cool and eye-popping the world of Pink Lemonade is. You'll instantly fall for the eponymous do-gooder motorcyclist who will charm her way into your heart while also injecting a healthy dose of madness into your mind." –Scott Duvall (ARMY OF DARKNESS/BUBBA HO-TEP)

"First half of the book was like 'What?' and the second half was like 'Whoa!!'  The ending had me like, where is book 2 going to take me?" –N. Steven Harris (WILDSTORM: MICHAEL CRAY)

"This is a very fun comic book! If you enjoy quirky, whimsical, and surreal comics like Mike Allred’s MADMAN, then this is for you." –Henry Chamberlain, COMICS GRINDER

"This book’s zany, upbeat, often surreal sensibilities lie somewhere between Mike Allred’s MADMAN and Ryan North and Erica Henderson’s UNBEATABLE SQUIRREL GIRL." –Dan Grote, WMQ COMICS

"Overall, Pink Lemonade #1 is a stunning start to a comic series with an art style that blows most of what is on stands out of the water." –Lizzy Garcia, BUT WHY THO?

"On the surface, this may seem like cool stuff for younger readers. I think kids will appreciate PINK LEMONADE on several levels, and I look forward to seeing her cosplayed. But Cagnetti, the writer/artist/colorist/letterer/genius/madman behind PINK LEMONADE has some things to tell us grownups, too." –Clyde Hall, DOOMROCKET

“...hopepunk by way of Jack Kirby and Evel Knievel!” –Grant DeArmitt

"(PINK LEMONADE is) strong-willed, quirky, and fun. Every interaction she has with another human is filled with this childhood whimsy I wish I still had." –Cidnya Silva

 

RECENT PRESS FOR PINK LEMONADE

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/05/10/its-ali...

COMIC CRUSADERS: https://www.comiccrusaders.com/its-alive-announ...

COMICS GRINDER: https://comicsgrinder.com/2019/05/11/review-pin...

WMQ COMICS: https://wmqcomics.com/news/indie-review-pink-le...

BUT WHY THO?: https://butwhythopodcast.com/2019/06/18/heroesc...

BLEEDING COOL: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/06/15/exclusi...

KGW COMIC PICK OF THE WEEK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SB9CskVgAN0

DOOMROCKET: https://doomrocket.com/pink-lemonade-1-review/

 

----------------------------------------------

ABOUT NICK CAGNETTI

Nick Cagnetti is 24 years old, he's been drawing forever but he first started making comics with his friends in 2012. Among the works produced were two series: Infinite Wonders, and The Spirit of The Shadows. Alongside storyboard work and other art gigs, Nick has been making Pink Lemonade comic strips and short stories on his own since 2016. In 2019, he set out to tell larger stories with Pink Lemonade's own comic book series which brings us to today.

 

ABOUT IT'S ALIVE!

IT'S ALIVE! is the brainchild of multiple Eisner Award nominee Drew Ford, publishing out of print comics, English translations of foreign material, original projects (like PINK LEMONADE!), and other unique collectibles.

story:
Hello! 

In case you don't already know me I'm Laurel, I'm an illustrator and I live in England, and a couple of years ago I went to Iceland with my triplet brother and sister. During those few weeks I documented our time there through sketches, photographs, comics and in writing. Those documentations eventually became this book! 

Ever since I had first seen the music video for Glósóli by Sigur Rós (years and years ago!) I had wanted to visit Iceland and its terrific and alien landscapes. You should watch/listen to that video if you want an idea of how it felt to be in Iceland.

 
I wanted to capture every moment we explored with a hungry fervour. The cold but clean, sulphurous air, the amazing collection of geographical wonders in ONE place and the magic that seemed to imbue itself in the land and inspire those that live there through their folklore and literature. 
 

This campaign is for those of you who want to have a copy of this book! Unfortunately the cost for printing is very high and so I hope to use this as a way for you to pre-order your own copy! If we reach the goal it would be amazing! You would be helping me to print lots of copies of this book that will then be distributed around the world! I really want to share this experience that I had with my family because I learnt and saw so much and I want others to experience this too.  

What I Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown for the funding: 

  • The goal I've chosen is to raise £1000 within a month.
  • The cost for printing is £861 for 250 copies, excluding the proof I already have as an example! This will mean that once these are printed there will be extra copies that will be available to buy through my online shop. 
  • I need the extra £139 to cover the packaging costs as well as the fees from using Indiegogo as a platform. 
  • The cost for shipping overseas is between £4-£10 so I'm afraid those of you in Europe and other parts of the world would have to put in a little bit extra to help me out! 
  •  The featured PERK would be you owning the first edition printing of this book! Included would be a drawing and signature from me on the inside cover as well as a gold riso-printed postcard that you can use as a bookmark! 
  • If this doesn't reach the entire goal then don't worry! Those of you that will have contributed will get their copies because I will put in the remaining money for printing myself, I want this done!  

The Impact

It would make such a difference getting your help because self publishing can be very difficult and lonely and costly and I've been working on this book ever since I came back from Iceland and I can't wait to share it with others. This book is a very personal project for me and the longest publication I've ever worked on and your contribution means it can become a REAL THING! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you can't contribute, but you can still help me in other ways! 

  • It would be amazing if you could get the word out on social media about this campaign! 
  • You can also do this by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Story:

An international, government-approved drug company has been secretly conducting random trials on the general public for over 80 years.
Just recently, some of those trials have produced alarming results - and this comic will document the panic and confusion as it unfolds.

Issue 1 of Random Trials will start the tale by focusing on Charlie Cooper, a very unlikely hero.  This balding, middle-aged rocker lives in a high crime area whose water supply has secretly been laced with a mild sedative (to see if it would calm the boisterous population).  The thing is, Charlie hasn't reacted well to the sedative - and world is about to meet a very dangerous (yet thoroughly loveable) man.

The writer & artist:

That's me! I have written the first issue of the comic book and will be illustrating it all myself.  I am a professional illustrator whose work has been featured in several published comics including the Image Comics title 'No Place Like Home' and Terminal Press' zombie anthology - 'Zombiebomb!' 

How I draw & when I'll be finished:

My art techniques are quite laborious and involved.  I colour everything using acrylic paints and colouring pencils - before scanning into photoshop and tweaking with colour treatments.  Because of this, I expect this entire project (Issue 1 = 24 sequential pages + splash pages and info pages) to take AT LEAST 3 months for me to complete.  I really want to get issue 1 ready for distribution at all of the Comic Cons that will be happening across the UK in 2013 - so I'll be making every effort to work as fast as I can (without jeopardizing the quality of the pages).  I will make regular updates on this board.

Why am I doing this?:

I've been collecting comics for 25 years - and I've always dreamed of having my own title.  I believe that I have a great story to tell - as well as the artistic skills to make a beautiful looking book.
 
There are tons of weird and unusual characters bouncing around in my imagination - and this book will give me the chance to start letting them escape onto the printed page.
 
Any contribution you make will help me to achieve my goal - and, hopefully, take me a step closer to becoming a name in the comic book industry.

What you'll get if you contribute:

I've included a wide range of contribution amounts - from $5 through to $200.  Perks include PDFs, signed copies of the book, original artwork and even the chance to see yourself as a character in issue 1!! 

What am I doing with your money?:

The funds I receive via indiegogo will go towards the cost of producing issue 1 of this comic book title.  That will include printing costs, art materials (paints, art pads etc), any fees given to other artists who contribute splash pages and the cost of a letterer.

Flexible Funding:

I will go ahead with this project whether I receive my entire funding target or not.  It should be noted, however, that my progress with the project is likely to be slowed down by any lack of interest from funders.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to contribute towards this project, I would be very grateful for any exposure you could give me.  Sharing the link to this campaign on Twitter, Tumbler, Facebook and other social networking sites would be very kind of you.


*PLEASE NOTE:

This comic book will be for mature readers only.  It is set against the background of a London housing estate - and the bad langauge and violence it contains is reflective of that fact.
story_txt:
The Story:
An international, government-approved drug company has been secretly conducting random trials on the general public for over 80 years.Just recently, some of those trials have produced alarming results - and this comic will document the panic and confusion as it unfolds.
Issue 1 of Random Trials will start the tale by focusing on Charlie Cooper, a very unlikely hero.  This balding, middle-aged rocker lives in a high crime area whose water supply has secretly been laced with a mild sedative (to see if it would calm the boisterous population).  The thing is, Charlie hasn't reacted well to the sedative - and world is about to meet a very dangerous (yet thoroughly loveable) man.
The writer & artist:

That's me! I have written the first issue of the comic book and will be illustrating it all myself.  I am a professional illustrator whose work has been featured in several published comics including the Image Comics title 'No Place Like Home' and Terminal Press' zombie anthology - 'Zombiebomb!' 
How I draw & when I'll be finished:
My art techniques are quite laborious and involved.  I colour everything using acrylic paints and colouring pencils - before scanning into photoshop and tweaking with colour treatments.  Because of this, I expect this entire project (Issue 1 = 24 sequential pages + splash pages and info pages) to take AT LEAST 3 months for me to complete.  I really want to get issue 1 ready for distribution at all of the Comic Cons that will be happening across the UK in 2013 - so I'll be making every effort to work as fast as I can (without jeopardizing the quality of the pages).  I will make regular updates on this board.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings Indigogo!

I guess this is where I introduce myself, my name is Ben Lee, and I am an artist and founder of Big Head Productions. And I’m here to ask for your help and support for a comic that’s been a labor of love of mine for, what seems like, forever.

That comic? LOST IN THE MIDDLE. Writing and drawing this story had become more and more important for me to tell. How this came about, well… one job I had in my cube farm career, I had one supervisor, a real “good ‘ol boy” vibe, well, I remember one day he just asked me if my parents owned a dry cleaners. Me, being Korean, the implication being that Asians typically own businesses like a dry cleaners.

Safe to say, I was beyond angry. But I could see the ignorance in his expression, and I couldn’t help but think he meant no offense. So in true “Model Minority” fashion, I shined it on.

But as started writing this story, the protagonist responds more violently, and ultimately finds himself in therapy. From there, the comic became a very introspective story, as the struggles the protagonist faced were deeper than beating up his boss. And suddenly I became really invested in what kind of narrative I could tell that happens over the course of a conversation. And the result has been really fulfilling, and it’s a result I would love to share with the world.

Which brings me here, to you.

What We Need & What You Get

Well, what do I need? Well, approximately $5000. Now how will that be put to use? It’s a simple breakdown:

-  printing

-  marketing and advertising

-  perk fulfillment

Now I mentioned, “perk fulfillment”. I don’t expect anything for free, and I want to give you a little love for your support. Stuff I have outlined is copies of the comic, signed copies of the comic. I’m planning a variant cover, exclusive to this campaign, to offer as a perk. Original art from the comic, and so much more.

And I know there’s no reason why you should know this, but I love sending snail mail, and care packages, so I’ll definitely try and throw a little extra in there to with every perk level. :)

Now, if you’re asking what happens if I don’t reach my goal here? Well, that’s one of the reasons I chose Indigogo over other crowd funding platforms, because there’s the ability to receive all funds raised, even if you don’t reach the goal. Now, where will that money go if I don’t reach my goal? Simply, printing. And I’ll figure the rest out. 

The Impact

Well, the impact your support will have will change my life. And that’s no lip service. Like so many others who want to make comics, this is been something that I’ve wanted to do since I was a kid. Now at 38 years old, I’m all in, and chasing that dream. See, I don’t recall what the proverbial straw was that broke my back at my last job. But last year, I realized between my savings and my freelance, whatever frustration I was having in my office job, I didn’t have to.

So I resigned. I incorporated a company. And I’ve been working to build this thing ever since.

So when I say the impact your support will bring is that it will change my life. I’m not kidding. You’re supporting my dream, and I can’t thank you enough for that. 

Risks & Challenges

The big risk and challenge, aside from fundraising, is getting the book out there. There’s only one distributor for the Direct Market, and there’s always the possibility the book won’t be accepted into their catalog.

But that’s okay. I’m willing to rise the challenge. See that’s one of the reasons I chose to do this myself. See, doing this myself affords me the freedom to chose my own printer, and if need be, my own distribution. And for that, I definitely want to give that business to, well, local business. And who doesn’t want to support their local economy, right?

So if I can’t get into the distributor catalog, I do have a plan to get the book out with a local fulfillment house. It’ll be huge challenge, and a steep learning curve. But, this thing already is. And if it wasn’t it wouldn’t be worth doing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you back this project, and if you do, thank you SO MUCH. But again, whether or not you back this project, if you find it worthwhile, it would mean so much if you can share this campaign with your friends & family. Be social media, email, or even word of mouth.  Every little bit helps.

Well, that’s my pitch. If anything, thank you so much for your time. And I hope you’ll see this book in your local comic shop soon!

— Ben Lee

story:
EDIT: Added a new Comic/Book shop reward level for the more economically minded! 50 dollars for 5 copies of the book. Also, I didn't expect the custom comics to go so fast, so I added two more. But that'll be it. I'm at my page limit for the book.

Also, one of the Andistraction strips has debuted online at Multiversitycomics.com where they also interview me about Max, and art in general.

The Comic

Max Overacts is my webcomic I've been updating for over a year now. The comic centres around the life of Max Fogherty, an emerging serious thespian at the age of 8. It was nominated for a 2011 Eisner Award, but lost, rightly, to Charles Christopher. The comic has a larger story developing underneath the daily gags, and the characters will age, go through changes, make big decisions, and have big things happen to them whether they like it or not. "Volume One: Hold On To Your Stubs" sets us on that journey.


If you've found your way here but never read the comic, please visit occasionalcomics.com and have a read! If you were a fan of Calvin and Hobbes, you may like it. Some people may say it's too similar and I'm just a pale imitation, but to those I say "read more than 5 strips! You'll see..."


The Book

My initial quote (Which is almost the entire fundraising goal, plus some to allow for postage) is for 3000 copies of a 164 page full colour book at 8 x 10 inches. That's only slightly smaller than the original artwork so the details will shine through! If we only make it halfway to the goal, that's still good enough for 1000 copies, so everyone will get their orders. Please don't be afraid of that huge goal! I'm not!


The book will collect the first 142 strips plus 12 exclusive strips not seen on the web, focusing on Max's sister, Andromeda. See Andi at work, meet some of Andi's band mates, and even witness the moment Jacob fell for her and she didn't even notice him.


Plus, there will be an extra two strips if some daring fans step up to the 500 dollar plate, to have themselves put into an actual strip in this book itself, interacting with Max, Janet, Andi, Klaus, etc. Two awesome readers will be immortalized in book form for the ages! YOU will be on people's shelves. In libraries! Beside home lavatories! YOU, yes YOU, may eventually be... in a dollar bin! *gasp* Plus... you'll get to hang the original in your house. ;)


What if you go over your goal?

If the funding goes over, I will most likely print more books, and if it goes WAY over, well... I have lots of ideas for my business, Occasional Comics. I may hire other artists at a good page rate to illustrate side stories of the Max universe (Auryn in Alaska!) if the money comes rolling in. Or, well.. and this is a big pipe dream, I have spent far too long not being paid for what I do, and I know I'm not the only one, so I would love to be in a position one day when I can pay others for their work. To help produce other high quality all ages material that reap maximum profits for the creators. To pay them straight away, and not an arbitrary 30/60/half year waiting period. Lots of BIG ideals. 


Most likely it will be for extra books though, and possibly extra rewards like Max enviro-bags, buttons, vinyl stickers, etc. Surprise gifts for surprisingly awesome fans. But, oh man... BIG ideals... :D


Can we help?

It's a big goal - don't be scared! I'm not! - so I will be looking for as much promotion as I can find - interviews, reviews, etc. I will be calling comic and book stores every day to find those interested in the wholesale rewards, who believe they can sell 10 or 20 copies to their customers. I will be sending out promotional postcards to those I can't get on the phone, looking for buyers all over the place. And not just Canada and the US, but also the UK, NZ, my old homeland Australia, anywhere!

If you know of any store in your own area that is a likely candidate, please email me their address/phone number! Internet searches are great, but it's hard to discern which stores would be interested from just a name, (if they don't have their own website) so this is where your intimate knowledge of your favourite stores would help me greatly. (My email address is on my website.)

Also, the wholesale rewards are there for stores primarily, but if you have 10 (or 20) friends or family who you'd like to gift copies to, by all means, go for the big grab!!

What if you fail?

I know, I know, it's a HUGE goal, and you're probably thinking you might not want to pledge because there's no way I'll make it, and then where will your book be? It's precisely that thinking that won't get this made, so please don't be afraid to make a pledge, and if you're worried, tell everyone else to pledge too! I'll be networking my ears off. This is going to happen.

I DO have back up plans to get the book out no matter what, but I don't need them. I got YOU! Let's go!

story:
Inspired by actual events* as well as beloved novels and films such as Stand By Me and The Stepford Wives, ELECTRIC YOUTH is a two issue, 56 page, full color, coming of age comic thriller that features the creative talents of Kyle Roberts, Clay Adams (Fried Comics), Rafael Dantas (Action Lab Comics) and Emilio Pilliu (ZZZ Comics) 

THE STORY

Ever feel like you weren't the kid your parents wanted you to be? Jeff Eckard does. And when he and his dad move to Irvine, California in the Fall of 1989, things only get worse. Because almost all the kids in this boring-ass town seem gut-churningly perfect. So when Jeff and his friends go dumpster diving behind the local Quickie Mart, they’re just looking for a little...stimulation? Instead, Jeff finds a dead body.

Only, no one believes him. Not his friends, not his dad, no one. It’s up to Jeff to get the evidence himself, but his investigation uncovers an even more horrifying secret...

PREVIEW

New backers - don't feel left out! You can sample 16 pages of issue #1 by clicking the image below and you can see first-hand how our last campaign went down -HERE-!

Without spoiling too much of the story, our next installment picks up right where we left Jeff and Danny at the cliffhanger conclusion of the first issue!

BUZZ FROM THE FIRST ISSUE!

Following the success of ELECTRIC YOUTH's  first campaign we happened to catch the attention of our small local paper that ran a feature in its Sunday edition. Not only that, the story ended up being the second most read article of the weekend!

The added exposure led us to doubling our sales after the campaign and even yielded a few Hollywood inquiries before COVID-19 put the world on hiatus. We're hoping a strong campaign for the second issue will get those producers' attention once again!

Comic speculators take notice!

"Electric Youth is an exhilarating slice of '80s Americana that proudly flaunts the genre conventions of the decade's teen movies in a loving homage. Adams & Roberts craft a tale of misunderstood youth that sets up an intriguing mystery." - COMICBOOKYETI.COM

"Electric Youth is a fresh take on Californian suburbia, with its odd mix of American nostalgia and horror. A good sense of nostalgia is a hard thing to nail, but the horror and humour in Electric Youth has an added authenticity!" - A PLACE TO HANG YOUR CAPE

*THE BACKSTORY 

Way back in 1989, at the age of 14, I moved from a small town outside of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to the burgeoning master planned community of Irvine, California. To call it a culture shock would be an understatement. Those first few weeks were a tough transition, but my circumstances changed for the better when I fell in with a trio guys; Matt, James and Jon...

Living in a town where there was so much to do, yet seemingly nowhere to do it, these guys made a big high school feel small and new town feel like home. James was always the ringleader of the group, constantly walking a fine line between brash and gregarious. After college he was the touchstone through which the four of us reconnected. Our friendship grew as we transitioned into adulthood, each of us settling into careers and families, whilst always staying present in each others lives. As close as we all were, each of us considered James our best friend. Which is why we all were so devastated when he was diagnosed with ALS at the age 32. Within a few short years the disease ravaged his body and robbed him of all motor function. Through it all James maintained his dignity, his sense of humor and his ability to bring us all together. One of those last times, the four of us spent an evening (and a couple of bottles of bourbon) reminiscing about our high school shenanigans - as sad as the circumstances were, it was a truly joyous experience. And from that night and those stories the seeds to this comic were planted. The dumpster event, minus the dead body, actually happened (although I won't say who exactly participated in that one). The characters within Electric Youth are an amalgamation of the four us, although Jon was the premier athlete and Matt was the kid who had to take his math classes at the junior college. They were, and are, the best friends anyone could ever ask for - and this comic, in a way, gives me the opportunity to continue to celebrate those relationships...and also provide you with a fun and thrilling story at the same time!

THE TEAM 

Clay Adams is a co creator of FRIED COMICS, where he has run eight successful KickStarter campaigns. His directorial debut, THE BOY SCOUT, was nominated for Best Short at the Golden Egg Film Festival in Los Angeles and his feature script, The Eclipse, placed second in the horror category of the FadeIn Awards. Clay has also written and directed for Georgia Public Broadcasting and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU.

Kyle Roberts is a high school art teacher and freelance illustrator. As a comic creator he publishes under his imprint, From Beyond Comics. He has successfully launched and fulfilled three projects on KickStarter. A Cal State Fullerton grad, Kyle’s past professional work includes: inking for Rob Liefeld’s Extreme Studios, watch artist at Disneyland and concept artist in the automotive industry.

Rafael Dantas is a Brazilian comic artist with over 10 years of experience. Rafael’s credits include work from Titan Books, Lion’s Forge, Action Lab as well as several Brazilian publishers.

Emilio Pilliu is an Italian comic artist whose style is heavily influenced by manga and anime. He’s worked for ZZZ comics and recently published a collection of erotic portraits called ”Monkeys”.

"Electric Youth is a fresh take on Californian suburbia, with its odd mix of American nostalgia and horror. A good sense of nostalgia is a hard thing to nail, but the horror and humour in Electric Youth has an added authenticity!" - A PLACE TO HANG YOUR CAPE
*THE BACKSTORY 
Way back in 1989, at the age of 14, I moved from a small town outside of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to the burgeoning master planned community of Irvine, California. To call it a culture shock would be an understatement. Those first few weeks were a tough transition, but my circumstances changed for the better when I fell in with a trio guys; Matt, James and Jon...

Living in a town where there was so much to do, yet seemingly nowhere to do it, these guys made a big high school feel small and new town feel like home. James was always the ringleader of the group, constantly walking a fine line between brash and gregarious. After college he was the touchstone through which the four of us reconnected. Our friendship grew as we transitioned into adulthood, each of us settling into careers and families, whilst always staying present in each others lives. As close as we all were, each of us considered James our best friend. Which is why we all were so devastated when he was diagnosed with ALS at the age 32. Within a few short years the disease ravaged his body and robbed him of all motor function. Through it all James maintained his dignity, his sense of humor and his ability to bring us all together. One of those last times, the four of us spent an evening (and a couple of bottles of bourbon) reminiscing about our high school shenanigans - as sad as the circumstances were, it was a truly joyous experience. And from that night and those stories the seeds to this comic were planted. The dumpster event, minus the dead body, actually happened (although I won't say who exactly participated in that one). The characters within Electric Youth are an amalgamation of the four us, although Jon was the premier athlete and Matt was the kid who had to take his math classes at the junior college. They were, and are, the best friends anyone could ever ask for - and this comic, in a way, gives me the opportunity to continue to celebrate those relationships...and also provide you with a fun and thrilling story at the same time!
THE TEAM 

Clay Adams is a co creator of FRIED COMICS, where he has run eight successful KickStarter campaigns. His directorial debut, THE BOY SCOUT, was nominated for Best Short at the Golden Egg Film Festival in Los Angeles and his feature script, The Eclipse, placed second in the horror category of the FadeIn Awards. Clay has also written and directed for Georgia Public Broadcasting and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU.

Kyle Roberts is a high school art teacher and freelance illustrator. As a comic creator he publishes under his imprint, From Beyond Comics. He has successfully launched and fulfilled three projects on KickStarter. A Cal State Fullerton grad, Kyle’s past professional work includes: inking for Rob Liefeld’s Extreme Studios, watch artist at Disneyland and concept artist in the automotive industry.

Rafael Dantas is a Brazilian comic artist with over 10 years of experience. Rafael’s credits include work from Titan Books, Lion’s Forge, Action Lab as well as several Brazilian publishers.

Emilio Pilliu is an Italian comic artist whose style is heavily influenced by manga and anime. He’s worked for ZZZ comics and recently published a collection of erotic portraits called ”Monkeys”.

story:
Our Story

We are trying to raise funds for the promotion and creation of our illustrated web-series "Fixer". All contributions will go towards spreading the word about the series through flyering, convention appearances, and online advertising, as well as the production costs associated with Fixer, which surpasses $300 a month before promotional costs.


The Impact

Helping to contribute to Fixer will keep this ambitious project alive. With out your financial support, the series cannot survive. And and all contributions will help to continue this visionary and artist project.


What We Need & What You Get

Just starting off, we would like to be able to cover our expenses for 2 months. This should be able to help us get on our feet. In return, we offer you incentives such as getting your name in the comic itself, a physical print of the comic, an exclusive, never before seen "Best of Tainted Reality" DVD with never before seen concert and tour footage, the chance to name a character in the story, and even put yourself in it!


Other Ways You Can Help

Blast the campaigns URL all over Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Live Journal, and any where else you can think of!

story:
The GIs of Comedy are Four Standup Comics. All Veterans of the United States Military. Still Serving. One Joke At A Time. The group was founded in 2010 by former US Army Staff Sergeant Thom Tran, who retired from the military after he was wounded in combat in Iraq in 2005. He "enlisted" US Air Force Major Jose Sarduy (still an active reservist), former USMC Sergeant Will C, and former US Army Private First Class Tom Irwin to form the group.

Since this comedic "Troupe of Troops" started they have toured all over the United States on military bases and comedy clubs from New Jersey to Kentucky to San Diego. Now on the Fall leg of their 2012 Tour, the GIs of Comedy plan to film a 2+ hour comedy special for DVD and BROADCAST on a MAJOR TELEVISION NETWORK, AND TO GET TO TROOPS OVERSEAS SO THEY CAN SHARE THE LAUGHTER WITH THE MEN & WOMEN IN UNIFORM!

Does this sound ambitious? Heck yeah. Isn't everybody and their brother trying to "make a DVD"? Yup. But here's why we're SURE we can make all of this happen:

1) Our Executive Producers are Ben Garant & Tom Lennon, the creators and stars of Comedy Central's "Reno! 911" (they play Junior & Dangle!), and the writers of the "Night at the Museum" franchise.

2) Ben & Tom have walked the tour's creator, Thom Tran into Comedy Central HQ to meet with the heads of the network who have shown GREAT interest in the project.

3) We already have an established production company ready to shoot the special!

4) We're ON TOUR RIGHT NOW! And have a deal worked out with a nearly 1,500 seat venue to film the special in November!

5) We are Armed Forces Entertainment approved artists and are currently touring over a dozen US Army Posts performing for troops all across the country!

6) We have the support of the former head of the Los Angeles USO who we've performed for many times, and military troops and commanders all over the country!

7) We've performed for SEAL Team 5 who again came out to support the tour at our recent show in San Diego.

8) The CBS Early Show, CNN, Fox News, and the Associated Press have all shown so much interest in the tour they've done stories about us! (You can see them all on www.youtube.com/gisofcomedy)

9) EVERYONE is supporting our troops, from Hollywood to Budweiser to General Motors.

10) Being based in Hollywood, we have the connections to THE movers and shakers in the Entertainment industry to make this happen!

So now we're asking YOU to help make this DVD and Television Special a reality, and YOU get to be a part of it! By helping fund our Kickstarter you'll have the opportunity to have your name listed in the credits as a contributor (see you name on TV and the DVD!), get an autographed copy of the DVD, be listed as a Producer (in title) on the projects, AND you'll be helping bring some laughter to the men and women who serve our country in uniform!

As for the "delivery date" of August, 2013... why so far out? Here's the plan...

- November 2012 - FILMING! We shoot the special in New London, CT (2 days of pre-production on site, 1 day of filming, 2 days of post/ pickups)

- January 2013 - EDITING! Since we're on tour until the middle of December, we'll be getting additional footage through the end of the tour, and then the holidays are immediately after, post-production and editing won't really start until the New Year. Editing will take between 6-7 weeks, as we're going to be taking footage from 5 months of the road, plus the actual show footage for the DVD

- Feb/ May 2013 - BATTER UP! We've been pitching the special to Networks for months now, and there's some serious interest. It's getting the special DONE which is the crazy part about Hollywood. But we have some heavy hitters on our side!

- July 4th, 2013 - LET MAKE IT HAPPEN! We've been wanting to get this filmed and aired on the 4th of July on whatever network will have us, so this is the air date we're shooting for!

- August 2013 - DVD SHIPPED. With the special (hopefully) aired by July, we'll have the DVD's ready and shipped to those who supported the sepcial!
