story:
Hello!!

First! About me! My name is Cara Nicole. I am also known as AZ Powergirl. I cosplay, edit comics, write, and color art professionally. I am also the model for Magic: The Gathering's Emmara Tandris, numerous novels and variant comic book covers. Last but not least, I am a legislative House of Representatives candidate in Arizona.

Because this is a time sensitive project I am limiting it to indigogo supporters. I will not be mass producing this calendar so get it while you can :)

So here is the detail of what the funds will be used for...

1) Printing and shipping to you.

2) Extra fun bonus prints, banners, Polaroids, etc.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring you this 13 month full color full glossy calendar I need your first born child, a large cauldron, a broom, and a full moon. Oh wait, that's something different... for this I just need some awesome cosplay and art fans to choose the perk they love the best and share this with others on social media. 

 

 

The Impact

The benefits of funding this project are huge! My first and second Photobook were the first of their kind and were wildly successful. So now I bring you the AzPowergirl 2017 Calendar! One of my biggest goals is championing cosplay and adding to its legitimacy as a valid art form. I feel that this project will help to advance this cause. 

As the proverb goes, you vote with your wallet. If you want cosplay, support it and more of it will come!

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make

Risks & Challenges

I've taken on a substantial investment by curating images, building the calendar and finding good printing. This is on top of the time and effort of having built the costumes, shooting with the photographers and editing the images. I always like to support my friends in this industry so I am using printers and photographers who are cosplay friendly and supportive of the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge at this time, you can definitely share this on social media like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, etc etc...

Also, feel free to take a look at my books and prints at my online store: http://183degree.storenvy.com

AND follow my latest photo shoots at http://patreon.com/azpowergirl

story:
alcheringa (in the mythology of some Australian Aboriginals) the 'golden age' when the first ancestors were created. It is also called the Dreamtime. The word comes (in the late 19th century) from the Aboriginal language Arrernte, and means 'in the Dreamtime'.

Alcheringa is a multimedia comic about a young woman named Madelyn who is troubled by reoccurring nightmares. It isn't until Madelyn enters the Dream World that she soon discovers what her true purpose is, in a realm polluted by nightmares. 

The team of Alcheringa consists of a variety of artists ranging from illustrators, colorists, inkers, musicians, djs, writers, photographers, models, designers, jewelers, and creative consultants. Together we work to create a complex and unique world that we hope will engage our readers. 




The comic upon completion will consist of the story, a photograph of Madelyn, and both an Alcheringa mix and music created to fit the story of the comic. The soundtrack will be directly linked to our website. We are all very excited about this project and we can't wait to share the world of Alcheringa with you. 

Please be sure to include specifics of character design, idea, or any information we may need in your donation message. Thank you!

story:
Welcome Indiegogo Backers!!

This is funding for Victor Garduno's first art book!!

'The Art of Garduno'

The 76 Page Art Book by Victor Garduno

Book size is 8.5"x11"

 

About Victor Garduno

Victor has been drawing since he can remember holding a pencil in his hand. His early drawings consisted mostly of superheroes like Batman, Superman, and X-Men. All through school comic book illustrators have inspired him. Upon completion of high school he initiated focus on movie character portraits, pin-up and fantasy art. Having a main interest in superheroes, Victor’s movie art started to take presidence over prior artistic predecessors. Victor has done work for Lucasfilm, Star Wars, Acme Archives, HorrorHound Magazine, and more recently an Exclusive Variant cover for BOOM! Comics BRZRKR #1 featuring Keannu Reeves in partnership with Hive Comics.

 

Hardcover Book

'Time Has Come'

story:
Anyone who has seen my work before has probably noticed how much I love to draw people dancing, so it's likely no big surprise that that's exactly how this whole project started. Originally I had planned to do just a number of stand alone illustrations depicting dancers costumed as planets in a celestial ballet (these images eventually became the covers to each book, all are pictured below ). As I continued to work on them, the idea stuck with me that a celestial ballet seemed like a romantic way to describe astrology and the rest of the project quickly began to take root from there.

As an unabashed lover of astrology (hello, Aquarius) extending these into a series of zines seemed like a great chance to delve in and research every sign. A total of 8 pages from cover to cover, these full color zines are short and sweet but packed with lots of information: general characteristics, associated symbolism, work life, love life and famous people who share the title's sun sign. Basically I wanted to make a small book that was informative and fun, a zine that I would be excited to read myself. As I'm not an astrologer, I came up with the content for each comic by doing a whole lot of research using favorite books, online resources and consulting with my one of my star reading friends.  

The money raised from this Indiegogo campaign will go directly to the cost of printing and shipping the 12 issues and their respective prints. I'm essentially treating this as a pre-order of the books, which will be ready to ship in a couple of months. Whether you want them all, or just want to check one of them out, I'm so grateful for your interest and support of this project! This has been a labor of love and I hope you'll enjoy reading them as much as I loved making them.

          ***In the images below you can see some pages from various issues.***

story:
Mizuumi-Con is a one-day family-friendly anime, gaming, and Japanese culture convention presented by OLLU’s Mizuumi Anime Club, a Recognized Student Organization at Our Lady of the Lake University.  We have educational presentations, cosplay contests, video gaming, voice actors, Video rooms, dealer/artist ally, as well as food booths and other entertainment. 


ZDA (aka Mizuumi-Con 1) was presented as a partnership between OLLU's anime club and San Japan. The same was true for Mizuumi-Con 2 . Mizuumi-Con 3 was run entirely by OLLU students, faculty, staff, and alumni on a shoe-string  budget. We have had pretty steady growth over all these years. ZDA's attendance was 930 with Mizuumi-Con 6 attendance ballooning to 2,415. 

All the funds collected will go into running this year's convention. Our primary goal is to raise enough to give everyone free admission to the event! We believe we can do this if we hit the $20k mark. Past our $20k mark we have quite a few stretch goals to hit as well.

Lots of people have asked why we are trying to crowd-source this year if we've been able to successfully run the event by charging admission in the past. We figured that this would be a worthwhile experiment as we would like to make anime conventions more accessible to the masses. We have all been down the road where you spent all your money to get to a convention and not had any left over to purchase things from artists or dealers (let alone eat).  This way those who can afford to go can "pay it forward" to those who might not be able to.   Another reason for this experiment is more of a practical one.  As some of you may not know, our main two convention coordinators have lives outside of the convention world.  They both have jobs and families that suffer so that you can enjoy all that convention goodness.  Well, sometimes life can be a cruel mistress, and can put a damper on all our convention fun. One has had to move across our fair state to stay employed while the other has been battling a plague of health problems, as well as caring for family that is sick.  On top of all of this, we lost our main transaction processor, so we thought "What the hey, lets try something new!"



When we make our goal, you may ask: "How will registration work?" This is a very good question.  As "free" events tend to draw a crowd, we will be capping convention attendance at 3,000.  Those who donate at a level which says confirmed entry or are Foundation Level or higher, will be able to enter with no fear of being stopped (e.g. think pre-reg in a normal convention experience.)  Those who have already bought a ticket from us at an early convention will be counted at the "Thanks w/ Confirmed Entry" level (you lucky dog!) Children 12 and under are always free if their guardian has a member badge.  Everyone else will line up first come/first serve at registration, except no money will change hands, you tell use you want in, and we give you a badge; one badge per person.  As per policy, memberships can be revoked from those who do not follow posted rules. Remember that at 1:30 pm the day of the convention all unclaimed Confirmed Entry badges turn into pumpkins....er.....get distributed to the general public.

Say however we don't make our goal, but all will not be lost, the convention will go as planned. This is a Flexible Funding fund type which means we will keep the funds we raise, even if our goal is not reached. If the goal is not reached, we will still honor all perks; which translates into those who donated at a confirmed entry level, you just got a pre-reg (with whatever swag that comes with said level), and we will charge our normal fee at the door to those that did not donate.  If you are a vendor or artist please do not donate unless you really want to.  We will not honor those who say they donated wanting a "free" table if we don't meet that stretch goal. To get any table at the convention you must go through our table confirmation process that will go live January 15th on the official convention website.



Of course we have stretch goals!  If our "Hit $20k and every member badge is free" didn't entice you, these others will!

We know how important our Vendors and Artists are to a successful convention, with this in mind if we hit $25k, all vendor and artist table fees will be reduced to zero. That's right, when we hit this goal, those that will have registered and paid for a table, will get a refund AND get to keep their table(s).  How cool is that!?!

It has been a dream of one of our coordinators for a while for us to get one of those huge revival tents to expand convention space (as it is hard to build more campus.) If we hit the $35K, Darrell's dream will become a reality as we will shell out for said space for even more panels and entertainment!

Finally our last stretch goal, the other coordinators dream.  If we hit $60k or over, we will make Mizuumi-Con two days!


Just a reminder:  This is a Flexible Funding fund type which means we will keep the funds we raise, even if our goal is not reached. If the goal is not reached, we will still honor all perks; which translates into those who donated at a confirmed entry level, you just got a pre-reg (with whatever swag that comes with said level), and we will charge our normal fee at the door to those that did not donate.
story_txt:
Mizuumi-Con is a one-day family-friendly anime, gaming, and Japanese culture convention presented by OLLU’s Mizuumi Anime Club, a Recognized Student Organization at Our Lady of the Lake University.  We have educational presentations, cosplay contests, video gaming, voice actors, Video rooms, dealer/artist ally, as well as food booths and other entertainment. ZDA (aka Mizuumi-Con 1) was presented
as a partnership between OLLU's anime club and San Japan. The same was true for Mizuumi-Con 2 . Mizuumi-Con 3 was run entirely by OLLU students,
faculty, staff, and alumni on a shoe-string  budget. We have had pretty steady growth
over all these years. ZDA's attendance was 930 with Mizuumi-Con 6 attendance ballooning to 2,415. All the funds collected will go into running this year's convention. Our primary goal is to raise enough to give everyone free admission to the event! We believe we can do this if we hit the $20k mark.  Past our $20k mark we have

story:
Breathtaker is a critically acclaimed Harvey Award-nominated graphic novel, first published by DC Comics and Vertigo in the early '90s. The award-winning, world-famous artists / creators Mark Wheatley (Jonny Quest, Frankenstein Mobster, EZ Street, Insight Studios & more) and Marc Hempel (The Sandman, Disney Adventures, Heavy Metal & more) are offering you the opportunity to pick up a new, improved, and remastered edition of this long out-of-print book. And then they want to continue their groundbreaking story of love, death, passion, and the journey toward redemption. But for all of this to happen they need your help. And for that you will not go home empty-handed! Now is your chance to give the breath of life to Breathtaker.



Siren. Temptress. Man-eater. Call Chase Darrow what you want, but whatever the label, the truth is that she is the Breathtaker: a nice young woman who possesses the power to love a man to death. Chase Darrow might be the only real, living example of a succubus. Breathtaker is part horror story, about a woman with the power to drain men of their very life force ... part romance, because her lovers are her willing victims ... part crime story, as Chase is on the run from a government that has branded her a criminal ... and part superhero story: she is pursued by The Man, a popular television and merchandising figure who also happens to have extraordinary powers and abilities that he is using to hunt down and capture Chase in an effort to boost his sagging Nielsen ratings. Story and painted, color art by Mark Wheatley and Marc Hempel.

Since Breathtaker was first published, it has influenced quite a few comics and creators. It is often found on the reference shelves of popular animators, including Genndy Tartakovsky (Dexter's Laboratory, Samurai Jack), who contacted Marc to tell him so. Fans who read the book become advocates who go around insisting that everyone should read it!

For ages, the comics industry has celebrated books that had a reach beyond our usual territory. Breathtaker has been at the head of the pack, being featured in highly attended museum shows across the United States. It all began at the Norman Rockwell Museum as a large portion of their very popular show, LitGraphic: The World of the Graphic Novel. From there, the Breathtaker comic pages, paintings, script pages, and development roughs went on to the Toledo Museum of Art, the Huntington Museum of Art, the James A. Michener Museum, the Munson-Williams-Proctor Arts Institute, and the Fitchburg Art Museum.


Marc Hempel and Mark Wheatley have an impressive track record working across the media, with many awards and nominations.

Marc Hempel is best known for his collaboration with Neil Gaiman on "The Kindly Ones" story arc in The Sandman, as well as his critically acclaimed work with Mark Wheatley on the titles Breathtaker, Mars, and Blood of the Innocent (soon to be a major motion picture). His own creations Gregory and Tug & Buster have been nominated for Eisner and Harvey awards, and his humor anthology Naked Brain was named Best Comic Book in the Baltimore City Paper's Best of Baltimore 2003 issue. Hempel's art has also appeared in Marvel Fanfare, Epic Illustrated, Heavy Metal, Jonny Quest, Tarzan the Warrior, Clive Barker’s Hellraiser, Flinch, My Faith in Frankie, The Dreaming, Lucifer, and Disney Adventures. More recently, Marc has produced CD art for the Nashville band Swamp Rat, drawn an episode of the online strip Munden's Bar for ComicMix.com, illustrated a 21-page Escapist story for Dark Horse Comics, and has contributed to both MAD Magazine and Nickelodeon Magazine. He is the recipient of the Speakeasy Award and the Inkpot Award.


Mark Wheatley holds the Eisner, Inkpot, Mucker, Gem and Speakeasy awards and nominations for the Harvey Award and the Ignatz Award. His work has been repeatedly included in the annual Spectrum selection of fantastic art, and has been exhibited in private gallery shows, The Norman Rockwell Museum, Toledo Museum of Art, Huntington Art Museum, Fitchburg Art Museum, James A. Michener Art Museum, and the Library of Congress, where several of his originals are in the LoC permanent collection. He has designed for Lady Gaga, created set pieces for The Black Eyed Peas, contributed designs to ABC’s Beauty and the Beast and CBS's Super Clyde. Several of his original graphic novels have been optioned for motion pictures, with Blood of the Innocent currently in pre-production. His graphic novel creations include Return of the Human, EZ Street, Lone Justice, Mars, Breathtaker, Black Hood, Prince Nightmare, Hammer of the Gods, Blood of the Innocent, Frankenstein Mobster, Miles the Monster, Skultar, and Titanic Tales. His interpretations of established characters such as Tarzan, Baron Munchausen, Jonny Quest, Dr. Strange, The Flash, Captain Action, Argus, and The Spider have brought them to life for a new generation of readers. He has written for TV, illustrated books, designed cutting-edge role-playing games, hosted a weekly radio program, and was an early innovator of the online, daily comic strip form.



Your perks will be exceptional! Please read the rewards list closely, as we are piling on the benefits and would hate for you to miss out on anything. If you help us to go beyond our goal, every additional dollar will go toward value added features for the remastered Breathtaker, including additional pages of material. If we reach our stretch goal, Mark and Marc will create the long asked for The Man™comic book story that is talked about in the context of the Breathtaker graphic novel. But, also, they will forge ahead with the long-awaited Breathtaker sequel.

The incredible Breathtaker perks include :





The full title of the original graphic novel is Breathtaker: Love, Death, Sex, Power.

Over the years it has become shorthand to just call the book Breathtaker. But now it's important that you are aware of its full title, because the very first presentation Mark and Marc made to editor Mike Gold at DC Comics included the promise of a sequel … one that was planned to take place about 20 years later. No one ever imagined it might take over 20 years to finally create that sequel. That’s right – once  Breathtaker Remastered is ready, Marc and Mark will begin work on the next Breathtaker story!

SOURCE MATERIAL

Much of the original art for Breathtaker is retained in storage at Insight Studios. Also, art collectors are being asked for scans of the small number of pages that are in their hands. The hunt for missing original pages is ongoing. Please contact us if you have an original color page or know of collectors who have color Breathtaker pages.

PUBLISHER

Negotiations have just completed for one of the largest publishers in the world to print and distribute the finished, remastered book.  Once the remastered book is delivered to the publisher, they will get it into as many sales outlets as possible around the world. But a tremendous amount of work must be done before that can happen.

The real work is only just beginning … and this is where your help will be so necessary. At the time Breathtaker was originally published, graphics computers were the size of a car and very expensive – way beyond the budget for this graphic novel. So Mark painted the pages in watercolor and gouache on ⅛-inch thick board. The line art was transferred to giant film positives and an unholy art sandwich was sent to the color separator for printing.

The next step was absolutely horrific for any artist! When the separator got the color art boards, they had to strip the surface layer of paper from the board so that they could wrap it around a spinning drum scanner. That’s right – they were ripping the art boards, and stretching the paper in the process! The results were okay to good, but never perfect. And in the years since, the paper and the film have changed sizes so that they do not match today. The pages are being carefully re-scanned and will be digitally manipulated to finally get a perfect marriage of the line art and painted color. In a number of cases the art is being retouched by Mark Wheatley, to remove damage and dirt, and even – in a few frightening instances – repair pages that were torn in half when the original color separator wrapped it around that scanning drum! The remastered Breathtaker will finally present the art as it was always intended. Nearly as much time is being invested in this process as it took to create the work in the first place! But it is worth the effort to finally get it right.

Marc and Mark always reach for higher and higher goals with each new project; remastering Breathtaker is no different. They intend for this book to be the very best it can be. They will include piles of the original script pages, development work, Marc’s pencils and line art, private commissions, marketing art, and other cool, behind-the-scenes material – even some new work!

Once this campaign funds, production will begin on the remastering of the original Breathtaker. After commissions are out of the way, Marc and Mark will use any remaining funding to get started on the sequel.


WHERE THE MONEY’S GOING

REMASTERING WORK ON BREATHTAKER: LOVE, DEATH, SEX, POWER – more than 200 pages of scanning and extensive art repair and restoration, as well as outreach efforts to gain access to some of the missing original art.

NEW CONTENT – creation of new covers, text features, additional art

LAYOUT/DESIGN – for the book and the additional and added features in the remastered edition

POSTAGE/PRINTING COSTS FOR PREMIUMS

CROWD FUNDING COMMISSIONS

STRETCH GOAL - $60,000

The Man™ comic book story. Mark Wheatley and Marc Hempel will create the actual overblown, Marvel-style The Man™ comic book that is shown as an object in the context of the original Breathtaker graphic novel.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

While the core material for Breathtaker Remastered already exists, the restoration work is nearly as demanding as the original creation, and requires the eyes and hands of an artist to get the work done. None of this is all that risky, as long as the artists, Marc Hempel and Mark Wheatley, are healthy and able to take the time to do this work as it should be done. Mike Gold, editor for the original series and a producer on the sequel has said, “There are plenty of comics pros who wish Mark would slow down. He turns out great work and doesn’t worry editors about missed deadlines.”

The publisher will get the finished book about 6 months after the closing of this fundraiser, if our goals are met. The solicitation cycle for a book to reach market is about 12 months; that’s where we get our estimate of 14-18 months for publication.

If any unforeseen issues should arise, we will keep donors informed of any and all changes in our production timeline.

story:
Pronto Comics: If one succeeds, we all succeed

Imagine sitting at home in a room or basement, working, toiling. Pouring your heart and soul into a creative endeavor.

Then you hear, "What are you doing?! Stop wasting your time and get a real job!!"

You just wish you were recognized. That there were people you could work with, read your work, or look at your art. Give you positive encouragement and tell you your dreams can be real. 

That is who we are—we're Pronto Comics and we believe when one succeeds, we all succeed!

Its a labor of love

Comic books are a labor of love. They test you, push your boundaries, and always demand more from you. Fame and money only come to a few of us. Those who make comics do so for the love of the craft. 

Our campaign is to help those who love making comics. It will fund us for the remainder of the year and allow us to connect with, educate, and promote emerging creators. 

With every contribution we receive, it is an affirmation of Pronto Comics' mission and encouragement to our creators, contributors, and members.

Your support is not only financial but moral as well. It tells those working at home on a computer screen or drafting board that their drive and determination are valid. It says that their creativity has merit and their dreams are justified. 

The funds we need and How they will be used

Studio Space for Meetings: $100 – Networking and event meetings

Event Space: $400 – Room rental, food, drinks, prizes, raffle tickets, music

Comic Conventions: $500 – Fees to cover tables at various conventions in the Tri-State Area

Plastic Shopping Bags: $500 – Logo bags for shoppers who buy our comics

Printing Fees: $1,000 – Covering the cost of printing new comics

Misc. Hardware: $200 – Comic book racks, office supplies, ledgers, letterhead, microphones, sound systems, candy, balloons and helium, tablecloths, etc

Promotional Material: $500 – Business cards, postcards with QR codes, flyers, posters, stickers, magnets, buttons, and name tags, etc

Computer/Online Materials: $300 – Website updates and upkeep, domain name registration, online advertising, web design, video production

Distribution: $1,000 – Print and online advertisements

Our Perks

Perks range from $5, which gets you 5 digital copies of our comics, all the way up to $1,000, for which we make a comic book about you, and of course everything in between. We have perks for readers, perks for art lovers, and perks for collectors. There are perks for social media aficionados and for those who want to expand their graphic novel collection.

We have perks at all levels of contribution that any comic book fan will love.

Order of Priority

In the event that we do not make our goal, all funds raised will be used in this priority:

1. Books: Always first and foremost!

2. Studio space for meetings and events

If we reach over $1,500, funds raised will be used in the following order of importance:

3. Comic conventions
4. Plastic shopping bags
5. Distribution
6. Promotional materials
7. Computer/online materials
8. Misc. hardware

More about us and why we need to succeed!

Pronto Comics has been a non-profit comic book company for over 5 years. We specialize in discovering, fostering, and introducing comic book creators to the comic book community and the world at large. 

We've helped many creators get a footing in the comic book industry. People have begun their careers here and we have expanded our membership accordingly. However, since we don't charge a membership fee our funding has not grown as quickly. 

In years past, we have mounted a successful Kickstarter campaign, live art/ writing events titled Phrases to Pages that are held twice a year, and sold out of our comics regularly at all the conventions we've attended. However, because of our aggressive expansion we still need more funding to take Pronto Comics to the next level. 

Contributing to Pronto Comics will allow us to help creators' dreams come true. Everyone who comes to us does so with the dream of being a comic book creator, whether it's writing, drawing, coloring, inking, lettering, or editing. 

We point people in the right direction and get them on the path of dream fulfillment. By helping us, you will help hundreds of creators!

We CAN do It!!

Raising this kind of money won't be easy. It is going to take hard work and a lot of dedication on our parts to keep asking and promoting it. However, we have the numbers to do that. 

Our members will reach out and expand this message on their networks and ask their friends to share it on and on. 

We have only a short time to raise it, but that will focus us further and make us eat, sleep, and breathe the expansion of our company. 

Tell one, tell all

Even if you can't contribute $5, 'cause we all know times aren't easy, you can still help. Tell your friends, tell your family. 

Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, even Pinterest! Sing it from the roof tops, send smoke signals and carrier pigeons. 

Help us spread the word!!!


Thank you for your support.

That there were people you could work with, read your work, or look at your art. story:
Short Summary

 

I am a storyteller, through and through. I've been writing since I was at least 13, coming up with goofy little side-stories for videogames and anime. It wasn't until I got into college that the world of comic books became a reality and I hit the ground running. I thought "I can use comics as a way to improve my art and storytelling and act as a stepping stone to, later, animating my work!"

 

   It's been an uphill struggle for ten years. Researching, drawing, writing, crying, heartache, anxiety, on the verge of giving up. But I never did and here I am at last. Finally good enough to produce and to make the vision of my life come true.

 

   It is a fervent wish of mine to be successful but not just for myself. I want to be successful so that it will serve as a vehicle of inspiration to all others who may have the desire to create entire worlds just from their imaginations.



What We Need & What You Get

 

Let's break down the numbers:

 

  • Ideally, $2500-3000 is what I'm aiming for. Most of this money will go to Technology updates and art instruction so that I can improve upon my art even faster. Once I acquire the necessary equipment, I will be working on an artbook with fan-contributed work amongst my own as well as the printing of the first few chapters. I will also be using some of these funds to build a website that will feature all of my other projects as well as 'Descendant'.

 

  • As a perk, I will be giving away free art and books as time progresses. Right now I have nothing to give back to you other than my solemn oath to work diligently.  D':

 

  • But I hope that doesn't stop you from helping! Believe me, if you give, I give in some way. As I gain popularity and funds are generated from my endeavours, I will be extending much in the way of community appreciation as I truly enjoy engaging my fans and friends. Everything from free merchandise to convention passes.

Not reaching my goal will not hinder my push forward. I will simply put the money aside until I am able to generate all of the necessary funds and beyond to keep my obligations to my friends and fans.

 

The Impact

 

Your contributions will do something personal for me. It will be the light at the end of this very long tunnel. The money generated will get me a few steps closer to getting out of food service and finally free to focus on my goals 100%. You will ALL be my official heroes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Can't give money?

 

That's PERFECTLY fine. I accept art of my beloved characters, stories and, someday soon, I hope to be creating role playing sheets so I can see how well the mechanics of the characters and their classes/roles in my universe are understood.

 

I'm also looking for people to help me learn flash and to make my comic website look even better than it now by adding character designs, beastiary and a place for featured fanart and contests!

 

Just hitting the *tweet* button will help immensely!

 

-----------------

 

Want to follow along?


You can follow 'Descendant' here:

Descendant on Smackjeeves

Descendant on Mangamagazine.net

 

Chapter 3 is now in the works!

story:
UPDATE: 6/25/15- FULLY FUNDED & SECOND STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED!

  A big, huge THANK YOU, and a hot, sexy kiss from Rissk herself to all of you who helped us to reach our goal in under 24 hours, and for enabling the unlocking of Stretch Goal #1! And now, I'm pleased to announce Stretch Goal #2! The new goal is $3600, and if we hit that mark, I'll be adding an additional 8-page Rissk/Widow story from THRESHOLD #5 to all versions of MAXIMUM RISSK, increasing the page count from 24 pages to 32 pages! Please share this link (http://igg.me/at/rissk/x/10814840) if you'd be so kind, and thanks to all of you who have contributed to this unique campaign! 


The Story 

I'm Mike Wolfer, writer and artist of such horror comic classics as WIDOW, NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD, FRIDAY THE 13TH, Brian Pulido's LADY DEATH and many more. I recently returned to my self-publishing roots with the formation of Mike Wolfer Entertainment, and have run several very successful Kickstarter campaigns to fund THE CURSE OF RAGDOLL, DAUGHTERS OF THE DARK ORACLE, and WIDOW ARCHIVES. However, Kickstarter does not allow material of an adult nature, so I've come to Indiegogo with my latest project because here, anything goes!

  Rissk made her first appearance in 1997's WIDOW #0. In 1999, publisher Avatar Press reprinted all of Widow's adventures leading up to WIDOW #0 in the 14-issue, x-rated WIDOW X series, and I retconned those stories to contain new, adults-only scenes featuring Rissk. In May of this year, I ran a Kickstarter to reprint all of Widow's adventures in the four-volume WIDOW ARCHIVES, but because of Kickstarter's standards, I had to remove all of the x-rated material, including all scenes with Rissk, as well as her 12-page origin story that ran as a back-up feature in WIDOW X.

  And that's what you'll get in MAXIMUM RISSK- All of the material that was too hot for Kickstarter! MAXIMUM RISSK contains her 12-page origin story, as well as 8 story pages that were excised from WIDOW ARCHIVES, all strung together with new dialog to form a single narrative. WARNING: Because this material was created for a totally exploitative, x-rated comic, THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO REDEEMING, ARTISTIC MERIT TO ANY OF IT! I'm not kidding. It's total, mindless filth, and strictly for adults only (XXX)! If you haven't been scared away by now, read on...!

The Goal 

MAXIMUM RISSK is a 24-page, black and white comic book, and is available in several different editions: Regular, Nude, and Sketch Cover Edition. But her story doesn't end there! You can also get Rissk's debut from WIDOW #0, repackaged as the 48-page, black and white FANGS OF THE WIDOW ANNUAL, in an exclusive, Indiegogo Edition! This book was previously available for backers of the WIDOW ARCHIVES Kickstarter, but the Indiegogo Edition cover features new coloring and the Indiegogo logo to make it a unique collectible!

  My goal for this campaign is $1600 US, which will be enough to pay for the printing of all of the perks, and allow for an overprint of all editions so that I can sell them at conventions. But- AND THIS IS IMPORTANT- all backer perks will be SIGNED & NUMBERED, with that numbering limited to the number of backers! Unlike other crowdfunded campaigns where you might have seen creators later selling the same backer perks at a discount, these signed & numbered editions will NEVER be sold ANYWHERE- They are exclusive to Indiegogo and you!
 

The Perks (Rewards)

  The MAXIMUM RISSK campaign begins with the regular cover of the 24-page, black and white MAXIMUM RISSK, for a contribution of $15! This backer edition is autographed by Mike Wolfer, and is numbered, limited to the total number of backers only!

  After you witness the origin of Rissk in MAXIMUM RISSK, the story continues in the 48-page, black and white FANGS OF THE WIDOW ANNUAL, which is also signed & numbered and gets added to the perks at the $25 level. The cover coloring of this special Indiegogo Edition of the FANGS OF THE WIDOW ANNUAL varies from the Kickstarter edition- You could almost say they're like day and night!

  Next comes a very special variant cover, the nude edition of MAXIMUM RISSK! As with the previous covers, this is also signed and numbered, and limited to the number of backers. All three books can be yours for a contribution of only $45!

  There's also an inked Sketch Cover edition at the $140 level!

  Next up are comic sets, featuring either my writing or art, or both! These sets all have limited quantities, so if you're a collector you'll need to act fast.


   The most unique and one-of-a-kind rewards can be found at the next two levels!
   At $250, you can get an original, inked, 11" X 17" commission of one character with minimal background of any comic or movie character of your liking (nudes are permissible)!

  But the greatest bragging rights go to those who back the $350 level! With this level, you'll get an original art commission (comic cover quality) of any Mike Wolfer character. This piece will later be used as either a comic book cover or art print, and the first time it sees print, your name will be listed on the printed work as the owner of the original art! Choose from Rissk, Widow, Ragdoll, Countess Bathory, The Siren, or The Wolfwoman (nudes are permissible)!

   And now, to give you an idea of what the interior of MAXIMUM RISSK looks like, here's a sample page, which has been censored. I told you it's absolute filth!

 

Incredible, Collectible ADD-ONS!

  For the die-hard collectors out there, here are two items that are sure to please! On the left is the CULT CLASSIC EDITION of MAXIMUM RISSK. Any backer with mailed rewards can add this autographed variant edition to their perks package by simply adding $25 to their pledge at check-out. And on the right is an ULTRA-RARE edition available ONLY to those who hold "Bonus Codes," acquired from my various Kickstarter campaigns. The CULT CLASSIC BONUS CODE EDITION of MAXIMUM RISSK will be signed and numbered, and limited to the number of backers who redeem their codes. If only one person redeems their existing Bonus Code, then it's an edition of ONE copy! It's a collector's edition like no other! 

Adding International Shipping Fees + Add-On Costs

  Here on Indiegogo, backers have to add their own shipping fees to their contribution amount at check-out. These will apply to all backers outside the United States, and those fees are listed on each Perk level description. When you go through the check-out process, you'll see your selected Perk, and the "Additional Gift" option below it. Click the "Custom" button and enter the dollar amount that covers your shipping fees and/or Add-On fees. If you are doing Add-Ons, send me a message to tell me what items you want added to your Perks package. Simple!

Stretch Goals

  Oh, yes, there will be Stretch Goals! Keep watching for details throughout the campaign!

Delivery

  All perks will be shipped to backers in September 2015. Packages with original art commissions will ship in October 2015.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  As with other crowdfunding campaigns that I've run, word of mouth is a great way for us to reach our goal and to unlock those additional Stretch Goals from which everyone with mailed rewards benefits. Please use the convenient Indiegogo share tools, and spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, or wherever else fans of horror comics congregate! Up-to-date information can be found on The Curse of Ragdoll Facebook Page. Thank you, and see you in Hell!

story: This project is not just a project of the one off type. It is a passion, a continuous learning process, a job, as well as a dream of mine since I was very little. I poured my heart and soul into this comic book and I plan to keep doing that for myself and the people that support me.

story:
Short Summary

I have met waitress Marina in a coffee bar, I think she asked me for a cigarette.  
As a revenge, on the bar table, between the coffee cups, ashtrays and bags of sugar, she told me the most extraordinary story I have ever heard.
True story but unbelievable, sad but powerful, from the past but so Hot. 

Marina was just drinking coffee with her friends, when the bloody war split on the table. The table was in Bosnia, Marina was the Serb and her friends were Muslims...

TragiComic about manipulation and propaganda, about  the Hate between former neighbours, about the civil War, about suffering and dying… but also about strong friendship and brave spirit, that cross all the contrasts and differences between any religions and cultures. 

Even after many years, the marks of War remains. Now is Marina working as a waitress and she serves us the menu of her war experiences - to remind us of the taste, before somebody orders the war on your table...
War Menu:
"Documentary Photos from the Bosnia-Serb War"  feat  "Coffee Table"

During this time I have met Marina, I was working as Photo Editor in a big and respectful newspaper, surrounded by documentary and famous photos. But in the news, we never presented the wars so truly boiling, how a veteran waitress laid it on the bar table! I’ve been told, that war is too bitter for the readers and the advertisers don't like the sad issues neither, because it kills the shopping mood.

Well, Peace is sweet, but - do we prefer sweet propaganda then real taste of Life? 

So i started to make the photos of the cups and sugar bags, drawing main sweet heroes of Marina story, searching the information on the net, looking for documentary photos from the Balkan war,... and making the collages between the sweet words and bitter world, between famous art and forgotten wars.

The whole comix is done, 6 chapters, 103 color pages + cover

 




Curious about more? You can see almost whole book for free! Check 5 chapters here!

... but you can not read it, right? :/ 
Well guys, the crazy text in the bubbles is not any bloody code, but czech, my native language. I do pretty speak english,...and it is a comic, so more visual then the text. But! The tiny line-language between appetite for War and taste for Life, the right proper words for sweet sugar and (still) sweet human spirit... 

Hell yeah, Metaphwar on the table needs professional poetic translation! 

To make the comic see the World, Im trying to collect money for great english translation & respectful hard-cover printed BOOK! Full colors, 103 pages... 

Printing is very expensive and keep the high quality I can run "just" for minimum 100 copies (so the BOOK will be much a limited edition ,-) , all books signed. 

Reaching the goal will cover the cost of: english translation, book printing run, freight costs to get the books to me, shipping the books and other goodies to you guys, and Indiegogo's cut of the raised funds.

How fundraising works:
Yes, your donation helps! You can select as many perks as you want, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being awesome: you are also receiving sweet stuff as proof of that! 

Rewards against the war! (choose the perk for your support:)
  • 6 antiwar postcards ready to be send around the world! (4 collages used in the comic + 2 extra)
  • 2 Antiwar Badges
  • Antiwar set T-shirt+Bag.
    Choose one design from 2 options, available in all common sizes.
  • Your own personal postcards from yours assembled photos or even mini Comic about YOU (you send me the photos and some info -> I will make the collages and small fantastic-real story, aprox. 10 pages + cover. Some example of the personal fairy tale book made from the assembled photos here.
  • awesome dammit printed BOOK!

Check antiwar Collages on this link
Or wear antiwar set T-shirt + Bag! Fine material, all sizes S, M, L, XL, XX

2 Antiwar Badges!

Ohh, I `ve almost forgot! :)) 
Whole sweet comic BOOK "War is sweet"



Welcome to REWARDS Menu: 


Risks & Challenges

The whole comic is done in czech language, I have put all except the last chapter on internet for you to have a look. Czech online readers can already even buy the complete e-BOOK  here!
If a raise the money for professional translation, then the english version is available in couple weeks! No worries, it is a comic and there is not so much text. So you can taste the war translation pretty fast ,-)

If you still have questions, don't hesitate to ask: I will be setting up a FAQ tab in the next few days and try to answer best as I can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Finally, please use the share tools at the top of this page to tweet, e-mail, facebook posts and let people know about the War Menu. You can still make a huge difference and help the Book to happen by spreading the word about this campaign.

Thank you & Make coffee not War!

WARNING: the war is not easy, therefore even this sweet comic (nor war) is not recommended for the children. No, seriously, it could be more heavy than happy.

story:
To Penelope Ayers, everyone is the enemy and nowhere is safe. While she far exceeds her ballet classmates in skill and determination, she alienates herself to avoid being picked on.

Pen used to be quiet and reserved, but lately she lashes out at any opportunity. She's bossed around by her roommate, bullied in her classes, and lectured by her instructor. All she wants is to be the best and prove everyone wrong, but the anger and isolation is driving her crazy. What's wrong with bragging if it's the truth? What's wrong with being alone when you're surrounded by people you hate? Pen will have to settle for something before she ruins her career.

Cavalier is a ~30-page short comic in full-color. The main genres are drama and slice-of-life and is rated PG for language. The estimated finish date on the comic is June 1st, 2014 if it's fully funded and July 1st, 2014 if it's partially funded.

At the start of this campaign, the script has been fully written, characters have been fully designed, and the comic has been thumb-nailed and paneled.

All the proceeds from the funding will go towards printing, binding, shipping and cost of living.

Half of the price (~$1200) is being saved for printing, keeping in mind I don't know exactly how many copies I'll need. At this price I can safely say I can afford a nice, full-color print for every funder above $20. Once I figure out the exact number of copies, setting aside enough money to print that many will become the first priority before money is allocated anywhere else.

The other half will go towards a percentage to Indiegogo (4-9%), a percentage to my editor Colin Meyer (determined by ending funding amount), and roughly $8/hour for the projected time it will take to finish the comic. Since I'll begin the comic after funding, the goal will not shift regardless of how many hours I actually work on the comic, and is the lowest priority of payment.

Perks for contributing to the production of this comic include digital copies, physical copies, and an additional art appendix. In the art appendix I'll share notes about productions, characterization notes, thumbnails, and all the extra art and sketches I can fit in.

Beyond that, there's opportunities to get extra personalized sketches or even full-fledged commissions of any subject of your choosing. Most everything can be customized to your preference, such as whether you want me to avoid marking on the inside cover or if you want a nice print of your commission sent to your home.

If this campaign gets extra attention, I'd be happy to suggest some stretch goals to shoot for.

  • At $4000, I will make an electronic-only extra epilogue comic to follow the story's ending. At ~15 pages, it will show the consequences of the changes that took place during the comic for people who want to see Pen all grown up.
  • At $6000, I will make an electronic-only extra prologue featuring Richardt during his prime, before he was disfigured. It will focus on his battle with his sexuality, his accident (not explained in original comic), and his fall from the top. Expected to be 15-20 pages long, finish date estimated mid to late July.

If there is extended interest beyond that, I'll be open to more stretch goals. Those listed will be available to everyone who donates at least $5.

Even if you cannot donate, you can help me a lot by sharing this campaign wherever you can,

I'm not exaggerating when I say that funding this project would be a dream come true. I've loved and practiced art since I was young, and with these funds I would be able to write and draw my own comics as a source of income. Not only will I improve greatly while drawing it, it will be an indispensable learning experience, hopefully making it so I can draw more and better comics for a long time to come. If you like my style, my stories, or heck, if you're just really nice, then you'll be doing me a gigantic favor by supporting me.

Why should you support this story? Besides helping a burgeoning comic artist, you'll also be supporting a female-centric, body positive comic without a patronizing tone. The comic will lack a romantic counterpart and focus solely on the trials and tribulations of a teenage girl, and challenge expectations of the people around us.

So share, talk about it, and in a few months, enjoy it!

Thanks for your consideration,
Liam Purdy

story:
Short Summary

In the elite circles and hushed whispers around the planet, the world’s best and highest paid assassins are mentioned as myths.  But if you can afford their fee, the Hit Squad is available to handle your extermination needs.  A once in a lifetime opportunity presents itself when hitman extraordinaire Rico Brande is recruited by the mysterious Mistress Sinn to join the exclusive Hit Squad.  Given an “initiation job” with the Hit Squad, Brande learns the deadly secret behind the Hit Squad...one that they are willing to kill to protect!  What happens when the hunter becomes the hunted and goes up against the best of the best?  Find out in the pages of THE HIT SQUAD #0!

By picking up this book, you will be helping to bring the next issue, THE HIT SQUAD #1 to life.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

With this being the follow up campaign to the recent COSMOS #1 book, I want to continue to introduce my comics to the Indiegogo Community and have chosen THE HIT SQUAD #0 the next to do so.  

Since the book is already completed, I am only asking for the minimum funding for two reasons: (1) I do not need funding to finish this book because it is already completed and (2) I really want to try to grow an Indiegogo following for our books.  I want EVERYONE we can get to make this campaign successful.  Don’t get me wrong, it would be awesome to get more than the minimum and succeed by getting the book into as many hands as possible (hopefully, we can make it happen) but I will be grateful to get new readers to the book.

We have a great book and some pretty cool rewards for you if you choose to back our campaign. We even have a pretty nifty Fanboy Action Boxed Set that is loaded with items and FIVE lucky backers will be able to walk away with our exclusive tenth anniversary Black Box Set!

If we achieve anything above our funding goal, that money will go directly into the creation of the upcoming THE HIT SQUAD #1.   

 

The Impact

The Hit Squad are important characters within my comics universe and is why I wanted to introduce them first ahead of any of the heroes.  Why is that, you ask?!  Because everyone loves a great villain and we’ve got a whole group of them!  

This is my next book following the successful COSMOS Indiegogo campaign but by no means my first project like this.  I have produced several other campaigns on other platforms and want to continue to do so here on Indiegogo as well.

 I hope that the Indiegogo Community will give THE HIT SQUAD #0 a try so that we can bring other great comics projects to the platform.  And I will make everyone who backs our campaigns a promise to always deliver them and to strive to give you some damn good comics & items that are worth your hard earned cash!

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks to this campaign are slim to none because the book is completed and just needs to be printed to meet the number of backers of this campaign who want it.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people won’t be able to back the campaign because of the holidays but you can still help by:

  • Asking folks to get the word out and making some noise about the Hit Squad campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!


I hope that you will give THE HIT SQUAD #0 a try and back this book.  I thank you for taking the time out to look at this campaign and wish you a very Merry Christmas & Happy Holidays!

story:
Short Summary

I always loved those epic, comic book stories, with great villains, and even greater heroes, fighting it out with stakes as high as saving the universe from complete destruction.

But, comic book heroes are always a step behind, confronting the villain only after he has begun to carry out his heinous plans.

All intriguing villains face a moral choice that puts them on the path to evil.  We might even say that before any evil act is committed, a spiritual battle inside the soul has already been lost.  The consequence of that loss, is the evil that we see.  But the spiritual battle remains unseen.

But, what if there were a new kind of hero?  One who had vision into the moral conflicts faced by the characters he met and could see the demons tempting them, and know their plans?  So, he could intervene on a spiritual rather than a physical level, before the villain decides to walk his evil path?

What if victory on a spiritual level meant that not just lives could be saved, but immortal souls, as well?

Welcome to "Blind Prophet!"

Hello, Comic Book lovers!

My name is Joseph Cillo Jr.  I'm the Creator and writer of Blind Prophet, the third in a series of screenplays I have written from a Roman Catholic perspective.

Blind Profit is the story of a blind, autistic savant who undergoes an experimental operation which gives him the ability to peer into the spirit world and see demons and angels vying for human souls.


Blind Prophet was originally conceived as a movie, and I still would like to pursue realizing the story on film.  But, it includes a lot of religious content that is important to me as the writer that might not survive the Hollywood editing process. So, we are going to publish this as seven episodes of a comic book, then roll it all up in a single volume as a graphic novel.

The entire series will be seven episodes:

  • A Prophet is Born
  • Spiritual Warfare
  • The Prophet Goes To Washington
  • The Great Demon of Pride
  • Sic Semper Tyrannis
  • Martial Law
  • The Better Angels Of Our Nature

Each episode will begin with an appropriate quote from the Bible or from a saint. Episode 1, for which this funding is directed, begins with:

Blind Prophet is not just an exciting story. It will make people think a little, about the sanctity of life, and the nature of temptation, and good and evil.  Here's an excerpt from a review of the screenplay:

“There is an undeniable sense of originality about “Blind Prophet” that makes for a unique and intriguing reading experience…. a unique narrative unlike any other script in existence.”  BlueCat Screenplay Competition.

We are looking to build a following and loyal fan base who will really love this work.  For that, I really do need your help...

What We Need & What You Get

I am funding the development costs myself and we are pretty much done with the artwork for episode one. At this point, we are looking for help only with the printing costs for episode one, "A Prophet is Born," and a little more money for the artist, so if we meet the goal a $1,000 bonus will go directly to the artist plus 20% of anything we exceed the goal by will go directly to the artist for this effort. If we do exceed the goal, the remaining funding will go toward development of the next six episodes.  If we don't make the funding goal, we will honor the perks, and I will fund the balance of the printing myself.  I expect this will work until I run out of money and credit :-)  I am comitted to making the seven episodes a reality, no matter what happens with the crowd-funding.

So, what do you get?

A copy of Episode One, "A Prophet is Born," first run edition! For just $3 you get an electronic copy, and for only $5 a printed copy sent to your address! For signed copies you need to pay a little more, and if you really love the cover art, we have options for that as well.

For people who want to give more, we can schedule a talk and signing event for your organization.  Since we are a bit behind schedule and it might take time to coordinate getting the content for an ad, I have removed that perk (mentioned in the video).  If you really would like an ad, and have content readily available, please contact me.  I would really like to be able to deliver product in time for Christmas, though...

Everyone who contributes will be recognized in the acknowledgements page.  So, you will be able to show this to your friends and let them know that you were instrumental in making this a reality.

The Impact

We are really looking to change the conversation surrounding life choices and religion. Too many people unthinkingly devalue life, and do not see how God can use even the least-likely to change the world. And, even if they never acquire supernatural powers, and are always dependant and in need, they can still be heroes on a spiritual level, in that they make us better people for having them to care for and to love.

Risks & Challenges

There are some people who will not like this story. It deals frankly with the choice around abortion, and in particular, aborting a child when abnormalities are found prior to birth. There could be people challenged by that issue, who will react very negatively. But, we welcome the debate. We are on the side of the beauty of life, and we pray that that is the right side.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, you can still help:

    • We would gladly accept your PRAYERS!!!
    • You can spread the word!  Check out the Indiegogo sharing tools!
    • Like, Diana, we're trusting in God...

The Better Angels Of Our Nature

Each episode will begin with an appropriate quote from the Bible or from a saint. Episode 1, for which this funding is directed, begins with:

Blind Prophet is not just an exciting story. It will make people think a little, about the sanctity of life, and the nature of temptation, and good and evil.  Here's an excerpt from a review of the screenplay:“There is an undeniable sense of originality about “Blind Prophet” that makes for a unique and intriguing reading experience…. a unique narrative unlike any other script in existence.”  BlueCat Screenplay Competition.We are looking to build a following and loyal fan base who will really love this work.  For that, I really do need your help...What We Need & What You GetI am funding the development costs myself and we are pretty much done with the artwork for episode one.  At this point, we are looking for help only with the printing costs for episode one, "A Prophet is Born," and a little more money for the artist, so if we meet the goal a $1,000 bonus will go directly to the artist plus 20% of anything we exceed the goal by will go directly to the artist for this effort.  If we do exceed the goal, the remaining funding will go toward development of the next six episodes.  If we don't make the funding goal, we will honor the perks, and I will fund the balance of the printing myself.  I expect this will work until I run out of money and credit :-)  I am comitted to making the seven episodes a reality, no matter what happens with the crowd-funding.
So, what do you get?
A copy of Episode One, "A Prophet is Born," first run edition!  For just $3 you get an electronic copy, and for only $5 a printed copy sent to your address!  For signed copies you need to pay a little more, and if you really love the cover art, we have options for that as well.
For people who want to give more, we can schedule a talk and signing event for your organization.  Since we are a bit behind schedule and it might take time to coordinate getting the content for an ad, I have removed that perk (mentioned in the video).  If you really would like an ad, and have content readily available, please contact me.  I would really like to be able to deliver product in time for Christmas, though...Everyone who contributes will be recognized in the acknowledgements page.  So, you will be able to show this to your friends and let them know that you were instrumental in making this a reality.
The ImpactWe are really looking to change the conversation surrounding life choices and religion.  Too many people unthinkingly devalue life, and do not see how God can use even the least-likely to change the world.  And, even if they never acquire supernatural powers, and are always dependant and in need, they can still be heroes on a spiritual level, in that they make us better people for having them to care for and to love.
Risks & Challenges There are some people who will not like this story.  It deals frankly with the choice around abortion, and in particular, aborting a child when abnormalities are found prior to birth.  There could be people challenged by that issue, who will react very negatively.  But, we welcome the debate.   We are on the side of the beauty of life, and we pray that that is the right side.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute, you can still help:
We would gladly accept your PRAYERS!!!
You can spread the word!  Check out the Indiegogo sharing tools!
Like, Diana, we're trusting in God...

story:
Come sit yer ol’ bones down and I’ll spin ye a yarn...

Once there was a woman named Astra Crompton who decided to share a story with the world. This story would be told in words and pictures and colour. It would be given freely, a new page every week, to the unfathomable depths of the internet. And it would be interactive, giving options to its readers at the end of each chapter to encourage them to direct the tone, relationships and content of the unfolding story. It would be about pirates and gay romance and gritty issues of prejudice, violence, freedom and morality. It would be called Weaponry.

Weaponry can be found at http://www.otherworldscomics.com/OWC/ as well as on DeviantART and Smackjeeves. Every Monday it has updated since 2011 when it first launched. There have been two chapters printed so far: Weaponry Academy, and A Pirate’s Life for Me. Both were the result of successful previous campaigns here on Indiegogo. Now it’s time to launch Chapter 3 from its moorings to join the growing Weaponry library...

Like the first two volumes, Chapter 3: All Adrift... will contain all of the comic pages from online (cleaned up and reformatted for print). There will be exclusive bonus art and planning sketches. The Crossbones vignettes for Blade and Gun will give glimpses to what might have happened had the vote results been different. Drumming Song will comprise 20 pages of bonus comic about the backstory for Grenade and Shield. All together it will be 86 pages of full colour material in a glossy bound print edition. Chapter 1 (have a look at it here) is a great example of what to expect from this next installment.

There is plenty more story to tell, and the next script has begun already. With your help and support, Weaponry’s crew will continue sailing the night, raiding unsuspecting ships, its pirates falling in love, battles ensuing in bloody massacre under the searing heat, and one lucky pirate will earn the right to the elusive Captain’s Seal...

Are you with me?

What a cost be this, for all me hard-earned coppers?

Your generous donations fund so much more than just the printing of the comic. It also supports the back end: the hosting fees for the website, Big Cartel and SmackJeeves accounts, a couple of small advertisements, and new merchandise!

$2000 is a modest request for a print endeavour, and really it covers only the bare basics:

  • 100 copies to be printed (including shipping from the printer to myself, import and customs duties, and basic shipping costs to send them on to you - if you are in North America)
  • The cost of 1 to 3 advertisements (this time I’m looking at Google AdWords, Facebook and SmackJeeves)
  • The cost for 1 year of web hosting (both my url and web hoster, Big Cartel store website, and Smackjeeves donator account) to increase viewer options and hosting space so that I can offer bigger page display and more goods to you, the reader.
  • The cost of the Incentives and merchandise (anything left over from the fundraiser gets added to the Weaponry store). New items this time include: a new tshirt design, the Blade Paper Doll set, the replica of Shrapnel’s medallion and a few other bonuses.
  • Offsetting the increasing costs of shipping
  • plus the cost of using IndieGoGo to facilitate the fundraising.


And if we find more than we seek...

I’ll be offering some STRETCH GOALS in the event that we exceed our small target of $2000 CAD. I won’t go into too much depth here, but they will include things like an Uphelios Map Puzzle, Wanted Poster, and possible colouring books and collectible trading cards. These extras will be added to everyone’s Perks that pitched in enough to be getting a mailed parcel. You can always pitch in more later to raise your total if you want to jump in on some Stretch Goal Action!


I see a vast array o’ booty laid out before me!

With the help and suggestions of readers in the Forums, we have hammered out some exciting Perks to thank you for your support. This includes a number of the most popular items from previous fundraisers as well as some exciting new loot!

You can, of course, simply pitch in a lump sum of money – but we are offering a great number of exciting packages. So have a peruse to your right and see if any of these levels excite your blood. Simply click on the one that appeals the most, and note that some of them have limited numbers, so be sure to grab them quickly before they’re all gone!

PLEASE NOTE that some of the higher level incentives have OPTIONS. Anywhere you see the “OR” you must select one of the other of this offered perk. Please leave a comment with which one you select (or if you like to be clandestine, send me an email) for my records. Also note that the highest tiers stack, which means anything over the 80$ mark includes the perks from that tier and the perks preceding it. Wow! That’s a lot of bang for your buck!

Since I'm the sole creator of this comic, I'm also the only one filling the orders (including drawing the unique art and making your hand-crafted prizes) so please have patience as I fill all of your orders. If you live OUTSIDE OF NORTH AMERICA please include an extra $10 in your donation to offset shipping costs. All parcels will be sent Canada Post Expedited, or International Small Packet Air as the destination requires. Wherever I can get tracking numbers I will, and they will be forwarded to you by email. Please remember that whatever email you use for your donation is the one I will use to contact you if I have any questions (such as t-shirt sizing, details for your custom illustrations, or preferences for your hand-crafted items). Please remember to check this email regularly as the fundraiser continues and after it’s conclusion to ensure the timely filling of your order.

We need all hands on deck!

Even if you can’t pitch in any cold hard cash, there are still many things you can do to help make this campaign a success. All it will take is a little of your time and a little bit of noise-making!

  • Spread the word! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Y!Gallery, DeviantART, Smackjeeves, messageboards, classrooms, chatrooms, forums, blackboards, emails, quill and ink!! Any method to get the word out there is the most important thing you can do. Word of mouth advertising is the least expensive yet most effective method out there.
  • Share the comic! If you know anyone you think might like Weaponry - please, encourage them to read the comic, and get them excited about the fundraiser! This is not only a chance to get Chapter 3 to print, it's a chance to spread the love of the comic itself.
  • Indiegogo has a number of helpful tools to make it easy to share this fundraiser at the mere click of a button! 
  • Keep checking in! I’ll be adding up new content as the fundraiser inches along, including our laborious Fundraiser video, sneak peeks of the incentives and print volume and behind the scenes extras!
  • Shout out! If you have a webcomic, blog, public journal or facebook page – I’d be happy to work with you to do an exclusive interview, Q & A or live chat to help promote the fundraiser and add content to your project. If you’d be interested in setting one of these up with me – drop me an email!


I could not have come this far without all of you. To everyone who reads the comic, comments, supported a previous fundraiser or plans to support this one. To everyone who lurks in the shadows, or shouts their love out from the crow’s nest. To everyone who got a friend hooked, or just stumbled upon it by chance. You are the reason I draw every panel on every page. Without you, I would not continuously find myself inspired, heart-warmed, entertained and blessed to be a part of this community. Your endless support and enthusiasm, patience and good-will are awe-inspiring. I am so glad to have met each and every one of you. Thank you for becoming my shipmates on this journey. Thank you for caring, for reading and for voting. Thank you.

Now let’s set sail for grand adventure!!

story:
UPDATE 5-7-2014: We missed our goal of an A-Kon 2014 release. Here's a progress bar to keep you updated:



For more details, click here.

The Project

Peter is the Wolf is the most popular project produced by White Lightning Productions, a small independent comics publisher. The webcomic ( http://www.peteristhewolf.com/general/ ) is currently about midway through the third book of the story... which means we're long overdue to bring Book 2 (Peter is the Wolf: Living in the Doghouse) out in print format.

However, there are a couple of snags.

First, when we published Peter is the Wolf Book 1 we did it in two formats. One, for adults only, sold well enough. The other, with no adult material... hasn't sold nearly as well. Printing a version of Book 2 that everyone can enjoy would require that WLP tie up a significant chunk of money in product for years and years, waiting for the books to slowly sell enough to recoup the investment. Thanks to various financial setbacks stretching from October 2012 through this summer, that's money WLP can't afford to spend just now.

Second, the book's artist, Ben Rodriguez, is deep in debt and can't afford to give up his day job. In fact, he's had to work overtime as much as possible to help pay down his debt... which leaves him too worn out to do the TON of work required to get the pages posted on the website into print-quality condition. This has pushed the print date of ANY edition of Book 2 back again and again.

How You Can Help

We're shooting for a goal of $6,000. After advertising and other expenses of this campaign are deducted, the remaining amount will be split between the comic's artist Ben Rodriguez (to help pay his loans and make finishing Book 2 pages paying work) and WLP (to help offset the cost of printing Book 2).

If the campaign meets its base goal, we'll commit to officially releasing Peter is the Wolf: Living in the Doghouse at A-Kon in June 2014. Hard deadlines will be set, and top priority will be given to putting the book together and getting it printed. The book will be solicited to book and comic distributors and made available via Amazon.com and other online outlets, in addition to direct sales from WLP. Going over the goal will help both BAR-1 and WLP clear old debts even faster and may even produce special bonus material for the comic!

If the campaign fails to meet its goal, whatever we get will go towards BAR-1's debts and towards printing a one-time print-on-demand run of Peter is the Wolf: Living in the Doghouse strictly for our supporters. The costs of short-run printing mean we will NOT be able to offer the book wholesale to retailers if this happens- nor will we have much of an overrun to sell direct. Other perks like the T-shirt, cameos, Munny, etc. will be done and will ship regardless of whether or not the main goal is reached.

There will be an adults-only version of Book 2, but that has NOTHING to do with this project. This project is meant to support a version of the book that DOESN'T require a plain brown wrapper! We want the broadest possible audience of people who like silly comics and werewolves to be able to enjoy the story- and we really need your help to make this happen!

What You Get in Return

We've got a number of perks for our donors, ranging from the ordinary to the absolutely unique. If your pockets are deep enough, you could own a SKETCHBOOK full of original PitW artwork... or an unique statuette hand-painted by the artist himself... or you could even appear in the webcomic YOURSELF!

Stretch Goal #1: $8,000

If we reach $8,000, WLP will commission an Aminal Control commemorative challenge coin (available as a $17 add-on to your donation) for our fans! The coin will be double-sided, color, and enamel-coated, featuring the two main characters of the comic (Peter and Sarah) in their werewolf forms.



Stretch Goal #2: $11,000

If we reach $11,000, WLP will do a D20-based Peter is the Wolf sourcebook, featuring stats for the main characters and artwork, old and new, by BAR-1! This sourcebook will be available for sale as a PDF download- or through this project, if we hit the stretch goal in time!

ACHIEVED- Special Stretch Goal: 50 Different Funders

Kris and Ben will organize a Peter is the Wolf meetup/minicon between June and October 2014, an all-day event for nothing but PitW, at some point either Houston, Detroit, or in between! This event will be ONLY for those who supported the project, mind you- but even $1 would be enough!

But I've got no money!

We understand. Neither do we.

But you can pass the word to your friends, or on your blog or website, about our project and about Peter is the Wolf itself!
