story:
NOTE:  I probably need to rewrite and edit this summary.  I have more to say, so if you cannot find the info you need, please contact me or post.  Also, ALL contributors at ANY level will receive a copy of Grumble #2.

SUMMARY
The project that needs your help is a comic book entitled, Grumble.  We need money to produce the art for an extra-large second issue.

Hello, my name is Leroy Douresseaux.  This an Indiegogo campaign for Grumble #2, the second issue of the comic book I write and Diego Candia draws.  We get help from Jaymes at DigiCaps and a promotional push from Herve St. Louis of the Comic Book Bin and from retailer/advisor, Jeffrey LaJaunie.

I live in the boonies, not too far from the delightful small town of Eunice, Louisiana.  I write reviews and social commentary, mostly for the Comic Book Bin.  After talking about it for years, the Comic Book Bin is prepping a digital comics publishing initiative.  And that's where our comic book, Grumble, comes in.

After trying to break into the comic book industry for years, one day it hit me:  Why not just create my own comics!  I had thought of self-publishing before that eureka moment, but only in passing – like a daydream.  I could never do it alone, so I helped form a team.  Now, a group of us have our new comic book series, Grumble, of which we have published one issue.

Grumble is a dark fantasy about a young woman who returns home for a beloved uncle's funeral.  Ava has forgotten her past, but the past has not forgotten her, and it will destroy her family and hometown to get at her.

We published one issue of Grumble, but we really need financial help if we are going to get the second issue out into the world.  The purpose of this campaign is to raise at least $4000 dollars to pay for the art by our collaborator, Diego, a conceptual artist and comic book artist who is working at a heavily discounted rate.



Why $4000?

Well, I decided to make the second chapter/issue of Grumble a big, darn thing.  We are going to serialize it on the Bin on a weekly basis, so we need lots of pages.  I also want the printed edition to be extra-large and in charge, so I guess I am putting all our necks on the line.

Indiegogo suggests that these campaigns express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  It is simple.  I need you to help me make this happen.  In these tough economic times, your hard-earned money will turn you into our superheroes.

$4000!  To get that, I am giving hard copies of Grumble #1, advertising in Grumble #2, and original art.  Contributors will also get their names and published in the comic and posted at the Bin.  For potential sugar daddy (and mama) donors and for Koch Brothers-like contributors, I am open to suggestions.

Where do the funds go?

Every penny will be used to produce pages of art from my script.  $4000 will get us at least 50 pages.  If we get more, we'll praise the Lord and produce more.  If we get less, we'll still praise and produce comics.

Grumble is a valuable thing to me, and I want to offer digital comics on the web (via the Comic Book Bin) the way newspapers have always given comics to their readers.  I think that there is value in that.  I want Grumble to be the first of many digital comics I offer.

A UNIQUE PERK?:  Grumble will be filled with fantastic creatures and monsters.  I am thinking about giving contributors the chance to name some of them, even if they choose to use their own personal names.  What do you think?

OTHER HELP:
We love money, but we love just-plain-love. Other ways you can help our cause:  Just visit the Bin and/or spread the word:

http://www.comicbookbin.com/

http://www.comicbookbin.com/webcomics.html

 http://www.comicbookbin.com/grumblecomics001.html

Please, get the word out and don't forget to use those Indiegogo share tools.

I'm new at this, so please ask questions, because I know that I have left out information you may want or need to know.

UPDATE:

Grumble #2 page 1 - a rough sketch of page 1 of a two-page framing sequence; art by Diego Candia.
story_txt: NOTE:  I probably need to rewrite and edit this summary.  I have more to say, so if you cannot find the info you need, please contact me or post.  Also, ALL contributors at ANY level will receive a copy of Grumble #2.SUMMARYThe project that needs your help is a comic book entitled, Grumble.  We need money to produce the art for an extra-large second issue.Hello, my name is Leroy Douresseaux.  This an Indiegogo campaign for Grumble #2, the second issue of the comic book I write and Diego Candia draws.  We get help from Jaymes at DigiCaps and a promotional push from Herve St. Louis of the Comic Book Bin and from retailer/advisor, Jeffrey LaJaunie.I live in the boonies, not too far from the delightful small town of Eunice, Louisiana.  I write reviews and social commentary, mostly for the Comic Book Bin.  After talking about it for years, the Comic Book Bin is prepping a digital comics publishing initiative.  And that's where our comic book, Grumble, comes in.After trying to break into the comic book industry for years, one day it hit me:  Why not just create my own comics!  I had thought of self-publishing before that eureka moment, but only in passing – like a daydream.  I could never do it alone, so I helped form a team.  Now, a group of us have our new comic book series, Grumble, of which we have published one issue.Grumble is a dark fantasy about a young woman who returns home for a beloved uncle's funeral.  Ava has forgotten her past, but the past has not forgotten her, and it will destroy her family and hometown to get at her.We published one issue of Grumble, but we really need financial help if we are going to get the second issue out into the world.  The purpose of this campaign is to raise at least $4000 dollars to pay for the art by our collaborator, Diego, a conceptual artist and comic book artist who is working at a heavily discounted rate.Why $4000?Well, I decided to make the second chapter/issue of Grumble a big, darn thing.  We are going to serialize it on the Bin on a weekly basis, so we need lots of pages.  I also want the printed edition to be extra-large and in charge, so I guess I am putting all our necks on the line.Indiegogo suggests that these campaigns express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  It is simple.  I need you to help me make this happen.  In these tough economic times, your hard-earned money will turn you into our superheroes.$4000!  To get that, I am giving hard copies of Grumble #1, advertising in Grumble #2, and original art.  Contributors will also get their names and published in the comic and posted at the Bin.  For potential sugar daddy (and mama) donors and for Koch Brothers-like contributors, I am open to suggestions.Where do the funds go?Every penny will be used to produce pages of art from my script.  $4000 will get us at least 50 pages.  If we get more, we'll praise the Lord and produce more.  If we get less, we'll still praise and produce comics.Grumble is a valuable thing to me, and I want to offer digital comics on the web (via the Comic Book Bin) the way newspapers have always given comics to their readers.  I think that there is value in that.  I want Grumble to be the first of many digital comics I offer.A UNIQUE PERK?:  Grumble will be filled with fantastic creatures and monsters.  I am thinking about giving contributors the chance to name some of them, even if they choose to use their own personal names.  What do you think?OTHER HELP:We love money, but we love just-plain-love. Other ways you can help our cause:  Just visit the Bin and/or spread the word:http://www.comicbookbin.com/http://www.comicbookbin.com/webcomics.html http://www.comicbookbin.com/grumblecomics001.htmlPlease, get the word out and don't forget to use those Indiegogo share tools.I'm new at this, so please ask questions, because I know that I have left out information you may want or need to know.UPDATE:Grumble #2 page 1 - a rough sketch of page 1 of a two-page framing sequence; art by Diego Candia.

story:
'If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change."
Dr Wayne Dyer"

Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover."
Mark Twain

"The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams."
Eleanor Roosevelt,


Ali is 15. Nothing works. School doesn't work, home doesn't work and everyone she loves is no longer there. Then she discovers an access to a place where all the answers can be found. Horizon. A place of dreams and metaphor and discovery. and ultimately freedom.

They say that we all have at least one book in us.
For many years, during my time as an artist for MARVEL COMICS and other publishers and while working in TV and Games I have had a story rattling around in my head that just won't go away. It has cropped up many times in many different forms for something like twenty years. The themes have always been the same even if the characters and story have changed. A number of times I have started it, mostly in collaboration with other writers. It never seemed to quite come together until finally somebody asked me why I didn't write it myself. That was the answer. Do it myself. I had always believed and been led to believe that I am not a writer. Artist , yes but writer, no. But why not? As I began to put together the framework and the plot and breathe life into the characters the story almost began to tell itself. And here we are. A project has come to life and all it really needs to take flight is an audience. This book will get published one way or another, that is for sure, but a little help and collaboration from its potential readers will give it wings. 


So whats the story?
Ali is a 15 year old girl. An age in-between. An age where she isn't a child or an adult. An age of confusion. Bullied at school and after a row with her mother that she cant even remember the reason for she sits in her room. Alone. With that dark tension boiling in her gut again. Why is it like this? Why don’t they ever listen?
The tears dry in her eyes and she grabs hold of the only thing she cares for from 'back then' and may even take with her into her future, her toy rabbit... and falls asleep. 
BANG! Eyes wide open she is awake, or so she thinks. And then... The adventure begins. 



We are then in a dream world interwoven with her daily life. It is within the dreamworld that the real story unfolds. Dreams are quite simply metaphor. It is in our dreams that we resolve issues about ourselves and our lives and Ali is no different. Only difference here is that she has a talking toy rabbit called Moon to guide her through the challenges that await her. 
And what does she meet on the way? Well, all kinds of things, mostly VERY BIG ROBOTS. Ultimately though, she finds herself and that is the point. Her resolution is one we can all identify with as it deals with those very human issues of Love and Loss, Fear and Freedom and what becomes possible when we let go of the things about us that hold us back. Those ways of being, behaving and relating to our circumstances that stop us from being all we can be.

Why Horizon?
I have long been associated with comics as an artist and more specifically with robot comics. Well, TRANSFORMERS, to be specific. Many will know that one of my other interests is coaching. 'Self Development' if you will. It occurred to me that these two elements could be put together to provide something new and fresh within the graphic novel medium. My years of experience of participating in and training for Coaching, Dream therapy and Self Development is something that I committed to getting into a fictional narrative a while back. And this is going to be it. A gentle story about real people (with some really cool robots) that deals with what it is to be human the obstacles we put in the way of being all we can be. Dealing with and removing those barriers would make for an awesome life. There is no shortage of 'self help' books on the bookstore shelves for older readers but to have a graphic novel that is not not only racked with its fellow graphic novels but that also sat comfortably alongside Chopra, Dyer, Byrne, Robbins, McKenna, Tolle and the many others will be amazing. A powerful book for those that love a good adventure. 

What We Need & What You Get
The book will be published. It is unlikely that it will be ready by the time this campaign expires but if you join in you will get constant updates as to when the launch will be. There has already been some interest from mainstream publishers but even if in the final analysis they choose not to take it I will publish it under my own PaperTheatre imprint. The funds raised here will act as seed money to cover some of the time that it will take to develop the book but also to cover some of the marketing costs. But its not necessarily about that. Its more to do with giving others the opportunity to be involved in the genesis of something new. A pre-order campaign that will allow you to be along for the ride and get your name forever in the book. Or to take up any of the other opportunities on offer here to order limited edition prints, deluxe format books and original artwork. The choice is yours. You can be involved as much as you like.

Take the plunge and be part of something that is not only exciting and new but that has the clear intention of making a difference to the lives of others.
Oh and did I mention. it will have BIG robots.


Other Ways You Can Help
There are other ways you can help with this. Put the word out. Enrol others in the idea. You dont have to 'sell' it to them just get their interest. Give them the opportunity to be involved in something new and exciting.

And don't forget to remind them about the share tools!


So there you have it. Welcome aboard

Andrew Wildman 2011

Many thanks to TOUCHSTONE for the use of their music in the trailer.

HORIZON is a Paper Theatre production ©2011 WILDideas. All rights reserved

story:
The Voluntaryist Comic Project

CAMPAIGN CLOSING SOON! ANY PERK HELPS! THE COMIC EVENTUALLY WILL BE RELEASED TO ALL FOR FREE (AFTER PERK PURCHASERS GET THEIR EARLY RELEASE), SO DON’T BE SHY TO SUPPORT!

STORY: “Voluntaryist” is about a superhero who finds himself pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all.  He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the U.S. armed forces.

The purpose of this comic is to give a sense of what is going on in America and, in addition, to offer the reader inspiration that something can be done to stop the coming dystopian future. It also promotes voluntaryist values in the narrative. (If you don’t know what that is, simply google the “Non-aggression principle.”)

CREATOR: The idea for the comic was created by Voluntaryist fanatic and costumer Jaime Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for dressing in spandex super-suits. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his legal studies in school.

GOAL:  Jaime's goal is to produce the first copy of the comic series on a .pdf to share with you, and, eventually, the world. 

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $4000 to get this comic fully going. The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring an artist to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into digital format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

  • $8 – A personal “thank-you” by having your name read among others in this category in a youtube video.

  • $15 – The comic in .pdf format.
  • $25 – Voluntaryist sticker + comic in .pdf format.

  • $35 – 10 minutes to chat with Jaime via Skype + comic in .pdf format.

  • $50 – Limited Edition Re-Print of Voluntaryist Character drawing by J.C. Grande, signed and numbered by Jaime Sherman.
  • $100 30-minute Skype chat with Jaime  + signed and printed comic + .pdf comic + personal thank-you card.
  • $250 Banner-Ad Sponsor on the Back Page– get an advertisement (PG rated) in the back page of the comic book. (Limited to 6 Sponsors for the page).

  • $500 - Have you ever wanted to be in a comic? Make an appearance in the comic book as a character (for this issue only) and receive a printed version of the comic, a .pdf, a 30-minute Skype chat, and a personal "thank-you" card from Jaime Sherman. You can pick whether you want to be friend, foe, or background character! Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

IF we do not reach our goal (but we will thanks to you!), we will produce as many pages of the comic as we can afford and still send those out to the people who donated to receive the comic in .pdf format/printed format.

Production

The comic will be produced primarily after the campaign is over, so the comic will be sent to you a few months after the 45 days are up.

However, we will give you teasers, sketches, and tidbits on our Website, http://volcomic.com so you can learn more about the backstory in anticipation of the comic's release.

YOUR Impact

While the comic is a fun relief from reality, our hope is that the comic is something beyond its entertainment value. We would like the comic to get into the hands of people who are unfamiliar with Voluntaryism and the current state of affairs. We want to wake people up to Voluntaryism and truly-free living using the comic medium because it communicates without being pretentious.

PUBLIC RELEASE:

We will be releasing the comic for you to download for free (whatever we can find that will allow us to post it for free)…but those who paid to get the comic e-mailed or printed will receive it FIRST and will receive the comic about a month AHEAD of everyone else.

SO, with that in mind, don’t be shy about donating at the $5 or $8 levels because EVERY dollar counts to making the comic come into existence. That we need you to be our hero for!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

FACEBOOK:
http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary

YOUTUBE:
http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

WEBSITE:
http://volcomic.com

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Sire V (Jaime) at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

 

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:
FACEBOOK:http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary
YOUTUBE:http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists
WEBSITE:http://volcomic.com
ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Sire V (Jaime) at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 
 

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
Official main cover. Artist: Fredrik Mattsson

Check out more art of Fredrik Mattsson at https://www.deviantart.com/fedde

Introduction

I am Hisham Kaine, author of the comic book Wahid: Weapon of mass destruction. For three years have I worked on this project and today we are a team of eight individuals doing our best to give you a unique but familiar experience. We launched a Kickstarter 33 days ago and reached our main goal and a first stretch goal of sum 5400 dollars, 144 backers. Now we are crowdfunding here on Indiegogo to reach our stretch goals so we can add a pin-up by Ian Miller, one free poster and make an audiobook of this project.

Who is Hisham Kaine/creator?

I was born in Sweden, but my parents are from Iraq. I see myself as one that has experience from both countries. It has given me lots of perspectives about culture, religion, politics and morality. I have been an avid fan of comics, games and movies for 30 years. It was my guide of right and wrong and has shaped me into being a person that wants to make a difference. Like "Uncle Ben" said: With great power, comes great responsibility. 

In recent years, I became tired of the Middle Eastern role models being either dead prophets or bloodthirsty dictators. I want to create a character that questions itself, values ​​and "God". Freedom of speech is extremely important to me and I believe that if we do not use our creative freedom, there is a risk that it will be lost.

Story of WAHID

The story of WAHID plays out in a parallel world aligned with our reality. What if Saddam Hussein had a weapon of mass destruction. What if, that weapon was a super-soldier, set loose in Iraq in the year 2014, what would happen next? That is what I am trying to tell with my story. We have made a music theme, website, social media, 2 trailers and with your help, a "Mature" comic book series.

Why crowdfunding?

To create #1 of WAHID, we need your help to finance this project so that I can pay my artist Fredrik Mattsson, print, travel expenses, promotion, marketing costs and distribution. For helping us, you will get the first print issue 1 containing 60 pages in full-colour, and a story unlike anything you've ever seen before.

    PLEDGES:

     

     STRETCH GOALS:

    First stretch goal of adding 8 pages have been funded already via Kickstarter.

     

    800 DOLLARS: We will hire Ian Miller for a bonus illustration of WAHID to put into the comic book. Ian will do the lineart while Fredrik will colour it as they have done together in earlier comics as Something Real, Holstered Heathen and Zombie with a Shotgun.

    Check out more art of Ian Miller: http://ianjmiller.com/

    Sample of Ian's work below:

    2 800 DOLLARS: we will give you an Exclusive New Art Print to those who bought the physical Print of Wahid to frame in your home :) 

    4 800 DOLLARS: We will make an Audio version of Wahid #1, voiced by me and others to give those with or without Vision variations (Visual impairment) a new experience. Check out trailer 2 at the top of this page for an example.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • use the Indiegogo share tools!

    SOCIAL MEDIA: 

    You can find us at

    www.patreon.com/Wahid_wmd

    www.instagram.com/wahid_wmd

    www.facebook.com/Infidelcomic

    twitter.com/wahid_wmd

     

    CREATIVE TEAM:

    Creator/script: Hisham Kaine

    Art director/Lead Artist: Fredrik Mattsson

    Co-Artist Artist: MA

    Video editor: Wendigo Agraba

    Promotor/Producer: Hasoni Parker

    Co-Writer: Vincent Hellstrom

    Webdesign/Web developer: P0e

    Music: JSM

     

    BUDGET:

    Risks and challenges

    The challenges we face are all economic issues. Depending on how successful we do on Kickstarter will determine the time it will take to release this comic. I am in touch with a printing company, ready to go. We have bought 1000 shipping packages, protective cover and address stickers. I counted to deliver 1000 exemplars from the printer. The budget to make this product will cost around 10 000 dollars, which I am ready to pay half for. The budget counts for print, travel expenses, promotion, marketing costs and distribution. Getting exposure is the difficult part. I plan to advertise on Facebook/Instagram because of the good results one gets. A challenge is to finish all pages in time. We have the script finished, Main and Variant Cover, half of the pages are finished, storyboard and layout are done for the whole issue. We are today eight individuals who work and believe in this project. If you help us finish this project, then you will ensure us to continue an ongoing series of Wahid! Issue 2 will be named Wahid: Dawn of Evil.

I was born in Sweden, but my parents are from Iraq. I see myself as one that has experience from both countries. It has given me lots of perspectives about culture, religion, politics and morality. I have been an avid fan of comics, games and movies for 30 years. It was my guide of right and wrong and has shaped me into being a person that wants to make a difference. Like "Uncle Ben" said: With great power, comes great responsibility. 
In recent years, I became tired of the Middle Eastern role models being either dead prophets or bloodthirsty dictators. I want to create a character that questions itself, values ​​and "God". Freedom of speech is extremely important to me and I believe that if we do not use our creative freedom, there is a risk that it will be lost.
Story of WAHID
The story of WAHID plays out in a parallel world aligned with our reality. What if Saddam Hussein had a weapon of mass destruction. What if, that weapon was a super-soldier, set loose in Iraq in the year 2014, what would happen next? That is what I am trying to tell with my story. We have made a music theme, website, social media, 2 trailers and with your help, a "Mature" comic book series.
Why crowdfunding?
To create #1 of WAHID, we need your help to finance this project so that I can pay my artist Fredrik Mattsson, print, travel expenses, promotion, marketing costs and distribution. For helping us, you will get the first print issue 1 containing 60 pages in full-colour, and a story unlike anything you've ever seen before.




PLEDGES:  STRETCH GOALS:First stretch goal of adding 8 pages have been funded already via Kickstarter. 800 DOLLARS: We will hire Ian Miller for a bonus illustration of WAHID to put into the comic book. Ian will do the lineart while Fredrik will colour it as they have done together in earlier comics as Something Real, Holstered Heathen and Zombie with a Shotgun.Check out more art of Ian Miller: http://ianjmiller.com/Sample of Ian's work below:2 800 DOLLARS: we will give you an Exclusive New Art Print to those who bought the physical Print of Wahid to frame in your home :) 4 800 DOLLARS: We will make an Audio version of Wahid #1, voiced by me and others to give those with or without Vision variations (Visual impairment) a new experience. Check out trailer 2 at the top of this page for an example.Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
use the Indiegogo share tools!

SOCIAL MEDIA: You can find us atwww.patreon.com/Wahid_wmdwww.instagram.com/wahid_wmdwww.facebook.com/Infidelcomictwitter.com/wahid_wmd CREATIVE TEAM:Creator/script: Hisham KaineArt director/Lead Artist: Fredrik MattssonCo-Artist Artist: MAVideo editor: Wendigo AgrabaPromotor/Producer: Hasoni ParkerCo-Writer: Vincent HellstromWebdesign/Web developer: P0eMusic: JSM BUDGET:Risks and challengesThe challenges we face are all economic issues. Depending on how successful we do on Kickstarter will determine the time it will take to release this comic. I am in touch with a printing company, ready to go. We have bought 1000 shipping packages, protective cover and address stickers. I counted to deliver 1000 exemplars from the printer. The budget to make this product will cost around 10 000 dollars, which I am ready to pay half for. The budget counts for print, travel expenses, promotion, marketing costs and distribution. Getting exposure is the difficult part. I plan to advertise on Facebook/Instagram because of the good results one gets. A challenge is to finish all pages in time. We have the script finished, Main and Variant Cover, half of the pages are finished, storyboard and layout are done for the whole issue. We are today eight individuals who work and believe in this project. If you help us finish this project, then you will ensure us to continue an ongoing series of Wahid! Issue 2 will be named Wahid: Dawn of Evil.

story:
New Stretch Goal Added!!!

The response to Boundless so far has been a joy to watch for us as creators but we know we can do so much more.  The production costs have been met, and then some, but our true goal with this campaign has always been to give as much as possible to the true frontline warriors in the battle against cancer.  For this reason we are adding a stretch goal at $10,000.  If we hit that mark all contributors who have pledged at the Sparklefists level or higher will receive a custom enamel pin of the Boundless logo.  You can help us out by sharing the campaign with anyone and everyone you can think of.  We still have three weeks left in the campaign, more than enough time to hit that goal, and we are brainstorming further goals as well.  Your generosity in supporting this campaign has been Boundless and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts.  

 

ORIGIN STORY

As the owner of Horizon Comics I've always wanted to produce and publish a comic book. This past October our shop participated in the industry-wide challenge known as 24-Hour Comic Book Day, where the goal is for a single creator to produce a 24 page comic in 24 hours. 

Because I see comics as predominantly collaborative efforts, I decided to fail the challenge from the start by enlisting two writers, two artists, and two inkers to complete the task. After 24 hours we had roughly half the comic finished, but realized at that point that we had a pretty special story going and an opportunity to use that story to do some good in the world. With this awareness, we have persistently worked to finish the comic, and I am proud to say that it is done. Now, we are offering you the chance to join us on this journey. 

SUITING UP

Most of the perks speak for themselves, but I do want to take a second to talk about the covers. There will be 3 different covers for this comic: A regular cover, an Indiegogo exclusive variant, and an ultra-rare B&W secret variant of the exclusive. Whatever size print run we end up having money for will be comprised mostly of the regular cover. The print run for the Indiegogo exclusive cover will be strictly limited to the number required to fulfill all perks plus a 5% overprint for damages and irregularities. The ultra-rare B&W signed and numbered edition will be limited to no more than 25 copies. Period. 

Our initial goal is modest: to produce a 1000 copy print run of our comic in black and white. $3,000 gets us there and covers all other perk production and fulfillment costs. Our secondary goal is to hire a colorist on a deadline so that we can produce a 1000 copy print run of our comic in full color and still deliver the goods to you by October. $5000 will get that done and cover all other perk production and fulfillment costs. Our ultimate goal is to raise as much money as we can to donate to a cancer research and treatment facility. 

BECOMING BOUNDLESS

Now that all that's out of the way, we want you to know that our primary goal here is to raise money for cancer research and treatment. To do whatever we can to help those who are on the front lines fighting this disease. At this point we've done what we can do, and that's where you come in. We need you. We need your support.  Join our team - help our cause - we can do great things together! 

WHERE'S THE KRYPTONITE?

Our goal is to deliver all perks on time and as advertised. That is the main reason that we've waited until the comic was finished prior to launching the campaign. And we've given ourselves a reasonable buffer for when we reach our secondary goal to produce a full color comic. And while I am 99% sure that we can deliver on or ahead of schedule, if the 1% should rear it's ugly head you will be informed immediately. 

Money matters. We are not a 501(c)(3), so your contributions for perks are not tax deductible. But you and I both know that's not a reason to deny supporting this project, because you will get your money's worth in perks alone; and every dollar that gets donated will help people in need. Money raised above and beyond the $5,000 goal will be used toward: 1) Donation to a Cancer research and treatment facility 2) Any and all associated taxes and fees 3) Some measure of remuneration to the creators to say thank you for their hard work and 4) Any unforeseen or increased production and fulfillment costs 

POWERS OF PERSUASION

The single most important thing that you can do to support this campaign is to help us get the word out. Please share our efforts with your friends, family and followers on social media. Right now. Do it, we'll wait right here and you'll feel better once you do...

Just click and share. 

Thank you!

Just click and share. 
Thank you!

story:
RAGS: REUP! YOU'RE CRAZY!

PLOT:

In current year, what's initially thought to be a terrorist attack on the San Ysidro border crossing leads to California being over come by the undead. Escaping north to whats supposed to be safety are Regina Ragowski her fiance Sean. A sudden heated argument leaves Regina, literally naked, afraid and running from her life as she now has to face the zombie plague with nothing more than her birthday suit.

Characters:

Regina:

Operator:

 

Randi

Kylie

 

Obligatory Page Showcase:

 

The Long

We're gonna keep this really short and REALLY sweet. So did you:

  • Want RAGS uncensored?
  • Don't want to pay crazy eBay prices?
  • Unsure about subbing to Patreon...? ( www.patreon.com/nanco)

Well now's your chance to get Issues 1-6 Uncensored all in one shot!

What We Need & What You Get

Again Keeping this simple:

  • What we need? Your name, Your address and some loot to cover shipping.
  • No extras. Just books so there's zero hold-up.

 

A comprehensive Review of Issues 1-5 can be found here:

 

 

 

 

RISKS -

 In a perfect world, printing shipping and all that jazz would go off smoothly and YOU the customer would receive your books in the utmost pristine condition...
However, some of you have done something karmetically to piss off the mailman and for those sad few whose postman is an absolute...well...ya know....we're offering FREE*** [yes you read that right] FREE replacements. The catch is that you send us back the damaged books so we can take them to the post office to smack the mailmen with it.


Trade Paper back?

Sorry we're saving that for our Patreon's (www.patreon.com/nanco) backers whose money allows us to keep Luigi drawing Gingers 24/7 (and also keeps him from being snatched up by Marvel who would suck his soul dry.)

Digital?

You can grab the entire collection here for $7




***Techinically not free as your paying for shipping

story:
Pitch

Imagine if six people had the power to change the world, but each had separate agendas. What would be the consequences of their actions and what kind of world would result?

James Hudnall

I'm a comics writer of over 30 years. I created Espers, The Psycho, The Age of Heroes, Streets, was a founder of the Malibu Ultraverse (created Hardcase and the Solution), wrote for DC and Marvel. This is a labor of love, It's an idea I have had for some time but the characters I created 3 years ago when I lost my right leg. I always felt if superhumans really existed in the real world, and tried to change it, the results would be far from predictable. Power systems do not like competition or interlopers.

I've teamed up with the talented Cossin brothers (Matt and Mikey) to bring this dream to reality.

48 Page Issues

My goal is to launch a series of 48 page quarterly comics. This campaign is to kick off the series. We already have over a quarter of the first issue done and we're looking for your help to bring it home.  This is a continuing story. Each arc will be collected later into trades. The first story will be four issues at 184 pages with additional material.

Our Goal

I have been in comics since 1986. I am an award-winning writer with one TV show produced based on my work (Harsh Realm) and my books have won awards in other countries besides the US. I am fully experienced in creating original content. Look at my bibliography page at http://jameshudnall.com/about-2/bibliography. I have written the first issue already.

Matt Cossin (Time Cheeta) is a very exciting new talent and his brother Mikey Cossin is doing fantastic color work. We are all dedicated to doing a comic like no other in the genre.

The challenge for us is having the funding to produce the work. We have a good printer picked out that produces high quality and will fulfill the books for contributors, 

This is the first book for our company, The Freedom Forge, which is designed to provide a place for creators who want to work outside of the corporate publishers and do work that's not constricted by their limitations. 

 

This is not political in the sense that it's an attack on any political party. I am not out to alienate anyone. I seek to entertain. I write stories to stand the test of time. But the themes and issues in this story are generally untouched by entertainment today. This is a comic that will deal with areas the media does not want to touch. Our comic has no adult content but its a comic for grown-ups. This is a story that will challenge you and will hopefully open a lot of eyes.

Ways You Can Help

Choose a perk and donate to our cause. It will make our dream come true.

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Indiegogo has share tools for that purpose.

Keep an eye on this page as we will be updating it with new perks and offers as it grows.

story:
I created Cat and Meringue way back in 2010, as a way to challenge myself as an artist to draw something every day. What started out as a silly daily comic side project became one of the best-loved things I have ever created and spawned a fan base larger and more awesome than I could have ever imagined!

Cat and Meringue sail a never ending ocean of silliness and adventure meeting weird characters, discovering strange lands and along the way working out that they are in a comic and that I, the artist, have it in for them! In the time that I have drawn them they have grown from a couple of silly squiggles on paper, to 2 of my best friends.

I have always loved toys, and the idea of bringing 2-dimensional cartoon characters into the real world, but the main reason I want to make plushies of these two is because of demand from you guys! So many awesome people that I have met both online and at comic conventions have demanded that I make the daft duo into cute plush characters!

Standing just under 15cm tall, the plushies are quite cute, small and immensely squishy. Made from stuffed super soft velboa with machine embroidered facial features they are incredibly well-made with the finish you would expect from a shop-bought cuddly toy. I am personally stunned by how nice they are to hold and admire!

These plushies mark the first big step into making the daft duo into a character brand. My dream as an artist has always been to create characters and stories that people love and connect with, and of all the characters I have created everyone seems to connect to these two little shapes the most!

Getting your comic or story out there for people to read is tough, but when the characters from these books pop out into real life in physical form it adds something special and raises everything up along with it. I really believe that these plushie dudes could be the beginning of an awesome future of stories and fun for the daft duo!

I wanted to keep the rewards simple and cost-effective for you guys so to that end I have made them all about the plushies themselves and their book, '1000 Days of Adventure' that contains all of their biggest adventures and is the best introduction to the characters if this is the first time you have met them!

Every reward tier gets you the book whether it be in digital or physical printed form so no matter what you can afford to pledge you can come away with something of the daft duo to enjoy! There are original sketches from myself, the artist, to get a hold of too!

The sketches are 100% original, drawn in pen and ink and coloured with pro markers, and you receive the actual artwork, not just a copy! They come in two forms, gag sketches (like the one above) and personalised sketches (like the one below!)

If you want rewards from more than one tier or simply want multiple copies of a reward then when selecting your reward simply pledge for the equivalent amount more on top of the tier you are selecting. For example, if you want to pledge at the £20 tier, but also want a £10 artwork, pledge £30 at the £20 tier. If you want two sets of plushies pledge £40 at the £20 tier. At the end of the campaign when the surveys go out, you will be able say what additional rewards you would like for your pledge!

I have big hopes and dreams for Cat and Meringue and I really believe that a product like this could be their big break into the world. By pledging to this campaign you will be there at the beginning of their rise to stardom, one of the first to hold a piece of their history!

The money raised will almost entirely go to the production costs for the plushies themselves, with a little bit for their packaging and a little bit more for Indiegogo fees. That's it!

I have a couple of ideas for stretch goals but rather than sharing them now, I will update the page and send out updates if it looks like the campaign is going to stretch. Don't worry though, I have some cool stuff planned!

I love these two guys like they are my own pets! And I hope you have fallen in love with them too. There's a whole world of theirs to explore over at catandmeringue.com and on their facebook page so even if you don't pledge you can always keep up with the duo there. But if you do decide to pledge then I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for supporting and believing in them!

I really think that with your help we can make Cat and Meringue into a pair of characters that the whole world can fall in love with!

-Nich (The Artist)

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

I won’t lie to you, this is my second crack at raising funds to create these plushies. The first attempt was on Kickstarter and I was asking for more money because I wanted some deluxe packaging. We made £4000 there which wasn't enough for the goal but enough to actually make the plushies themselves. Unfortunately I couldn't keep that money. Thats why I am back here with a lower goal that I know we can achieve as we have hit it before. The packaging is gone from the project and its focused on the plushies. I know we can do it!

I’ve never made plushies before, only books. But I’ve made a lot of books and done a lot of crowdfunding. I know what it takes to fulfill large orders, maintain communications with backers and how to manage time and funds.

The company producing the toys have proven themselves to be reliable and fast and very good at what they do. The main risks and challenges will be packaging and sending a large quantity of toys out myself and also maintaining quality control. I will take special care and focus on these points to ensure it is a success. If the delivery is delayed for any reason (i'm sure it won't be, but you never know with factories) then I will be sure to keep you updated.

I really think that with your help we can make Cat and Meringue into a pair of characters that the whole world can fall in love with!-Nich (The Artist)

I won’t lie to you, this is my second crack at raising funds to create these plushies. The first attempt was on Kickstarter and I was asking for more money because I wanted some deluxe packaging. We made £4000 there which wasn't enough for the goal but enough to actually make the plushies themselves. Unfortunately I couldn't keep that money. Thats why I am back here with a lower goal that I know we can achieve as we have hit it before. The packaging is gone from the project and its focused on the plushies. I know we can do it!
I’ve never made plushies before, only books. But I’ve made a lot of books and done a lot of crowdfunding. I know what it takes to fulfill large orders, maintain communications with backers and how to manage time and funds.
The company producing the toys have proven themselves to be reliable and fast and very good at what they do. The main risks and challenges will be packaging and sending a large quantity of toys out myself and also maintaining quality control. I will take special care and focus on these points to ensure it is a success. If the delivery is delayed for any reason (i'm sure it won't be, but you never know with factories) then I will be sure to keep you updated.

story:
What's up?!?

Hey! I'm Josh P.M. comics artist, illustrator, ska musician, and general "cool dude".

You might know me from The Adventures of Hardcore Dan, or you MIGHT NOT! Either way, this indiegogo is about my new minicomic project which is brand-spanking new and will be my first new self-published work since 2010! 

This new project is tentatively titled Space Stories, which is a working title and is subject to (many) changes. The actual book will have a couple science fiction stories that I've been kicking around for some time. I've been in grad school for a bit now for Illustration so I believe I've gotten to a point where I can finally tackle these narratives and make something pretty cool! 

In addition to helping me finish and print this comics, the funds raised here will also help me get to the Toronto Comics and Arts Festival (TCAF) coming up in May (where I will have some physical copies of the book!) where I will hock my wares and say hi to you if you will also be there and we can drink beverages together!

Whyyy what's in it for meee?

As an art grad student I am continuously racking up thousands of dollars in debt! I'd like to keep my comics making in the black and be able to have fun making this book without as much concern for the printing and travel costs. 

100% of proceeds will be going towards the production of the books and travel to TCAF no matter how much I make! This is essentially a pre-order of the book in its various forms (electronic and physical) with the opportunity to contribute to my travel expenses and get awesome stuff in return.

As for the perks, hopefully there will be a level that everyone is comfortable contributing to and I will provide cool stuff at each teir. There will be no "$1 for a high-five" or "$12 for my undying appreciation" because you are here to make sure art gets made but also to get some rad stuff, so please take a gander at the fun stuff throughout the perks! They'll include everything from .PDF's of the comic (and some older work too) to custom drawings and maybe even a personalized song performed by me (it doesn't have to be ska if you don't want that but make sure to specify because ska is my default setting).

Note: I will probably be sending any mail orders out after TCAF, so look for physical perks to be delivered around the end of May!

 

What if my bank account is totally kaput?

That's totally fine! Please, if you cannot contribute personally, pass this page along to friends, family, that weird neighbor down the hall in your apartment building, your dog, or favorite bus driver! I'd really appreciate it!

story:
Blood, spit, and hellfire.

Dead Mage is a digital-first comics mini-series from author John Leo and artist Garth Binam, with a cover by acclaimed artist Natasha Alterici (Illustrated Girl) and letters by Rachel Deering (Dark Horse, DC/Vertigo). It's a western/fantasy mash-up with a very mythic feel. Think A Fistful of Dollars meets Hellboy, sprinkled with seasonings from HP Lovecraft's secret drug stash.

Dead Mage follows the story of Dirt, the aging sheriff of a frontier town, and his headstrong young deputy, Charlotte Granger. This is a world where gunslingers use magic as readily as bullets. Where demonic incursions regularly threaten to destroy the mortal world. Where the only thing keeping you from being dead is a quick draw and a sharp mind.

Who the hell are you?

John Leo is a former teacher, and is presently an author and graduate student. In 2014, John Leo was featured as one of Untitled Publications' "Ten Emerging Artists You Need To Know." He writes novels, hip-hop songs, and comic books, and is currently developing his drinking problem. Mr. Leo lives in Indiana with his wife and their murderous cat. You can find follow John on twitter!

Garth Binam is a recent master's graduate from the Guildhall Program at Southern Methodist University. That's in Texas. He is passionate about art and video games.


The plan.

We are already deep in the creating process of Dead Mage, but having some money would help. Using the cash from this campaign, we will finish the 22 page debut issue of Dead Mage and keep things going from there, ideally up through issue 3. We are hoping to self-publish the series and get it directly in the hands of fans and retailers. Or maybe Dark Horse and Image will get into a bidding war that can only be resolved with Thunderdome-style gladiatorial fights between editorial departments.

The budget is allocated so that we can provide the comic with not only outstanding interior illustrations, but also hiring pro letterer Rachel Deering to make the words look awesome. And also a gorgeous variant cover by Natasha Alterici!

With a couple hundred for miscellaneous expenses, backer rewards, funding and Paypal fees, and enough happy-juice to help John run this damn campaign, that takes care of every dime. So give us yer money!

CHECK OUT OUR GALLERY!

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST AND GART ZETA

Anaseed Man is a Brighton based comic book artist who insists on speaking in third person. 
In October 2012 he released his first graphic novel GART. And now looking to explore that world due to the succes of the first volume in the form of GART ZETA!!

Set 16 years after the first book. Gart aims to break the mundane atmosphere of the past decade and a half by embarking on an epic adventure with his motley crew of punk comrades, His best friend Nob, the new King of Goblins Dagga and his 14 year old daughter Lowl.

Anaseed Man is turning everything up a notch in this volume. GZ will be printed in a bigger A4 format and will be ENTIRELY in full colour.

SO WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

If you back this project you will receive a copy of the book well in advance of online/ comic convention release.

As well as the book, the more you donate the more likely you are to receive some one off items. Including original colour art work and original pages from the book.

The goal of £3500 to print a run of 400 book, 100 pages in length. But if the goal is smashed I'll add extra pages with art from the series and exclusive short comics. The more you donate, the better this book can be!

GART ZETA is currently a work in progress, inks for the book are about a third of the way through and the colours are fast catching up.

This bad boy will be ready and in your hands by JUNE 2013. So help spread the word on twitter, tumblr, facebook or wherever you dwell online and get everyone reading comix about goblins!

 

http://anaseed.net

http://gartcomic.co.uk

story:
UPDATE: BLACK SPARTANS MANGA SERIES OFFICIALLY IN PRODUCTION. FULFILLMENT GUARANTEED FEB 2021!!!

Black Spartans is an American made shonen manga, set in a fantasy world that is a mix between the medieval and feudal eras. It follows a guild of Hunters around as they go from town to town, using their extraordinary abilities to take on various mythical creatures to keep the people safe, and seek payment in return. 

Unbeknownst to them, the Oni are finally planning to make their move and take back what they believe to be their rightful place as the true dominant race of the world, by seeking to resurrect the Four Great Demons and tip the balance of power back to their side.

Throughout their journey the will face all types of mythical creatures, other hunter guilds, the Royal Knights, and have to reckon with the fact that the roots of Balbino’s power is also demonic. They will make many allies and take you on a wild ride of exciting, infuriating, and heartbreaking experiences. 

Our heroes, Balbino, Dayanita, and Amara will have to face challenge after challenge, forcing them to grow their strength and ideologies of the world, so they may be ready to face the ultimate challenge of the Four Great Demons.

Black Spartans Chapter One is an 18 page storyline to kickoff the entire series. When purchasing your copy, you have the option of choosing between the original cover art, an alternate special edition cover, or the cover art that will be on the complete first volume.  

This is the first of over 200 chapters in the series.

 

Interior Page Art

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET!

To ensure we deliver a 18 page 5 star product, I’ve recruited some of the best talent in the industry. All money will go towards the illustration, printing, and shipping of the project.

 

CONCEPT ART

HELP LAUNCH AN EXCITING NEW MANGA SERIES BLACK SPARTANS!

We need your help and support to launch an exciting shonen manga series. Our team will deliver a 5 star product that will immerse you through the extensive world that has been built, and captivating storyline of our heroes. With your support, we can bring this world and story to life.

Talent:

Writer/Creator: Brandon Calloway

Artist: Macchiato Studios

Concept Artist: Pau Alexander & Bobby Bratayu

Editor: Jauqan Allen

Creative Consultant: Emiloe Caldwell

RISK & CHALLENGES:

With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. We will ensure transparency and update our backers should any problems arise. We intend to print end of February 2021, and shipping in early March 2021. Regardless if we are completely funded, we will ensure Black Spartans becomes a reality, one way or another.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book IP by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate manga fans! Show your support by sharing on Instagram, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out. Together let’s make Black Spartans a reality!

story:
Do You Love Ben Gran's Facebook Cartoons? 

Lots of people tell me that they love my Facebook cartoons, they love my Facebook jokes, and they love the witty remarks and self-deprecating comments and semi-embarrassing confessions and off-color innuendoes and bitter, deranged rants that I post on Facebook all day. 

But here's the thing: I can't keep giving this stuff away for free. 

You love my cartoons on Facebook, right? Have I brought a smile to your face? Have I helped to brighten your day, or at least helped you while away the long, stifling hours in your cubicle, or helped you to ignore your children for a few precious moments of mirth and mental respite? Are you not entertained? 

Then stop being a worthless, ungrateful freeloader and help me! 


Here's what I want to do: 

  • I want to make a really, really awesome HD video of my next big comedy show. (Date and Location TBA)
  • I need money to do it.
  • You have money. Will you give me some of your money? Not even "all" of your money, not even "most" of your money, but just "some" of it?
  • If you want me to keep making Facebook cartoons, I'd love it if you'd give me a small amount of your money to support me in doing this comedy thing.
If you give me $25, I will make a Facebook cartoon of you and me that you can cherish forever. I'll even design your very own Facebook cartoon avatar (if you don't have one already). 


Help Me Help You Help ME!

I need $500 (or so) to help fund the filming and production of a high-quality HD concert video of my next comedy show - in a similar style to what you'd see in an HBO comedy special from Louis C.K. or other professional comedians. I need this video to look really good - with good lighting, soundboard audio, and a boom mic to capture all of the audience laughter. I want this video to make me look like a far better comedian than I actually am - and that costs money. 

  • I need to pay my videographer to film the show, record the audio, and splice it all together with snazzy video editing techniques. 
  • I'm going to offer some FABULOUS perks for people who donate. 
  • Even if we don't reach our entire fundraising goal, even if we only get $100, the money will still help cover the costs. Just give what you can - no guilt, no obligation, no worries, no pressure... 

Oh, who am I kidding: PRESSURE! Give $5, $10, or $25! Check out our list of FABULOUS perks! C'mon! GIVE ME YOUR MONEY. For just $25, you can be my co-star in a fun Facebook cartoon like this one: 

What's In It for You? 

If you love to see the funny stuff I post on Facebook every day, here is a simple way that you can make a difference and help me keep doing what I do. If you want to support one of your favorite funny people on Facebook and help me take my comedy career to the next level, this is the time to do it.

  • Having a really good video of my next show will give me some excellent video clips that I can use when applying to comedy festivals. (Which is one of the best ways to improve my comedy career.) 
  • This video will help me get more comedy gigs and expand my comedy thing to a larger audience.
  • This video will give me a fun way to commemorate the show and give everyone a unique souvenir. Let's do this! Together!

Are You Broke? 

"But Ben," you say, "Like most of my fellow 300 million Americans, I'm really, really broke! I can't afford to give you even $5, because I'm about to get evicted!" 

No problem! (I mean - getting evicted is definitely a problem. Good luck with that. Seriously.) 

But even if you're too broke to donate, you can still help:

  • Help spread the word about this campaign - ask your friends to chip in a few bucks so we can all enjoy more amusing procrastination material on Facebook!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!

As always, thank you for your support of my reckless, belligerent narcissism. 

DISCLAIMER: This fundraising project is not related to or endorsed by Facebook or any Facebook cartoon-making app. This is a private fundraising project for the private profit of Big Entertainment, LLC, owned by Ben Gran, Comedian. Donations are NOT tax deductible.

story:
The smaller the town, the bigger the secrets...

 

The story follows Aleck Zwerg, the frustrated but charismatic son of a coal miner, who long ago outgrew the bounds of what White Ash had to offer.  Spurning a generational calling to work in the mine, Aleck’s been counting down the hours till he can get the hell out of town and head off to college. 

But as the long awaited day of liberation arrives, and Aleck packs his car for Carnegie Mellon, disaster strikes.

The accident at the mine keeps Aleck in town for three more life-changing days. During which he sparks up a romance with the enigmatic Lillian Alden.

Unfortunately, Lillian's father, Thane, owns the coal mine (and pretty much the rest of White Ash) and under no circumstances would he ever approve the union of his daughter to the son of a miner.

Aleck and Lillian's forbidden flirtation turns dangerous when Aleck uncovers a secret about his family that changes everything he knows about himself, the people around him, and the town of White Ash.

Furthermore, if Aleck leaves, there will be no one left to protect the people of White Ash from an ancient evil that’s returning.

And that’s only in the first issue.  There are so many, many more surprises in store and we can’t wait to share them with you!

Really. We can't wait. 

So we're going to start right now. Here's a preview of the first five pages.

We hope you enjoyed that little taste.  What's that, you want some more?  Well, thanks to the White Ash Chamber of Commerce, we have a short "get to know our town" video.  True, it's a bit dated, but it should give you a good sense of what life is like in our idyllic little mining community.

PERKS (AKA quit stalling and tell me what I get)

Well, you're going to get some pretty awesome things, starting with...

 

The Team 

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges

The comic is already well underway. The script is finished. Pages are being drawn, inked and colored. Conor and Fin have chained themselves to their respective computers and vowed not to eat or sleep till the project is delivered. 

Welllllllll, maybe they'll occasionally break for food (They're selfish that way). But not to worry, we've added plenty of buffer to our schedule, so we should be able to meet (or dare to dream, beat) our deadline. Charlie's managed running several animated television productions so he knows about getting things done on time. 

Plus, we all survived the predicted Mayan Apocalypse of 2012. And luckily for backers of White Ash, there isn't another credible one on the books till 2200 (when the highly scientific study based on the British game of cricket, says the last human will be born before the start of that year). So even if they're right, we'll still have plenty of time to get our books out.

That said if any apocalyptic flood does hit, or even a less apocalyptic one, we'll keep you apprised of the situation. We want all our backers to be part of White Ash for a long time. To us, we see this as the beginning of a beautiful relationship. And if you've actually read all this, it seems that relationship has already begun. So thank you.
story_txt:
The smaller the town, the bigger the secrets...

 
The story follows Aleck Zwerg, the frustrated but charismatic son of a coal miner, who long ago outgrew the bounds of what White Ash had to offer.  Spurning a generational calling to work in the mine, Aleck’s been counting down the hours till he can get the hell out of town and head off to college. 

But as the long awaited day of liberation arrives, and Aleck packs his car for Carnegie Mellon, disaster strikes.

The accident at the mine keeps Aleck in town for three more life-changing days. During which he sparks up a romance with the enigmatic Lillian Alden.

Unfortunately, Lillian's father, Thane, owns the coal mine (and pretty much the rest of White Ash) and under no circumstances would he ever approve the union of his daughter to the son of a miner.

Aleck and Lillian's forbidden flirtation turns dangerous when Aleck uncovers a secret about his family that changes everything he knows about himself, the people around him, and the town of White Ash.

Furthermore, if Aleck leaves, there will be no one left to protect the people of White Ash from an ancient evil that’s returning.
And that’s only in the first issue.  There are so many, many more surprises in store and we can’t wait to share them with you!
Really. We can't wait. 
So we're going to start right now. Here's a preview of the first five pages.





We hope you enjoyed that little taste.  What's that, you want some more?  Well, thanks to the White Ash Chamber of Commerce, we have a short "get to know our town" video.  True, it's a bit dated, but it should give you a good sense of what life is like in our idyllic little mining community.


PERKS (AKA quit stalling and tell me what I get)
Well, you're going to get some pretty awesome things, starting with...









 

The Team 

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges
The comic is already well underway. The script is finished. Pages are being drawn, inked and colored. Conor and Fin have chained themselves to their respective computers and vowed not to eat or sleep till the project is delivered. 
Welllllllll, maybe they'll occasionally break for food (They're selfish that way). But not to worry, we've added plenty of buffer to our schedule, so we should be able to meet (or dare to dream, beat) our deadline. Charlie's managed running several animated television productions so he knows about getting things done on time. 
Plus, we all survived the predicted Mayan Apocalypse of 2012. And luckily for backers of White Ash, there isn't another credible one on the books till 2200 (when the highly scientific study based on the British game of cricket, says the last human will be born before the start of that year). So even if they're right, we'll still have plenty of time to get our books out.
That said if any apocalyptic flood does hit, or even a less apocalyptic one, we'll keep you apprised of the situation. We want all our backers to be part of White Ash for a long time. To us, we see this as the beginning of a beautiful relationship. And if you've actually read all this, it seems that relationship has already begun. So thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We are excited for this opportunity to continue the offering for those who missed out on the limited-time crowdfunding of "NIGHT IS FALLING Issue #1 - Welcome To Jonah's Harbor." We are committed to an exceptionally high-quality product, with a story that will slowly drag you into the dangerous darkness of night. If you missed out on our campaign, here's your chance to climb in the coffin with us from the very first chapter of our 10-part 1977 storyline. 

 

The Story

In NIGHT IS FALLING, brother and sister Valerie and Joshua Haskell are moving from New York City to Jonah's Harbor, Maine, ostensibly because their dad has a new job in the town.  But it's a chance for a new start in many ways, as Valerie has been dogged by cruel rumors at their former school, and Joshua has been kicked out for fighting.  They soon discover that the Jonah's Harbor kids who take them into their circle have been keeping a dangerous secret, and cultivating a plan to save the town from an unspeakable evil.   

 

The Setting

Jonah's Harbor, Maine is a tiny coastal mill town, which in the summer of '77, finds itself once again in transition.  The mills are closing, and previous industries (shipbuilding, shoe manufacturing, poultry) are gone for good.  Will the town's salvation come in the form of new businesses taking advantage of the cheap land and an eager labor pool, or will a darker force capture Jonah's Harbor in its evil grip?

 

 

Who will love Night Is Falling?

  • People who grew up on movies like Fright Night, Lost Boys, The Goonies, Stand By Me, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, The Gate, Monster Squad, Gremlins, E.T., Cloak and Dagger, The Explorers… any of those timeless classics from the 80s where it’s up to the kids to save the world. (And a story that isn't afraid to put our heroic kids in serious danger.) 
  • Readers of bleeding edge comics like Sabrina, Afterlife with Archie, Monstress, Lumberjanes & Motor Crush 
  • Fans of Stephen King stories/films like Salem’s Lot, It and Stand By Me (The Body) and other spooky tales set in New England
  • People who love the commitment to detail and setting in the hit series Stranger Things 
  • Fans of Dracula and other classic vampire stories
  • Fans of Neil Gaiman’s young adult horror stories Coraline and The Graveyard Book - We've got some vampire violence and light swearing but depending on your child, we'd rate our book a PG-13.
  • If you'd enjoy a comic with the pacing of an old school horror film, atmospheric visuals, and starring a cast of characters you care about, THIS IS YOUR BOOK!

 

What do you get with Night Is Falling #1?

Night Is Falling #1 is a full color comic book that will be 30+ pages in standard American comic size, on high-quality gloss paper. It's the first of 10 planned issues that cover our 1977 story arc.

Backers get a digital and/or physical copy of the book. 

Includes 30+ pages of story (no ads) plus bonus content at the end of the book.

We have a limited supply of the super-rare variant cover by Illustrator Tom Brown of the hit gothic steampunk comic series "Hopeless, Maine." Only 100 issues of this version will even be printed and only 30 will be available on here! You'll also have the opportunity to add on a digital bundle of great extra content to immerse yourself in. If you want a deeper look and listen to the world of NIGHT IS FALLING, check out the digital bundle add-on option during checkout!

 

The Creative Team

 

Also, when time permits, we slay vampires. 

 

If you share our love for vampire stories, especially ones inspired by modern film classics where average kids become heroes that embark on fantastic and dangerous missions, we think you'll really dig what we are up to. Those are the kind of stories that shaped us during our formative years. Our whole team feels in this modern climate, tales of heroic kids are particularly resonant and we want to bring more of these stories into the world.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Although our creative team is still very new to the world of comics, we have successfully met and exceeded the crowdfunding goal for our first issue. Our entire team has had great success in the past for various creative projects, and have delivered on each one of them. We are no strangers to the hard work and long hours it takes to deliver a high-quality product, and we've surrounded ourselves with some very accomplished mentors in the comic publishing community. That being said, we are a team of humans, and there could very well be life hurdles we cannot predict along our path. We promise to be as transparent as possible​ and to give ample updates along our creative journey through our email newsletter. You will be made aware of any issues we encounter. No one wants to see this book get made more than we do, and we will give it all we have to make this as awesome as it can be.

story:
Goals

For this Indiegogo campaign, the more money raised, the sooner you get a copy!! After each goal is reached, the "Estimated Delivery Date" will be changed on the campaign.

$3,000 - Estimated Delivery Date for the DIGITAL version (November 2020) - GOAL REACHED!!!

$7,500 - Estimated Delivery Date for the PRINT version (November 2020)

After a triumphant victory at Orleans, Joan, following the guidance of St. Michael the Archangel, leads Charles VII to Rheims where he is crowned King of France.

However, danger lurks around the corner and Joan is quickly captured and sold to England!

What happens next will change the course of history!

This issue brings Joan's adventures to a conclusion, continuing the story from the first issue.

If you haven't seen the first issue, check it our HERE!!

 

Sample pages from Issue #2!!

During her trial, Joan stated that it was St. Michael the Archangel who guided her in battle and helped her every step of the way. No one believed her. She was sentenced to a gruesome death for heresy and witchcraft. 

But what if she did receive celestial guidance in an extraordinary way?

This new comic book series, THE MISSION OF JOAN OF ARC, tells the story of St. Joan of Arc from her perspective. 

With this comic book, we seek to bring Joan’s visions to life, imagining what she might have seen.

For added inspiration, we’ll also reference an original script by French Carmelite nun, St. Therese of Lisieux. She wrote the play during the “Year of Joan of Arc” in 1894.

Therese took Joan at her word and featured St. Michael the Archangel as a principal character in her play.

CREATOR/WRITER - Philip Kosloski is a writer well known for his accessible articles on topics of spirituality and Church history at Aleteia.org as well as his comic book series Finnian and the Seven Mountains and The Mission of Joan of Arc.

CONSULTING EDITOR - Lewis Helfand is freelance comic book writer and editor. Lewis Helfand's credits include the award-winning Mother Teresa for Campfire Comics and Nelson Mandela: The Unconquerable Soul; named graphic novel of the year at Comic-Con India.

For this issue, we are teaming up with Cornerstone Creative Studios to create a high-quality comic book with a compelling story and stunning visuals!

PENCILLER

INKER

COLORER

LETTERER

Our mission is to create quality, entertaining Catholic content that inspires both children and adults to live a heroic life. Through our comic books and online publications, we seek to highlight the truth, beauty and goodness that can be found in effective storytelling.

Check out where we have been featured in the media on our website.

www.voyagecomics.com

Rewards

Signature of Joan of Arc T-Shirt (featuring the actual signature of St. Joan of Arc) 

The Mission of Joan of Arc #1

story:
Thank you for visiting our team at our support page!!! As some of you may know, “Brimstone and The Borderhounds” will be launching officially on October 31st, 2010 with a Pre-Launch Signing Event being held on October 30th, 2010 at Borders Books flagship store on Long Island, New York. As many people know, it takes A LOT to publish a comic book! This includes time, effort and serious dedication; which is what EVERY member of our team has proven time and time again! We here on the Borderhounds Creative Team are looking to take this title to the next level! In order to do this, we need to raise the funds needed for producing enough books for major distribution. We are currently in negotiations for the comic book to be carried in Borders Books, Barnes and Noble and Diamond Distributors (Diamond distributes to the majority of comic book stores across the country). Although it says that we are looking to raise only $1,000... in actuality we need to raise closer to $10,000 to accomplish our goal on the level needed for success.

 

The money received will not only go to the production of the comic itself, however it will also assist in the promotion and advertisement of the "Brimstone and The Borderhounds" title and other Borderhound creative team projects including the video game in production with SGN Games for the Xbox LIVE & PS3, "Brimstone" action figure in production with Shocker Toys and the development of other titles that will spin off from the Borderhounds brand. We are asking our friends, family, fans and whomever else who ever had a dream to reach into your pockets and partake in our history...

 

We have suceeded in raising the revenue in order to create a phenomenal visual experience for our appearances at the major comic book conventions! Visibility is key and we have been noticed! We are again looking to raise the money by utilizing pre-sales of the comic book, advertising and a couple of really cool perks! As you will notice… for every different level of support, you receive something in return.

For those of you looking to just “help out” – We wholeheartedly appreciate it and your deed will not be overlooked! As always thank you all SO much for your support!!!

For a complete OVERVIEW of “Brimstone and The Borderhounds” Please visit us here: http://www.theborderhounds.com/overview.html or for more information, please visit our Official Website at: http://www.theborderhounds.com

 

**It has come to our attention that people are confused on how to purchase the comic here... Please notice the "FUND OUR PROJECT" button on the right hand side of the screen. Next, you can choose which package you would like to order. Finally, as you scroll down that page you will enter all of your personal information in order to complete the purchase! Thank you again for your support!!!

The Impact

What We Need & What You Get

story:
My name is Chris Bodily (aka Hatrobot.) I'm extremely excited to share with you Book One of my first full-length graphic narrative, Black Lantern. I've dreamt of making comics since I was a kid. As someone raised on Scooby Doo and candy corn, this is my homage to all the ghost stories, monster movies, and zombie films I've digested over the years. 

As freelance paranormal investigators, the Burnwood and Blackwell Agency are no strangers to the supernatural. Edgar is a tattooed jack o’ lantern with a haunted past, Fiona is a rockabilly witch learning to master her abilities, and Julius is a talking black cat with a thing for ghosts. But when a clandestine priory comes after Edgar for a dark ritual, the three will have to embark on an arcane adventure into the occult in order to solve the mystery. With Halloween fast approaching, will any of them make it out alive?

Black Lantern is a project three years in the making. Book One is a fully funded, 250 page graphic novel that should be ready for release by January 2020.  The purpose of this campaign is to allow backers who may have missed the initial launch an opportunity to reserve their copy of the book, and ensure that Book Two can be completed. If you're the type of person that starts thinking about Halloween costumes in July, Black Lantern is the book for you. 

In addition to a paperback copy, all backers will receive exclusive digital wallpaper and bonus materials, as well as a .pdf copy of the book. In the event that we're able to raise an additional $10,000 through Indiegogo, an exclusive edition hardcover upgrade will become available and all backers will receive a Black Lantern original tarot deck.  

Since Book One is already complete and fully funded, barring anything catastrophic, there’s no reason things shouldn’t be fulfilled in a professional manner once the book is published. In the event of any unforeseen problems however, backers will be notified immediately. 

This comic does contain some adult themes, language, and violence and may not be suited for young children.

Black Lantern is a project near and dear to my heart. Your investment in its success means a great deal to me and I can't thank you enough for your support.
