If you're the type of person that starts thinking about Halloween costumes in July, Black Lantern is the book for you. In addition to a paperback copy, all backers will receive exclusive digital wallpaper and bonus materials, as well as a .pdf copy of the book. In the event that we're able to raise an additional $10,000 through Indiegogo, an exclusive edition hardcover upgrade will become available and all backers will receive a Black Lantern original tarot deck.  Since Book One is already complete and fully funded, barring anything catastrophic, there’s no reason things shouldn’t be fulfilled in a professional manner once the book is published. In the event of any unforeseen problems however, backers will be notified immediately. This comic does contain some adult themes, language, and violence and may not be suited for young children.Black Lantern is a project near and dear to my heart. Your investment in its success means a great deal to me and I can't thank you enough for your support.

story:
If you are a fan of dark hero stories in the vein of James O'barr's The Crow or Todd Mcfarlane and Robert Kirkman's Haunt, The Embrace is the book for you. The Embrace has 40 pages of  story developed by some of the best, up-and-coming talent in the Industry. The Embrace is a story about Loss, Fatherhood, and Justice as a father gets saved by the ghost of his son:No Father Should have to bury their son, but life sometimes doesn’t play out the way it should. It’s been a year since the mugging that robbed Clarence Griffin of both his dignity and his son, David. With the police closing the case, Clarence revisits the last place he was with his son with every intent on taking his own life. However, as he arrives he is stopped by the ghost of David and in the embrace of his child’s spirit, he not only receives a vision revealing the people responsible but a suit that protects him from harm and grants him abilities. Now father and son hunt down the criminals responsible for this tragedy and bring them to justice

Interior Pages Preview:

 

 

 

 

This title promises to be THE Superhero book of 2021, and in order to ensure that, we have some of the best up-and-coming talents in the indie comic scene. Scribing the project is Michael Oden, writer of the Elysian Fields series, pencil and inking duties are being done by up and comer Dean James, coloring for the book will be handled by Paul Bilick colorist of Shinobi Sasquatch, lettering will be handled by Es Kay, and editing duties are done by Lee Byron Carver. Together we are bringing you 40 pages of story in this top-of-the-line comic that will be sure to deliver a harrowing experience to its reader, but in case that wasn't enough to sell you, we made sure to add something a bit special to the campaign! 

 

Characters:

Prelaunch Pin-up:

This pinup is FREE for all the backers who previously signed up for the mailing list, however, if you didn't find out about us till after the campaign launched, it's okay! You can still have this beautiful 11x17 piece as an add-on for your book! 

 

Main "Death in the Family" Homage Cover:

 

Because Homage covers are all the rage, and everyone has used that Spider-Man 300 cover so much, we decided to go a different route! For the main cover of The Embrace we decided to pay homage to the iconic Batman: Death in the Family cover because, frankly, it fits our book super well! 

 

Jim O'Riley & Sigmund Torre Cover:

 

The Free Pinup for signing up for the mailing list was just too good not to get its own cover! Be sure to get this Virgin B Variant of the main book! This edition of the book will be made a holofoil as a stretch goal of $4,500 

 

Special Edition with Barton Bros Cover!

 

How to Draw Comics YT artists Clayton and Korey Barton have delivered brilliant art that will serve as the cover for our Special Edition of the book. This edition of the book will use a 105lb text card stock cover, with not only the story but an art gallery, and even the script of the book! 

 

A Free Book You Say?

When I initially was pitching this book, I really wanted it to feel like James O'Barr's The Crow in almost every regard. In other words, I was initially looking at doing this book ENTIRELY in black and white. However, the moment some colors got brought into The Embrace's design, I knew that we had to do the color. That being said, Dean still thought that having this Black and White edition of the book would be an awesome thing to reward our backers, and I agreed. This brings us to The Embrace: Spectral Edition. The Embrace: Spectral Edition will feature all the things included with the Special Edition, except that the story will be entirely in Black and White. However, if you notice, this tier is not listed on the campaign perks, and this is intentional. You can ONLY get The Spectral Edition via the purchase of our featured Signed One of Everything Tier! That means that you are effectively getting 5 books for the price of 4! 

 

Partnership with Dave Brink's Perfect 10 issue 2

We are excited to announce our partnership with Dutch creator David Brink and his action-packed series: Perfect 10! By backing BOTH of these projects, you will receive a FREE crossover pinup of The Embrace and Perfect 10 drawn by Only Death Can Save Us creator, Russel Leach! 

 

Elysian Field #0 Redux:

With all the feedback we have gotten from Elysian Fields we wanted to show that we were, in fact, listening, and so to showcase that spirit and demonstrate the future of Elysian Fields, we will be doing a Redux of Elysian Fields, recolored by Avery Ferdinand (Harland Buck) and re-lettered by Es Kay. 

This $10 add on will be available for purchase alongside ANY tier of The Embrace! 

 

Fanart Contest Winner:

We had some really great submissions for The Embrace fanart contest and trust me, it was REALLY tough getting these down. However, We did have to choose the winner and so while the top 3 will be featured in a fanart gallery along with the piece that inspired the contest by B00ty Juice, this fantastic piece will serve as an early bird special add on pinup for all backers in the first 30 days! 


 

We Need You

Doing these books is no small undertaking, and as such our project needs you to make it come to fruition!  In our previous Elysian Fields campaigns, we have hovered just before the 10k mark, and our biggest goal with this book is to push well beyond that 10k mark and hopefully even hit 20k! In an effort to do this, we have created some reward incentives in the form of Stretch goals! 

$3,000 ------> POGS

Remember those cool discs with comic art on them from the 90s?  Well so do we, and with the very 90s, Image kind of vibe that the book has, we thought it would be fun to have these throwback items as our first stretch goal

$4,500 -------> Holofoil B Variant

The Jim O'Riley and Sigmund Torre variant gets made into a SEXY Holofoil!

 

$5,000 --------> One of Each Collector Box

All backers of the One of Each tier will have their books shipped in this stunning collector box! 12x9x2 with box art done by Derek Clay! 

 

 

 

$6,000 ------> James O'Barr "The Crow" Homage B Variant for the Special Edition! 

Linework by Von Randal, colors by @EntertainmentMadness on Twitter, we have a new B Variant available for the Special Edition of the book! The cover is a mixed media piece of a digital drawing by Von Randal, and then painted over by @EntertainmentMadness with acrylics and Watercolors! That Original piece will be offered on the campaign as well once complete! 

$7,500------> SECOND SECRET!

$10,000 ------>Metal Trading Cards

We were going  to do holofoil trading cards at this stretchgoal, but upon seeing this new trend of doing metal trading cards, we felt it was worth the upgrade! 

$12,000 ------> BUTTONS!!!!

People like Buttons I hear right? 

$15,000 ------> 12 Page Short story

In better times, David once opened Clarence's most prized comic: The Astonishing Arachnateen #1. Get an inside look at the book that helped cultivate a boy's heroic spirit! 

 

We hope to see you join the backer list for The Embrace! We are bringing a next-level book to you guys with a compelling story, and character. You Don't Want to Miss Out!

story:
Indie Volt Revolt!

For the last two+ years listeners to the indie Volt radio network and podcasts have seen and heard a number of creators talk about the world of creating, publishing, distributing, selling, reading and loving comics. Now, to celebrate the podcast network's second anniversary, as well as Arrow Comics' return to publishing, Indie Volt contributors gather their best stories into a one-of-a-kind volume you do NOT want to miss! More than a display of "put up or shut up", or "preview snippets", this volume is a fantastic collection of self-contained short stories that anyone who loves comics will enjoy, whether they know what an "Indie Volt" is or not!

This volume BEGINS with over 100 standard comics sized square-bound pages in black and white, sequential art designed to display what comics are truly capable of! A world-wide collection of artists and writers from all walks of life have put their best work on display here, so much in fact that we've made it a "flip book", like those great old Ace paperbacks, here you go though at least 50 pages of comics THEN TURN THE BOOK OVER and go in again with at least another 50 pages of comics and stories! This gives you TWO great full-color front covers in one handy volume!

Collecting these stories and production on this volume has been no easy feat. This product has been the brainchild of Indie Volt host Randy Zimmerman for almost the last year. Randy is co-creator of Arrow Comics' first regularly published comic, Tales From The Aniverse and has over 35 years of experience producing, creating, selling and distributing comics.

No Frills, just GREAT Comics!

This volume showcases the talents of over TWO DOZEN sequential artists, almost all of which have been featured on episodes of the Indie Volt podcast. Additional 'stretch goals" will be offered as well to make this book literally as big as the backers allow!  We are also only offering two versions of this book to be printed and the print run WILL BE LIMITED to this campaign and a few extras for retailers and contributors.  As they say in those ads 'once they're gone, they're GONE!"

"Print-On-demand" has forever changed this industry. As of this campaign's posting, this book is already 90% IN HOUSE and ready for printing. Once this campaign ends, and barring any stretch goal hold-ups or glitches, we will go to press and get this book into your hands immediately.  We have an experienced printer within a small drive from Arrow Comics HQ who does great quality square-bound books, and because it is POD our final backer numbers are secondary to getting these books in your hands, that's why our "goal" is flexible and low.

For Indie Volt's international radio audience we will be offering the book in physical form (we're sorry, but you'll have to cover postage) OR, for our readers outside of the North American continent (because we know how crazy postage has gotten), we are offering a complete pdf file at a special price. this pdf will contain ALL of the covers offered, ALL the stretch goals this campaign might achieve, AND a few added surprises of additional Arrow product as well.  If you've enjoyed the Indie volt podcasts over the last few years you know we have no outside funding besides a few great sponsors. now is the time to show your appreciation to the show and our talent as well!

For our retailer friends in the direct market, we are offering a genuine "Retailer Tier" where you are welcome to purchase multiple copies of Revolt at a retailer discount (retail store verification requested).

Arrow Comics knows this is our first crowd-funder, so fulfillment will be top priority. Anyone familiar with Arrow's quality in the past (The Realm, The Dead, Dark Oz, Spank The Monkey and more) know our commitment  to quality and creator ownership is second to none.  Additional stretch goals to this campaign will include samples of some of those older Arrow products that we are just as proud to be associated with today as we are with Indie Volt Revolt!  Some of that product also features work(s) from Revolt contributors as well!

 

This volume includes:

more than 15 stories featuring a vast variety of sequential art. Complete short stories designed to showcase the quality of talent you hear every week on the Indie volt radio network and podcasts including:

- FAIRIES WEAR BOOTS by Seth Aneila Abair  aka "Goblin Grim". A touching, tragic story of magic and forgiveness.

HATCH by Glenn Fleming of Comics Unlimited: A silent tale of discovery.

 

WOULD YE YET KNOW MORE? by Emily Zelasko from A Piece Of Cake: A tale inspired by a Norse poem featuring Odin himself (There's a slice of illustration from this story two pictures above).

THE SECRET ORIGIN OF MEGA MOOSE by John Celestri animator of dragon's Lair, Space Ace and Bobba Fett from the star Wars Holiday special: introducing the reader to his all ages superhero Mega Moose!

THE TALE OF THE LINDYJAX AND THE DOG BY THE SIDE OF THE ROAD by Randy Zimmerman from War of The Worlds: infestation, Flint Comix and Indie volt host: A tale of a homeless dog, a trading elf, and the need for respect.

AND:

AN UNEXPECTED STING Featuring Retro Ram and His Rocket Rangers: by Ralph Griffith (story) and Stuart Kerr (script) of the original Arrow comics, Mark Bloodworth (pencil roughs) from NightStreets and Hellraiser, Jason Moore (finishes, inks and letters) from The Dead and Evil Ernie and featuring a commemorative portrait of Ralph Griffith by Vince Locke from Deadworld and sandman: A special last story tribute to Arrow Comics' founder Ralph Griffith who wrote that story he always wanted to write.

AND MORE, BUT THAT'S ONLY IN ONE HALF OF THE BOOK! ON THE OTHER SIDE YOU'LL SEE...

DETECTIVE TED TIRED: TEA PARTY FOR TWO by Jake "Stinch" Tvister telling a modern detective tale of car exploding proportions.

MISS CHEVIOUS AND GANDA IN LOSING YOUR WAY by J.D. Calderon from Tall tails and The chronicles Of Oswald (script) and Daphne Lage (art) from Tall tails and EgoRaven bringing back to print The Aniverse's favorite team of bounty hunters for the first time in 2 decades.

A special tale by Erik Hodson from Roddy Piper: The kilted Avenger featuring the secret origin of his Webtoon and Tapas featuring THE DREADED DINOSAURMAN!

HORSEMAN'S TALES - LOOK DON'T TOUCH by Rik Hoskin (story) and Russ Leach (art) presenting a bar brawl tale featuring War from Only death Can Save Us you will love to see!

A TRAVELER'S DESIRE by J.R. Harris from the upcoming Arrow Comics Superhero series Paragon, bringing us a fantasy tale in the manga grey tone style of the great Hayao Myazaki.

AND MUCH MORE!!

To get a further preview of the quality of the art contained in this book please watch the video above.

All profits generated from this campaign will be divided by the number of pages this volume contains and returned equally to its creative teams.

 

Two Great Cover Sets To Choose from!

COVER SET #1 FEATURES;

-DEATH REVOLTING by Russ Leach from Dr. Who Comics and Ben 10; featuring his character Dee from Only Death Can Save Us

And MISS CHEVIOUS AND GANDA by Daphne Lage from Tall Tails and EgoRaven .

COVER SET #2 FEATURES:

JET PACK GIRL by Chris Scalf from Godzilla and Dark Horse's Star Wars

And RETRO RAM REVOLTING by Kirk Jarvinen from Aquaman; Time and Tide, Great Scott and more (pencils), Jason Moore from Tales from The Aniverse and Batman: Haunted Gotham (inks) and Chris Hall from Grimm's Fairy Tales (colors).

 

STRETCH GOALS!!

THANK YOU!!  GOAL REACHED AT 25 BACKERS: REVOLT Hhas grown another 12 pages by adding a hilarious GUANO GUY story by Mark Darden! For being the 25th Backer to this campaign, Trish Bengtson will receive a sketch of Miss Chevious by Randy Zimmerman! 

AT 50 BACKERS: REVOLT grows ANOTHER 8 pages with the addition of a BRAND NEW Hero Bot Zero story by Randy Zimmerman and an artist TBA! The 50th backer to this campaign (minus those backers who have had to cancel and be refunded - if no one else cancels it looks like #54) will receive a Miss Chevious sketch by Daphne Lage!

AT 100 BACKERS: We add yet another ancient (don't call it 'antique"!) Arrow Comics issue to your bundle! PLUS we MIGHT sneak yet another story into the book (okay, we WILL sneak another story into the book- HEY! it IS 100 backers after all!)

AT 150 BACKERS: REVOLT adds a Tipsy The Gnome tale written by Krysta Grant (the indie Princess and author of the adult GN Lure) with art by Indie Volt owner Varian Grant (He promises!)!

AT 200 BACKERS: REVOLT adds another story TBA as we get closer to this goal!

AT 250 BACKERS: REVOLT adds another story TBA as we get closer to this goal!

AT 300 BACKERS: REVOLT adds ANOTHER story TBA as we get closer to this goal!

AT 400 BACKERS: REVOLT adds ANOTHER...you know... we LOVE "Print On Demand" and our printer will love us back!

AT 500 BACKERS: We faint, but we add yet ANOTHER special thing to your shipment!

BEYOND THAT...WE'LL DEFINITELY THINK OF SOMETHING!

This will be the first publication printed by Arrow Comics 4.0. Watch for us as we bring the very best quality comics to both crowdfunding as well as the Direct Market! As always our motto remains: "Our Aim Is Entertainment, Our Target Is Quality!".

This campaign and publication is dedicated to the memory of Ralph Griffith. We miss you pal!

And MISS CHEVIOUS AND GANDA by Daphne Lage from Tall Tails and EgoRaven .

COVER SET #2 FEATURES:
JET PACK GIRL by Chris Scalf from Godzilla and Dark Horse's Star Wars
And RETRO RAM REVOLTING by Kirk Jarvinen from Aquaman; Time and Tide, Great Scott and more (pencils), Jason Moore from Tales from The Aniverse and Batman: Haunted Gotham (inks) and Chris Hall from Grimm's Fairy Tales (colors).
 
STRETCH GOALS!!
THANK YOU!!  GOAL REACHED AT 25 BACKERS: REVOLT Hhas grown another 12 pages by adding a hilarious GUANO GUY story by Mark Darden! For being the 25th Backer to this campaign, Trish Bengtson will receive a sketch of Miss Chevious by Randy Zimmerman! 
AT 50 BACKERS: REVOLT grows ANOTHER 8 pages with the addition of a BRAND NEW Hero Bot Zero story by Randy Zimmerman and an artist TBA! The 50th backer to this campaign (minus those backers who have had to cancel and be refunded - if no one else cancels it looks like #54) will receive a Miss Chevious sketch by Daphne Lage!
AT 100 BACKERS: We add yet another ancient (don't call it 'antique"!) Arrow Comics issue to your bundle! PLUS we MIGHT sneak yet another story into the book (okay, we WILL sneak another story into the book- HEY! it IS 100 backers after all!)
AT 150 BACKERS: REVOLT adds a Tipsy The Gnome tale written by Krysta Grant (the indie Princess and author of the adult GN Lure) with art by Indie Volt owner Varian Grant (He promises!)!
AT 200 BACKERS: REVOLT adds another story TBA as we get closer to this goal!
AT 250 BACKERS: REVOLT adds another story TBA as we get closer to this goal!
AT 300 BACKERS: REVOLT adds ANOTHER story TBA as we get closer to this goal!
AT 400 BACKERS: REVOLT adds ANOTHER...you know... we LOVE "Print On Demand" and our printer will love us back!
AT 500 BACKERS: We faint, but we add yet ANOTHER special thing to your shipment!
BEYOND THAT...WE'LL DEFINITELY THINK OF SOMETHING!
This will be the first publication printed by Arrow Comics 4.0. Watch for us as we bring the very best quality comics to both crowdfunding as well as the Direct Market! As always our motto remains: "Our Aim Is Entertainment, Our Target Is Quality!".
This campaign and publication is dedicated to the memory of Ralph Griffith. We miss you pal!

story:
Hello there!

Let me tell you a story about five comic artists, inspired and in love with the retro manga style, but who had nowhere to express their passion for it.

'This cannot continue!' they said. So they grouped together as editors, invited other brilliant artists to participate with them, and created this new manga anthology.

The five editors are Elise, Arthur, Sara, Sofia and Anette, and we welcome you to the Golden Garden anthology!

 

The Golden Garden Anthology

This massive book has 16 different comics inspired by manga styles from the 70's and early 80's!

We wanted to honor the comics from the era and show a variety of styles and stories inspired by them. We asked the artists to blend their own styles with the retro styles of artists who came before them and make each manga feel like it could have been published in that time.

The stories, themes and styles within have exceeded our wildest dreams. Every comic has a true retro feel and the variety of the stories extend from a dancer making a deal with the devil to time traveling soda lovers and magic fights.

 

The artists of Golden Garden

Here are all of our amazing artists that are participating in the anthology!

 

Anette Bengtsson/DotsAndSwirls

'Bunny Queen'

A witch and her dearest friend, a little bunny named Queen, are fighting a battle against time to cast a spell before the world falls to pieces. Will they make it before the world crumbles, or will a certain giant hare stop them before their plan is successful?

​

Arthur

'Soda'

Max is a skater boy from our modern time who only cares about soda and skating. One day he trips and travels back in time to the 18th century, there he meets the rich and extravagant Alexandre.

Diana (Omegasama) & Johan Gustafsson

'Gissu'

In a city ruled by mages, a soldier and his alchemist husband must defend those they love from strange magic.

Don Arvidsson

'An Insecure Dance'

Ariel, a professional dancer whose career has come to a standstill, feels guilty for letting their dance partner down one time too many. Hearing the call of Ariel’s anguished and self-doubting heart, a mischevious Satan arrives to offer a hand…

 

Elise Rosberg

'The Legend of the Hyacinth'

Based on the Greek mythology legend of Apollo and Hyacinthus, and the jealous Zephyrus. Hyacinthus is a spartan prince beloved by all, including the Gods Apollo and Zephyrus. But Hyacinthus rejects Zephyrus and chooses Apollo, which doesn't sit well with Zephyrus...

Erupan/Rebecca Johansson Ryberg

'Reciever'

Since her childhood Kirsten has been harrassed by a mysterious caller, depriving her of sleep and always keeping her on edge. Whats worse is that nobody else seems to hear that old landline phone ringing. It's not even connected, so who would ever believe her?

Grusrobot/Anna Karlsson

'A Scent Of Roses'

In the year 2725, in the giant city of Volsung, the rich indulge themselves in their pleasure gardens while the poor fight hunger and disease.Young lovers Sigrid and Maria struggle to bridge the gap of the two worlds and be together.

Jojo/Felicia Eklund

'We Shine Together'

When Hana must bury Yuki, her deceased cat, she lights a lantern and vows to keep it lit so that Yuki’s spark of life still may exist. After the long walk home Hana collapses from exhaustion and wakes up at the hospital only to be told that she’s got an unknown disease, which eats her up from the inside. Will Yuki's spark of life be enough to help Hana's from fading?

JoJa

'A Grain of Magic'

The fairy prince, Florian, have been given a tricky task that turns out to be harder than expected. He seeks some help from Helio, an outspoken food gatherer. See if they can do it in "A Grain of Magic"

Kelverse

'MIRA'

A tale that reaches through time about the struggles between wanting to grow up, realizing you might not be ready for it, and finding confidence in yourself.

Nikijoart

'Rain Sparkles'

Saga has a crush on a cute girl, but they rarely ever talk. That is, until one rainy afternoon after school.

RibShapedEyes/Sara F

'Made To Order Life',

​A spirit who wishes to become a human visit the only shop who can provide help! However, the one managing the store is a overworked intern who seems to have their hands full! How will this turn out for the spirit?

Sofia Almqvist

'I’ll Still be Here!'
What makes you alive? Is it about evolution and biology or simply that you can sneak by a captcha test on your computer? Ricci and Stella are eager to find out, and what better way is there than to make it into a good ol’ contest?

Stina “Spocha” Lövkvist

'Space Bean 2081'

A young assistant is assigned the task to keep an eye on a revolutionary experiment involving a shapeshifting extraterrestial forest spirit for 30 minutes, and fails of course. The forest spirit breaks free. Fleeing through the tunnels of a windling undergound science base she picks up the presence of another spirit, who declares to have given up on humanity and decided to dissappear from the face of the earth.

Tomas Antila

'Strange girl from another world'

Aria is a dimension traveling monster slayer able to defeat any enemy. But when her foes are junior highschool girls she must use all her social skills to win.

William Lillstjärna

'Oasis 1025'

In the year 19XX, a lethal virus is threatening to wipe out all of mankind. Doctor Mici is on a mission to find a cure, but instead uncovers the dark origins of the virus. A science fiction tribute to the later works of Osamu Tezuka.
 

Here are the perk-levels that we are offering!

We also have some fun add-ons that you can choose from when you check-out. Read more about them further below!

Bookmark
You will get a printed bookmark with the illustration from our front cover sent to you! Note that this perk is for one physical bookmark only.

E-book
You will get a digital/e-book version of the book!

Printed Book
You get a copy of the printed version of the book sent to you!

Retailer/Bookstore
This perk level is for retailers in Sweden ONLY.
This perk level contains 10 printed versions of the Golden Garden anthology, at retailer price (f-pris). Retailer price (f-pris) includes a 20% discount on the books + shipping within Sweden.


​Original drawing
You will be sent a printed book, and also get an original drawing (black/white/grayscale) in A5 size by one of our artists!

Manga Lesson (2 hours, Skype or IRL)
You can get the printed book, and a two hour manga lesson with one of our teachers at checkout! We have four different teachers that will be available for lessons! Here you can read more about them:
Elise Rosberg
Sara F
Tomas Antila
Anna Karlsson

 

Add-ons

Signed by the Editors
Get your book signed by the five editors of Golden Garden!
Anette Bengtsson/DotsAndSwirls, Arthur, Elise Rosberg, Sara F och Sofia Almqvist!
Add this at check out!

 

An overview of the book

Cover art may be changed!

The book consists of:

  • 350 comic pages
  • 16 comics made by 17 awesome comic artists
  • Full color cover and black/white/gray interior pages
  • Dimensions of the book is 170 x 240 mm (European B5)
  • A perfect-bound softcover volume, meaning that the final volume will have a smooth spine to which the interior pages are glued.
  • All text is completely in English and the book will be read the Japanese way, right to left

 

Golden Garden is also available as a digital E-book version!

 


 

 

Timeline

We have just reviewed everyone's layout sketches and everyone has started working on their final pages!

All of us have been working together by reading each other’s layout sketches and giving each other feedback to ensure some really great and interesting comics for you to read.

The book will be officially released in January-February 2020, which is also when we expect to be able to start shipping out your books and perks! Please allow for some shipping time.

 

Can we do this?

YES, ABSOLUTELY!

All of us editors have either participated in or been editors for anthologies like this before and have produced many marvelous and appreciated self-published comic books and anthologies.

We know how to deal with printers, creators and how to make this project a reality.

One of our editors has a bachelor's in publishing and bookmanship.

 

Cost breakdown

What we need

What we need some help with is to finance the printing costs for the book. By purchasing a book from us through this crowdfunding campaign you are helping us make them into a physical thing!

The book will be sold after the crowdfunding campaign as well, by each of the artists, but by contributing to the crowdfunding campaign this early, you can help to ensure that the financial burden on each artist is much lessened or even non-existent. It helps a lot!

There's no publisher behind this project who can fund it, so otherwise all of our artists would have to fund this with money from their own pockets.

You can also choose to get yourself something extra with your order. Maybe an art print, some stickers or original piece of art?

Every contribution is much appreciated!

 

If you are not able to donate, there are other ways that you can help us!

Share this campaign on social media, talk to your friends about it, and help spread the word about it. It helps us a lot!
 

Self-published

This is and indie-project, which means that we are publishing the book ourselves without outside funding or a publisher to back us up.

That is why we need all the help we can get from you lovely backers! Please help us share this campaign in any way that you can, we will be forever grateful!

 

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

Our crowdfunding goal is set as flexible, which means that everything that is donated to us, we keep, regardless of if we reach our goal or not. This money will go directly into the printing costs of the book.

Should we not reach our goal, the remainder to reach it will be divided between the participating artists so that we together will help to pay the printers.

But, of course, or plan is to reach our funding goal!! And should we exceed it, we are hoping to add stretch goals to make the book even prettier!

Should delays in making the anthology occur, such as printers taking longer time than they thought or similar things, we will inform you as soon as we know!
 

Gallery

Check out our gallery (on our website) or all of the artists social media accounts to see some of the sketches, behind-the-scenes material and sneak peeks of the comics!

There is already some stuff up there, so go have a look!

 

Don’t forget to check in from time to time to see our updates

And follow us (and our artists!) on social media to see more of the comics that will be in Golden Garden.

You can find us at:

Twitter

Facebook

Instagram

Our website:

Golden Garden Website
 

Thank you for stopping by and considering us!

story:
The Creator: Being a long time fan of comic books and comic book movies, it was only a matter of time before Ray Zepeda would eventually turn his love for comics into a career choice. For the last decade Ray has been pushing forward trying to make his dream a reality and having met Ryan Scales (Iron Lion Studios) in 2008, and launching Tragic Hero Comics in 2012; that reality is almost here! Tragic Hero Comics needs YOU now!

The Story: A secret society known as the Department of Advanced Research and Knowledge (D.A.R.K. for short) attempts to create perfect soldiers by secretly testing the youth of America… Years later the project is suddenly shut down without so much as a word and every test subject is subsequently tracked down and terminated…

…Or so they thought…

As it turns out 113 of the original test subjects managed to slip through the cracks because they had failed to yield positive results from the testing done to them as children. Not only did they survive D.A.R.K.’s massacre but they managed to stay hidden for years until something put them back on D.A.R.K.’s radar…

… Get ready to find out how it all goes down in this explosive prelude to AntiHero: 113!

Goal: Tragic Hero Comics’ goal is to raise enough money to publish this exciting first step into the Tragic Hero Comicverse, and use the momentum from it to successfully launch “AntiHero: 113” and other exciting titles for you (and eventually the world) to enjoy!

What We Need…

This is where you wonderful people come in we need to raise $850 dollars for this campaign! That’s it!

Why so much? Where is it going? Both good questions… a little more than half is going to pay for the art, while the rest will cover printing and shipping costs… it’s as simple as that.

What You Get…

Tragic Hero Comics has a lot in store for you guys! We have several perk packages for you guys to choose from (some are limited) so just take a look on the right and choose something that catches your fancy!

*** Please include your full address and $5 dollars for shipping if you need to have your perks sent to you!***

Remember you can also support us by making a contribution using a Credit/Debit Card or PayPal if you would rather do that.

What IF We Don’t Meet Our Goal?

Man! You’re asking some good questions! Like a famous starship captain once said…”We don’t believe in no-win scenarios”. We will produce as much as we can with what funding we are fortunate enough to receive, and we’ll keep trucking until we get whatever else we need to successfully launch this first (of many) book(s). All perks will be delivered upon printing with a bonus perk if (for some reason) our goal isn’t met by the end of the time limit.

Production

Tragic Hero Comics and Iron Lion Studios are both hard at work getting the book finalized and print ready! So stay tuned for possible sneak peeks of the script or early art work!

YOUR IMPACT ON US

First, if we can get all the funding in time Tragic Hero Comics will be able to debut “AntiHero: 113/Prelude” At Big Wow Comic Fest 2014!

Second, if we get any additional funding, every penny of it will automatically be used to help us produce the next exciting chapter of “AntiHero: 113”!

Third, you all are helping everyone involved in this project get a little closer to realizing their dreams of working in comics… So for that we THANK YOU SO MUCH!

When Will The Prelude Be Ready?

The book will be ready as soon as we meet our goal, Those of you that donate will receive your perks/ Prelude copies first. For those who can’t donate but would like to buy a copy later, info for where and when we will be selling them will be available soon!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If you can’t help us financially, we totally understand! Here’s the good news, you can still help us get the word out about the prelude and our quest to get it funded! All you have to do is share our campaign with your friends and family!

FACEBOOK:

http://www.facebook.com/TragicHeroComics

TWITTER:

https://twitter.com/TragicHeroComix

story:
Short Summary

*日本語ページはこちら!(日本語ページからリターンへ直接ジャンプも可能になりました。）
http://bit.ly/1msfODG

I’m turning your moving moments into video.

I’ve succeeded in being the first to make the emotional power of Manga and turn it into a product:


The personalized, hand-drawn manga called “Para-Para Manga”

“Para-Para” manga is based on original Japanese animation techniques, using paper to, page by page, make the images come alive.



What makes Para-Para Manga different from regular anime or manga?


What was once a picture, Para-Para Manga becomes a movie, breathing life into the images, creating a warm, comfortable feeling.

The Para-Para Manga that Kando Studios offers is not limited to things like weddings; they work perfectly for promotional videos and have been used by major communication companies and others like Goldman Sachs Securities.


We’ve received positive comments and feedback from tourist and foreigners living in Japan.


"It’s a really good job and a really great idea for weddings. " 
"Even if I don’t understand all the Japanese characters, 
I was able to understand the story and impressed.” 
”This movie is different from any other way such as slideshow or letter. "


How We Create

1.Story Hearing


Para-Para Manga does what film cannot: express the thoughts and images in your mind to the world. But it first needs to be made concrete.

So, we’ll ask you what you want to use Para-Para manga for and have a short consultation.


2.Story Graph Creation

We’ll make a custom graph of your ideas, what you want to say, and the emotions you want to convey and create unique, one-of-a-kind scenario for you.


3.Story Board Creation


We’ll put each story into a story board.

In about one month a specialized Manga artist draw your 500 page Para-Para Manga


4.Image to Animation


We’ll turn your images into animation using carefully selected music.

What We Need

In order to bring Para-Para Manga to the world, we need to make the following things:

· An English Website

· An American Para-Para Manga promotion video


What You Get

An illustrated postcard $10USD

An illustrated postcard commemorating Para-Para Manga's world debut.


Your original postcard $20USD

An illustrated postcard of you, characterized as a manga character. 

The promotion video. $50USD

We’ll put your name in the credits of the promotion video.

appear in the promotion video. $100USD

You will appear in the promotion video. 

special Para-Para Manga. $200USD

We’ll give you a special Para-Para Manga present Or we’ll give you the story 

board made for the promotion video. 

Para-Para Manga just for you. $500USD

We’ll make a thank you Para-Para Manga just for you.

[Original Movie]

We will provide your original movie as bellow.


Para-Para Manga original. $1,000USD

We’ll make a 1-minute Para-Para Manga original on a story you choose

【Limited to five people】

Para-Para Manga original. $1,500USD

We’ll make a 2-minute Para-Para Manga original on a story you choos

【Limited to three people】 ※In order to make your story, we will conduct a

story hearing via Skype or email.


※Every Perk will be delivered digitally


■Creation Flow of Original Movie

①Contribution

②Story Hearing Scheduling and Story Hearing sheet submission (via Same Page ltd.).

③The hearing will consist of only one thirty-minute session (via Kando Studios and same Page ltd.).

④Story Board Creating

※40 second version only

⑤15 minute story board consultation (one time only via Kando Studios and Same Page ltd.).

⑥Manga Creation

⑦Movie Creation

⑧Delivery of Goods (45 days)



Risks and Challenges

Original movie creation time may be delayed due to high return levels.

story:
Brief Story

Just like most of you, I got tired of people hogging the machines/equipments at the gyms by sitting on their phones. I got tired of people working out their fingers and thumb instead of the rest of their body. Tired of people sitting and chatting by the gym equipment I want to use, but they're using it as a couch. Now join me and send a message with this "WorkOut or WalkOut" fun logo to not just these folks, but also to those who spend way more unnecessary time on the couch playing video games, 'facebooking', texting, and all that "finger/thumb training."
It's not smart to drive while "inTEXTicated" so why workout "inTEXTicated"? The phone can wait. We all know Time is Money. The time wasted by a lot of people on their phones at the gym and on the couch at home is more than enough for a quick workout to stay healthy for day to day activities.

Donation & Perks

When you choose a PERK, you will also receive FREE SHIPPING*. There's currently a limited amount of products listed on the perk section. Different Colors, Products, and Sizes will be available soon. Most of the products that you see in the photos and many more not shown in this campaign will soon be available on the official website with your support! With your support I'll be able to launch an official eCommerce online store at: www.workoutorwalkout.com and get this line of products into some local retail and gym stores. Let your voice be heard!!! Speak without "speaking".

* Please note that FREE SHIPPING is ONLY available for US Residents.

The Impact

People will have a good laugh when they see it and will remember, but at the same time it will create awareness and help people focus more on their health than their "fingers". A lot of people spend so much time on their phones these days doing basically nothing when less than half that time wasted can be spent doing a lot of productive things. Most importantly, you're helping to launch a small business that will be a stepping stone for so many other good things to come. Remember to set a goal to be physically healthy, which can also lead to emotional comfort. "Health is Wealth." If you need an excuse not to be healthy, you'll find one. New Year resolution is right around the corner; you better get started with this motivational logo.


Risks and  Challenges

In life generally, there are obstacles. You can either see obstacles as an opportunity to prove yourself stronger and better or you can simply sit back and use it as an excuse as to why you can't make things happen. Fighting through obstacles and disappointments is part of life for me and will always be. Staying down because of obstacles is simply not an option.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Can't contribute right now? Not able to make a purchase right now? There's always something you can do just with the click of your mouse or tap on your phone! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Tell your friends and family about "WorkOut or WalkOut" on Twitter, Facebook and any other social media platform that you use.

      Thank You for stopping by and showing your support.


      "WorkOut or WalkOut"

story:
Short Summary

Let's Ask Violet's star, Violet, doesn't know how to peel an orange.  Help her raise money so she can learn how to peel an orange!

What We Need & What You Get

Basically what we're looking for is people to donate to us to help with the upkeep of the webcomic.  We thought this would be a fun little way to help with that.
If we have $100 donated towards this, then there will be a comic depicting Violet finally and successfully peeling an orange!

If you donate $1, your name will be put on the site under the "Sponsored By" page.  If your name is already there, then you get a star put beside your name!
If you donate $5, you get an 50px by 50px avatar picture made by Let's Ask Violet's creator Sam Limberger!
If you donate $15, you get a commission made by Let's Ask Violet's creator Sam Limberger!
If you donate $50, you get a signed copy of the comic depicting Violet peeling the orange!

If our goal of $500 is met, anything extra gets donated towards the Canadian Center for Abuse Awareness. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just send this around to everyone you can think of!

story:
Thank you for viewing our Indiegogo page! Ben Shaw and Mike W Lunsford are the co-creators of Ethan Stone P.I. and are looking to debut the 2nd issue of their independent project. The 2nd issue also features a special guest inker for the cover: world renowned comic artist Josef Rubinstein! Both Ben and Mike love working on Ethan and would like your help in raising funds to print the 2nd issue and allow them to debut it at AwesomeCon in Wasington D.C.. Below is a brief description of Ethan Stone.

"Ethan Stone is no ordinary P.I.; he's a 'Paranormal Investigator.' As a former police officer, he brings a detective's mindset to his cases but also solves them with scientific weaponry and tools that he creates himself. His partner, Father Seth Murphy, is a priest with a unique connection to the Divine that allows him to create holy weapons and protective spells. The two are a formidable team in fighting the forces of evil. Their first case has them investigating a demonic possession of a wealthy woman's home; a simple case for them. But not all is as it seems as they try to find the reason why the demons chose this home...and as Seth and Ethan descend further into the bowels of the home, they come face to face with a monster that will take all of their cunning and abilities to defeat!"


Here is a preview of some of the finished pages!



Any contribution is appreciated and even if you can't help financially, give us a shout out on Facebook or Twitter!

story:
HIYA folks, my name is Chris (CEE) Raymond, freelance illustrator and outlaw cartoonist. What I got here, and what I need YOUR help with, is a potentially awesome comic series I've created called CRIME & SPACE that I'm looking to raise the startup cash to make happen. And man, have we got the PERKS for YOU! Our valued contributor! Original art, digital comics, prints plus SUPER PACKAGE where YOU the contributor get to guest star in an issue of CRIME & SPACE!

Art is Work

My goal with the Indiegogo is to raise enough money to produce three solid issues of the comic. I've set my goal at $3500 dollars which will go toward expenses and costs to pay for supplies and the good folks who are helping me put the books together.

EVERYONE gets a SHOUT-OUT!

That's right, if you donate just 5 dollars we'll give you a Shout-Out on the CRIME & SPACE Facebook page posted DAILY to show our appreciation! If you haven't liked the Crime & Space FB then you really should. It'll be where I keep people posted on the campaign and other goodies Click HERE to go like our page!

“I'm EARTHLING so adjust your translators accordingly. That's EARTH. Bad air,worse food and plenty of places to swim..and a thing we call ARMED ROBBERY..."

-ROY RIOT, Space Criminal  

HERE'S a link to the original pilot story FOOL'S BRIEFCASE. Go give it a read and come on back!

THE ORIGINAL STORY


YOU'RE BACK! Awesome! Did you dig it? Hope you did. The story originally ran in my DIY anthology OMINOUS SOFA. I set out to do a 13 page caper sci-fi story and what it grew into was a real chuckle and a genuine a love for space criminal ROY RIOT and his robot partner CRAIG. By the time the ink was drying on the last page I found myself just aching to write and draw more of their exploits and all the cool, crazy space stuff burned on my weird brain.

The Misadventure Continues

With Crime & Space I want to continue to tell the weird, gritty tale of ROY RIOT, a criminal operating in the depths of dirty space that's as quick with his gun as he is with his mouth. Armed only with his wit, a pair of Laser 45s and his automated partner CRAIG, he roams the galaxy in his souped-up saucer staying one step ahead of the law and armed and ready to pull off that one big score.

ROY is the anti-Buck Rogers


A hoodlum out of time from the Earth year 1956, Roy was found in stasis aboard an alien vessel with no clue of how he got there (a mystery that will be explored throughout the series.) With no money, no means of support and a life that has been dead for centuries, he soon realized he could be a vagrant adrift the cosmos or return to his criminal ways and seek out that final heist, where he can retire, escape to the depths of space and open his own bar complete with a bevy of beautiful alien women. But Roy and Craig don't have the best of luck and every job they pulls are always more trouble than they're worth.

C.R.A.I.G. The Robot Sidekick

Roy's right hand robot and only friend, stands for Complimentary Robot And Instructional Guide, which comes standard with the saucer ship Roy stole (his first criminal act upon returning to his old ways) Craig is programmed to mimic the personality of his owner upon activation so he makes the perfect partner in crime. But despite his programming, he still gets frustrated with Roy's brash, illogical shoot first methods and leads to a lot of fights and arguments. Their friendship is the core of the stories.   What I've done is taken all the genres I'm fond of, the 50s sci-fi serial, the Roger Corman b-movie, the loop reel Saturday morning cartoons and combined it with all the crime noir, Elmore Leonard slow boiling coolness burned on my brain. What I hope for is a bang bang shoot em up read that people will dig.


Something Extra

As a bonus for some of the pledge levels, you can also receive copies of my other short comic stories DUSTER and MEAT OF THE SOUL from my anthology OMINOUS SOFA!


They say a man is only as good as the people he works with and if so, then I am good to go. This is first of many pretty cool projects I have on the burners with a whole killer cadre of talented people, but CRIME & SPACE is where I want to begin. And hopefully you'll find my work enjoyable enough to help me make that happen for us. We got a lot of cool perks and material for contributors to sink their teeth into. So here's hoping you dig CRIME & SPACE as much I have, and will help us continue making it!  

Cee Raymond
 Somewhere in San Antonio.

story:
WHAT IS INK TALES?

INK TALES is a new, oversized Australian graphic anthology that is centered around the theme of tattoos.

The creators involved have really ran with the theme and come up with some pretty wonderful and bizarre content. From tattooed femme fatales to high-tech tattoo viruses. From alien prophecies to the 6 deadliest numbers in history, there’s something for everyone. 

So it doesn’t matter whether you love or hate tattoos, this graphic anthology will change the way you perceive one of the oldest art forms in human history.


*MY PLEDGE TO YOU*

If for some crazy reason, Ink Tales doesn't make the $4,000 goal by the 16th of November, I can guarantee that you will get what you paid for!

However it does mean that less books will be printed :(

So don't wait for it to hit the shelves because that might not happen. Buy it now and sleep easy my friends.


UPGRADES!

If you've already purchased an Ink Tales perk, there's still time to UPGRADE!!

All you have to do is contribute the difference and send me an email at dale.maccanti@hotmail.com


Now it's about time that we revealed the amazing INK TALES cover created by Jeffrey 'Chamba' Cruz.



Book Specs: 120 pages, large format (28.5 x 19.5cm), colour cover, b/w interior, soft cover tpb.

WHO’S INVOLVED IN INK TALES?

INK TALES collects the works of some very talented Australian writers and artists. Here they are in alphabetical order for your convenience (and so it doesn’t look like I'm playing favourites).

·      Black Betty

·      Ary Bizar

·      Steve Boyd 

·      Jeffrey ‘Chamba’ Cruz

·      Gee Hale

·      Billy Hysteria

·      Andrew Isaac

·      Lindy Lou

·      Dale Maccanti

·      Kate Moon

·      Bruce Mutard

·      Jason Paulos

·      Will Pleydon

·      Benjamin Plymin

·      Grange Wallis

·      Justin Woolley

SAMPLE PAGES

Tangible Evidence by Jason Paulos

Paladin by Will Pleydon

Chasing Dragons by Bruce Mutard

In God's Hands by Kate Moon

(I'll be posting more sample pages in the updates section)


THE REWARDS

We've got heaps of Indiegogo exclusive rewards to offer!

(Just shift your eyes to the right!)

ULTIMATE BUNDLE

If you purchase the Ultimate Bundle, keep in mind that you can swap the Editorial and/or T-shirt with one/two of the following: an additional copy of Ink Tales, another poster or a5 sketch.

PRINTS/POSTERS

You're not limited to the original 2 posters.

Now you can choose from the following prints below. (The Cover Poster is still available)

One Woman Army Print/Poster by Gee Hale

Steve Boyd Prints

Kate Moon Prints

ORIGINAL ART/PAGES by Will Pleydon. Available only in the Original Art Pack!

(Send me a message if you want to see closer photos to make your final choice). 


A5 ORIGINAL SKETCHES

The Ink Tales artists are slaving away creating amazing A5 sketches for YOU! Don't let their hard work be in vain... Because they will hurt me.

Kate Moon Sketch

Will Pleydon Sketch

BRUCE MUTARD PERKS

Aussie comic veteran Bruce Mutard has graciously let me add a few Mutard-related perks! From purchasing his books, original art and tutoring sessions!! Believe me, you don't want to miss these IndieGoGo exclusive perks

WHEN WILL INK TALES BE LAUNCHED?

INK TALES is scheduled to be launched in Melbourne sometime in late November or December 2013. As soon as the campaign finishes, your money will be used to pay the printers and get this ball rolling.

For those of you that can’t make it to the launch, your package will be sent in the mail soon after (hopefully in time for Christmas!).  


REVIEWS!!!

The reviews are already rolling in. Here are a few kind words from some very beautiful and sexy people!

"This collection features stories of horror, suspense, pain and regret, every one etched in blood and ink." – Emmet O’Cuana (The Momus Report)

Beardy and the Geek Review

"Does a great job of showcasing the diverse talent emerging from the Australian comics community." – Kane Melbourne (Non Canonical Comic Podcast)

"Ink Tales suggests that comics and tattoos are quite similar- scar tissue, artistically rendered in ink. It’s a sharp book. I want another tat now…" – Anthony N. Castle (Australian Comics Journal)

Australian Comics Journal Review

"War-ravaged alien worlds, supernatural thrillers, and personal, haunting tales are all linked by ink in these pages. Dale Maccanti brings together some of the finest established comic book creators in Australia, along with some exciting new talent, to tell stories of the present, the past and the future." - Tom Taylor (Injustice: Gods Among Us, The Deep, Batman LOTDK, Star Wars: Blood Ties).

Whatcha Podcast Feature Article

Brimbank & North West Weekly Newspaper Interview


SPREAD THE WORD!

The internet is a magical place and I’ll be posting, tweeting and tumbling all over the place about INK TALES and this campaign BUT we need your help in getting the word out there.

So please tell your friends, share on social networks, kidnap Rupert Murdoch, whatever it takes!

All updates, art previews and behind the scenes material can be found at our Facebook page:

If you’re a tweeter, then you can follow the action here:

And finally if you’re a tumbling Tumblr:

Now also on Imgur

Read it on Reddit

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
WHAT IS INK TALES? 
INK TALES is a new, oversized Australian graphic anthology that is centered around the theme of tattoos. 
The creators involved have really ran with the theme and come up with some pretty wonderful and bizarre content. From tattooed femme fatales to high-tech tattoo viruses. From alien prophecies to the 6 deadliest numbers in history, there’s something for everyone.  
So it doesn’t matter whether you love or hate tattoos, this graphic anthology will change the way you perceive one of the oldest art forms in human history.

*MY PLEDGE TO YOU*
If for some crazy reason, Ink Tales doesn't make the $4,000 goal by the 16th of November, I can guarantee that you will get what you paid for! 
However it does mean that less books will be printed :( 
So don't wait for it to hit the shelves because that might not happen. Buy it now and sleep easy my friends. 

UPGRADES!
If you've already purchased an Ink Tales perk, there's still time to UPGRADE!!
All you have to do is contribute the difference and send me an email at dale.maccanti@hotmail.com

Now it's about time that we revealed the amazing INK TALES cover created by Jeffrey 'Chamba' Cruz.




Book Specs: 120 pages, large format (28.5 x 19.5cm), colour cover, b/w interior, soft cover tpb.
WHO’S INVOLVED IN INK TALES?
INK TALES collects the works of some very talented Australian writers and artists. Here they are in alphabetical order for your convenience (and so it doesn’t look like I'm playing favourites).


·      Black Betty
·      Ary Bizar
·      Steve Boyd 
·      Jeffrey ‘Chamba’ Cruz 
·      Gee Hale 
·      Billy Hysteria
·      Andrew Isaac 
·      Lindy Lou
·      Dale Maccanti 
·      Kate Moon 
·      Bruce Mutard 
·      Jason Paulos 
·      Will Pleydon 
·      Benjamin Plymin 
·      Grange Wallis 
·      Justin Woolley 






SAMPLE PAGES
Tangible Evidence by Jason Paulos

Paladin by Will Pleydon

Chasing Dragons by Bruce Mutard
In God's Hands by Kate Moon
(I'll be posting more sample pages in the updates section)

THE REWARDS
We've got heaps of Indiegogo exclusive rewards to offer! 
(Just shift your eyes to the right!)
ULTIMATE BUNDLE
If you purchase the Ultimate Bundle, keep in mind that you can swap the Editorial and/or T-shirt with one/two of the following: an additional copy of Ink Tales, another poster or a5 sketch.
PRINTS/POSTERS
You're not limited to the original 2 posters. 
Now you can choose from the following prints below. (The Cover Poster is still available)
One Woman Army Print/Poster by Gee Hale

Steve Boyd Prints

Kate Moon Prints



ORIGINAL ART/PAGES by Will Pleydon. Available only in the Original Art Pack! 
(Send me a message if you want to see closer photos to make your final choice).  

A5 ORIGINAL SKETCHES
The Ink Tales artists are slaving away creating amazing A5 sketches for YOU! Don't let their hard work be in vain... Because they will hurt me. 
Kate Moon Sketch


Will Pleydon Sketch


BRUCE MUTARD PERKS
Aussie comic veteran Bruce Mutard has graciously let me add a few Mutard-related perks! From purchasing his books, original art and tutoring sessions!! Believe me, you don't want to miss these IndieGoGo exclusive perks

story:
Marco Turini Art Book

Marco Born in Italy, 1973

Live in Prague ( Czech Republic ) from 2010

Work in the past for Marvel, Top Cow, DC Comics, Heavy Metal magazine, Idw and many other publishers in the world.

At the moment Marco is Assassin's Creed and Deus Ex Artist for Titan Publishing, UbiSoft and Eidos.

The Book

Illustrations and other Extra Stuff ( sketches, Studios photos and much more ) in HD quality,  118 pages full color, 21x29,7 cm, Hardback.

GREAT NEWS! With all backers ( from 47 euro pack ) also 12 full color postcards ( women in Prague in Art Noveau Style )!

Also this A4 Poster in the Pack for all backers!!!!!!!!!





LIMITED EDITION 200 COPIES !!!!!!!

What you can see in the Book?

Over 60 unpublished (  the half of this also for the Internet !!! ) Illustrations, the preliminary sketches and the working phases ( sketches, work in Progress, work station photos and more ).

+ Exclusive Interview!


 Sketch SAMPLE.

www.marcoturiniart.com 

for more info about Marco.


Note: The book will print at the end of the Crowdfunding but i need more time for delivery for do all sketches. The maximun estimate delivery is January 2016. Thanks for understand :)


Shipping WorldWide without add cost!!!!!!!

story:
I was once told that if three people - three people who don't know each other - suggest that you do something, it's the universe telling you that you simply must do it. The Vicious Sisters Series is just that, the result of something I've been told to do over and over again.


I don't believe in a "normal" family. I believe every family has their own share of scandals, skeletons and secrets. I believe that the "normal" families in this world are the abnormal ones. Over the years, I've shared with my closest friends my family's most outrageous stories. After divulging a few tales, my audience always had two reactions. First, my friends would become the storytellers and would slowly start to share their own skeletons. Second, I was told, again and again, that I needed to write a book.

The Vicious Sisters Series is inspired by my own grandmother, her three sisters, and the skeletons and scandals in our family closet. I've taken my family fables, both the myths and the truths, sprinkled in abundant amounts of imagination, mixing reality with a whole lot of fiction, cooking up a little graphic universe where these stories reveal themselves.

Drafts have been written for all four volumes, drawings have been drawn, and by the time you read this, Volume 1, Episode 1 will be digitally prepared for e-publication and print. However, that only brings The Sisters partially to life. They need more "juice" to fully materialize. Like any mad scientist, I'm totally itching to bring The Vicious Sisters Series to fruition.

The final series will be composed of four volumes, one dedicated to each sister. Each volume will be further broken down into four shorter episodes. Each episode and the final volumes will be available as e-publications and limited edition printed books.

Oh, I'm not finished! Currently, each sister has their own Twitter account (which needs a more tending to, I admit); each can "write" their own blog posts on the The Vicious Sisters Series website; and they "share" a single Facebook page. Before, during and after the production of the e-publications and printed versions, I envision The Sisters living on through the magic of the internet and social media.

Furthermore, I can visualize Instagram accounts for each, where, in place of photographs would be drawings in the same style as the books, of their daily life: selfies, food porn, kittens, puppies and rainbows - from their distorted point of view of the world. I imagine Pinterest accounts with similarly styled drawn pins, of their plans, hopes, dreams and bucket lists, with a dark twist, of course.

Wait! There's one more! Envision a smartphone app having to do with twisted families - starring The Sisters, of course.

Your kind contributions will help to kick into gear all facets of The Vicious Sisters Series from the smallest details to the bigger productions: e-book publishing costs and fees; ISBNs for both the e-books and printed editions; printing and shipping costs for limited-edition printed publications; initial costs for website domain name, hosting & its webstore; costs for a proper website design; smartphone app design & implementation fees; promotional stickers; online marketing & advertising costs; and more paper, pencils and erasers.

Tchotckes in return for contributions include, but aren't excluded to, promotional stickers, free e-book publications, printed publications and signed, framed original drawings.

If you don't have cash, I also love to trade. If you can help with publicity, printing, publishing, website design, smartphone app design, or anything else, I would absolutely be delighted to work something out.

In my wildest imagination, I would love to see these sisters fully pervade both the world of print and online virtual spheres, but I'll take it one step at a time. Today Indiegogo, tomorrow the universe!

Full disclosure: Out of respect to, and in an effort to protect, the innocent, the guilty, and those in-between, all names have been changed. Of course, all contributors will receive my full contact details, but since real people and my family are involved, books will be printed under a ghost name.

story:
Avenger Red Ongoing Comic Project

We are all passionate about comics and storytelling. We are also committed and motivated to make our goals a reality. As for who we are, this can be seen in the second video below.

Our campaign is important to us because this is one of the steps to achieving our goals. Publication takes money, the work has already been done and more work is ongoing. We will publish and we need your help to reach a wider audience, more quickly.

I cannot express how useful a successful campaign would be for our goals. Your funds will ensure that our six issue story arc will get printed and reach the widest possible audience which, in turn, leads to more issues in the ever growing story of Avenger Red. But that is not all. During this time, while our comics get published, we will be using the issues we have and our own hard work in a direct effort to increase our visibility and draw more anxious readers into our story. The greater the success of this fundraiser, the more comics we can print for immediate distribution and the more events and comic shops we can attend to introduce our work.

We did our best to make the amount needed a reasonable goal. These funds alone will ensure the printing continues through the first story arc. A more successful goal will, of course, help us with more issues printed as well as enable us to do exciting promotional events.

We have already discussed stretch goals should we meet our goal before the deadline and look forward to implementing them as well as introducing more perks as needed.

Even if our goal is not met, the funds will ensure that you, and your pledge, will get your perks as well as print all that we can.

We have already had one successful project fundraiser (on the other sight) with all perks being awarded to those pledges and that project achieved a successful completion.

I believe in the story of Avenger Red on various levels and believe it has a place in the world of comics. The rest of my creative team: Free Isabelo and Daniel Blodgett also believe in its validity as a story and a product. We're not looking to change the world, but we are looking to entertain, excite and explore interesting themes and concepts through our story. And we want all of you to be a part of it!

story:
The Pride Adventures

The Pride, a six issue mini series by Joe Glass, Gavin Mitchell, Kris Carter and more is already funded and in production, but we realised that there is so much more to the world of The Pride and these characters than can be contained in one series.

The Pride Adventures continues to look at the world and role of LGBTQ superheroes, expanding their universe, letting us get to know the characters better and even introducing whole new characters to the universe.

But unlike some other companies, these stories are completely self-contained.

What is 'The Pride'?

The Pride is a six-issue mini-series written by Joe Glass, and with art by rising star Gavin MItchell, and Kris Carter. The series is currently published by Deadstar Publishing before returning to its self-publishing roots in 2013.

The Pride Adventures will expand the world and characters of the series, with a number of short, self-contained stories by a range of other artists.

Issue one features a six-page It Gets Better story with series artist Gavin Mitchell which hasn't seen print since the limited self-published Stiffs/The Pride ashcan in 2011; A Twink/White Trash short drawn by Samir Barrett; and finally a story introducing a brand new character and art by JD Smith, and thanks to the very gracious band The Irrepressibles including the lyrics of their fantastic single 'In This Shirt'. 

The Pride Adventures #1 is aiming for release later in the year, looking toward a November/December release.

Our Story

I'm Joe Glass, and I'm a gay man who loves comics. Luckily, I also happen to be a writer.

When I was growing up, and coming to terms with my sexuality, one of the things I always felt sad about was the fact there were no visible, openly gay superheroes I could relate to. Sure, there were one or two, but they lived in the background or were poorly reresented. Ever since then, I wanted to change that. And that's what The Pride is all about.

However, this is not a paying gig for me, it's literally a labour of love.

The production time for The Pride has proven a long process, and we've had a stumbling start which has left us in a position, for a number of reasons, where we will start afresh and relaunch the project in Late SPring/Summer 2013, with a regular release schedule and a host of amazing artists on board.

But there was so much more of the world I wanted to show; so much more for the characters to say and so many amazing artists wanting to contribute.

Thus The Pride Adventures was born!

The series will be a sister project to The Pride and will be released alongside the main series, expanding the world and characters and even introducing new ones, until a broad, inclusive and exciting new universe becomes available to our readers.

The Impact

The whole point of doing this project is to provide young LGBT comics readers with heroes they can look up to, and older ones with heroes they can relate to; it's to cover issues that straight readers may not be aware of, or may have disregarded as something which 'doesn't affect them' when they affect all of us; it can hopefully change some opinions and help push for an improvement in representation; and most of all, it will be fun!

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised by this project will be used to pay for printing this comic.

Furthermore, each donation can be used as a kind of 'pre-order' that we can show larger distributors like Diamond the kind of numbers we can achieve, so hopefully they will work with us to help distribute the comic as far and wide as possible. The other benefit of the project being on this site is that it's the best way to get your copy if you live in the United States or anywhere else outside of the UK. As yet, we are working on distribution deals in those territories, but we're not there yet. So your help will let us spread this message globally. Higher print runs and perorder numbers are of course also possible even if we don't hit the ultimate target, but the more we raise the better.

And also, due to the exchange rate, pre-ordering the comic in this way is a significant discount from retail price.

In fact, if we beat the target, then it just means we can print more, market more, and maybe even commission more artists to provide their help in the series. Anything to make this project as big and great as it can be! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help fund the series, you can help spread the word! There are links to the comics Facebook and twitter pages, and I'll keep this project updated on any and all news on the comic, so you can keep helping by passing that inf+o on to anyone you know and encouraging them to help us. Thank You!

story:
The Legend of El Lobo! The Creators:

Hi. This is Bruce Logan, Award-winning Director, and Cinematographer whose work includes 2001: A Space Odyssey, Star Wars, Star Trek: The Motion Picture, and Tron, and Richard Soto, Actor/Teacher/Storyteller, who inspires kids through Arts and Education. We are the creators of The Legend of El Lobo!

The Legend of El Lobo! The Story:

A young Latino comic book artist draws a ferocious shape-shifting Aztec“superhero” for the kids of the barrio.  The superhero metes out bloody justice on the neighborhood street gangs. The young artist is shocked to discover that his superhero has become a reality, and that the comic book mirrors events in the real world.  He finally realizes that, when called upon by the collective emotions of the barrio, he “becomes” the mythic beast he has created. Although his motive to save the barrio kids from becoming gang members is good, he is horrified by the violence he is capable of.  He realizes that the savage nature of the beast is a manifestation of the rage in his own heart. Can he control his rage, defeat the gangs, and save the kids of the barrio?

The Legend of El Lobo! The Comic Book:

We are publishing a comic book about our Aztec hero...  And we need your help.

We want to raise $9000 for the artwork and publishing. For your help we are offering, the comic book, signed artwork, posters T-shirts, even three comic book cameos. Your contribution will help us pay our artist, Albert Morales, and cover printing costs and further, it will help us build the fan base for our upcoming feature film!

Thank you and “Viva El Lobo!”

Artist Albert Morales!
story_txt:
The Legend of El Lobo! The Creators:

Hi. This is Bruce Logan, Award-winning Director, and Cinematographer whose work includes 2001: A Space Odyssey, Star Wars, Star Trek: The Motion Picture, and Tron, and Richard Soto, Actor/Teacher/Storyteller, who inspires kids through Arts and Education. We are the creators of The Legend of El Lobo!
The Legend of El Lobo! The Story:

A young Latino comic book artist draws a ferocious shape-shifting Aztec“superhero” for the kids of the barrio.  The superhero metes out bloody justice on the neighborhood street gangs. The young artist is shocked to discover that his superhero has become a reality, and that the comic book mirrors events in the real world.  He finally realizes that, when called upon by the collective emotions of the barrio, he “becomes” the mythic beast he has created. Although his motive to save the barrio kids from becoming gang members is good, he is horrified by the violence he is capable of.  He realizes that the savage nature of the beast is a manifestation of the rage in his own heart. Can he control his rage, defeat the gangs, and save the kids of the barrio?
The Legend of El Lobo! The Comic Book:

We are publishing a comic book about our Aztec hero...  And we need your help.
We want to raise $9000 for the artwork and publishing. For your help we are offering, the comic book, signed artwork, posters T-shirts, even three comic book cameos. Your contribution will help us pay our artist, Albert Morales, and cover printing costs and further, it will help us build the fan base for our upcoming feature film!
Thank you and “Viva El Lobo!”
Artist Albert Morales!

story:
Edgar is second guessing his lifestyle and the choices he has made. He wants change, only problem with change, it's attached to deadly consequences. 

The Last Good-Bye is a 33 page one shot crime, noir, redemption story that offers it's backers multiple perks to chose from.

Exclusive Variant Cover (Mark Savona)

We hope to gain your trust and support as we build a comic book publishing company that is focused on providing entertainment.

story:
About the Artist

My name is Astrid Lydia Johannsen and I've wanted to draw comics since I was old enough to take a purple marker to my mother's rocking chair. When I'm is not drawing comics, I can be found either riding my bicycle or practicing belly dance.

About the Comic

Absolutely True Tales of Lesbian Drama is a queer urban fantasy in an alternate history. Set in the Silk Road city of Isifni, it's the story of four flatmates who wind up finding themselves out of their element. The comic has been ongoing since 2 January 2010, updating more-or-less weekly. It can be found online at lesbiandrama.com.

About the Campaign

I'm seeking to publish volume one of my webcomic, collecting 91 comics into a paperback tome. This book will also include director's commentary, art and sketches, and rare related works which are no longer available online. I'm striving to get this book printed in time for the Alternative Press Expo in October 2012. If my fundraising campaign succeeds, the money that I raise here will go to print a small run of 100 copies, one of which could end up in your very hands. Any more money that I receive will go to print additional copies of the book which I will have available to purchase both at APE and online at my comic site.

Ways You Can Help

Contribute money if you are able. I've set up pledge perks at various increments so that you not only get the pleasure of knowing you've supported the arts, but you get some art to show for it. If you can't pledge, there are other things you can do to support my endeavor. Read my comic! Draw me some fan art! Tell your friends about my comic and fundraising campaign! My comic is nothing without my readers, so I am asking you, my readers, to help me bring my comic to you in print.

Thank you so much!

story:
Overview:

SeaDog and Codename: Killswitch is a 48 page graphic novel! 

Mark Poulton (writer/co-creator of GRAVEYARD SHIFT, GRAVEYARD SHIFT II, and USASSASSIN) teams up with his son, Chase Poulton, co-writer of the award winning graphic novel PIZZA TREE, artist Clint Hilinski (JUSTICE LEAGUE, YOUNGBLOOD) and colorist Andrew Dalhouse (BLOODSHOT, TEEN TITANS, USASSASSIN) for the first exciting chapter in the tale of the world's greatest hero, who also happens to be man's best friend... SeaDog! When super human trackers led by the mysterious villain, Shikari, abduct an unregistered meta, the government strikeforce known as CODENAME: KILLSWITCH try to enlist the aid of the world's greatest hero, SEADOG.  

 

 

 

SOLDIER SEVEN SKETCH VIDEO

GRAVEYARD SHIFT vs. SEA DOG and Codename: KILLSWITCH (final art will be in color)

JON MALIN VARIANT COVER UNLEASHED!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Hello fellow Comicbook readers my name is Christopher Windfield and I am a artist and film maker and if you love comics that are thought provoking with a lot of action then this comic is the for you. This comic is dedicated to my cousin who actually came up with the idea years ago about a group of bad ass kids called Killers In Disguise. I took the idea and expanded on it with a deep storyline that I wrote years ago. My cousin passed away some years ago and I am doing this in lieu of his memory so completing this book is an essential goal that I must achieve. Im just looking to tell this wonderful story which I can not compare to any other storyline.

Contributions to this project will help fund my colorist Santosh Kumar Rath (BEEZZZ STUDIO) who has colored many exceptional works. His work can be viewed here!

Majority of the funds will go towards the coloring process which will be 100 pages of awesomness and a small press run (print on demand) books. The entire digital copy will go up for sale once the coloring process is complete along with any perks.

Written By: Chris Windfield

Pencil/Ink and Cover By: Chris Windfield

Colors By: BEEZZZ STUDIO (Santosh Kumar Rath)

Lettering By: Chris Windfield

Edited By: Malcolm Marrow

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I could of released this book as a Black & White version (which will be one of the perks) but I really wanted my story to be told in color. This book is an ongoing anthology that will be released at 100 pages. This way I can focus more on creating the artwork, lettering and the storyline while my colorist works on the pages. I am 70% done with the book with only 30 more pages to go. This novel is for Mature Audiences ONLY!

I HAVE SOME KILLER PERKS!!!

Everyone will receive a perk! Things such as a digital download of the 1st Arc around 26 pages, artwork and printed copies fully colored!

KILLER BEHIND THE SCENES SKECTHBOOK!

Donate more and receive things like a Behind the scenes digital and physical Sketchbook with detailed character drawings and panel layouts and concept drawings etc.

 

Colored Pages By

 

Artwork

 

Variant Cover

If my goal isnt reached the funds will offset compensation to Santosh Kumar Rath for his amazing coloring job. I have to be able to pay him too for his hard work! 

With your support, this will be the starting point for what will be a continuing series of Killers In Disguise!

I initially need $2,000 to commit the time needed to draw the planned minimum 48 pages of content and cover. This will also allow me to print the comics, stickers, and prints to fulfill the orders. This will be a limited print run of 50 copies of this book! The book will also be sold via Amazon Print On Demand! I just need your help to fully color this amazing story!

If more than 2k is raised then I will be able to do a bigger print run with variant covers.

Projected completion date would be February 2020. That allows me the time needed to make the pages as great as I can make them in order for you to have a more killer comic!

I have several perk tiers lined up, so check those out and choose what's right for you. We'll be adding more as we go along. Also, spread the word! Killers In Disguise!

If my initial goal of $2,000 isn't met, it would definitely prolong the projected/planned release and ship date. The more I raise essentially allows me the time I need to produce the art! If I don't reach goal I'd still print the exact amount of copies to fulfill orders, which is why my goal is so important!

If you can not contribute please find it in your heart to share using the IndieGOGO Share links.
